content_old: 21 And so it was when the cloud would be from evening until morning as soon as the cloud went up in the morning so soon did they set forward: whether by day or by night as soon as the cloud went up so soon did they set forward.

content: 22 Whether for two days､ or a month､ or a year､ the cloud lengthened out its stay upon the habitation､ abiding thereupon the sons of Israel remained encamped､ and set not forward,—but at the upgoings thereof they set forward.
content_old: 22 Whether for two days､ or a month､ or a year､ the cloud lengthened out its stay upon the habitation､ abiding thereupon the sons of Israel remained encamped､ and set not forward,—but at the upgoings thereof they set forward.

content: 1 And Yahweh spake unto Moses､ saying:
content_old: 1 And Yahweh spake unto Moses､ saying:

content: 2 Make thee two trumpets of silver, of beaten work shalt thou make them,—and they shall be unto thee for calling the assembly, and for setting forward the camps.
content_old: 2 Make thee two trumpets of silver, of beaten work shalt thou make them,—and they shall be unto thee for calling the assembly, and for setting forward the camps.

content: 3 As soon as they blow therewith so soon shall all the assembly assemble themselves unto thee, unto the entrance of the tent of meeting.
content_old: 3 As soon as they blow therewith so soon shall all the assembly assemble themselves unto thee, unto the entrance of the tent of meeting.

content: 4 And if only once they blow then shall the princes, the heads of the thousands of Israel, gather themselves unto thee.
content_old: 4 And if only once they blow then shall the princes, the heads of the thousands of Israel, gather themselves unto thee.

content: 5 But when ye blow an alarm then shall set forward the camps that are encamped eastwards;
content_old: 5 But when ye blow an alarm then shall set forward the camps that are encamped eastwards;

content: 6 and when ye blow a second alarm then shall set forward the camps that are encamped southwards,—an alarm shall they blow､ for setting them forward.
content_old: 6 and when ye blow a second alarm then shall set forward the camps that are encamped southwards,—an alarm shall they blow､ for setting them forward.

content: 7 But in calling together the convocation ye shall blow､ but shall not sound an alarm.
content_old: 7 But in calling together the convocation ye shall blow､ but shall not sound an alarm.

content: 8 And the sons of Aaron the priests shall blow with the trumpets,—and it shall be unto you for a statute age-abiding､ unto your generations.
content_old: 8 And the sons of Aaron the priests shall blow with the trumpets,—and it shall be unto you for a statute age-abiding､ unto your generations.

content: 9 And when ye go into war in your land､ against the assailant that assaileth you, then shall ye blow an alarm with the trumpets,—and bring yourselves to mind before Yahweh your God, and be saved､ from your enemies.
content_old: 9 And when ye go into war in your land､ against the assailant that assaileth you, then shall ye blow an alarm with the trumpets,—and bring yourselves to mind before Yahweh your God, and be saved､ from your enemies.

content: 10 And in your day of rejoicing and in your appointed seasons､ and in the beginnings of your months then shall ye blow with the trumpets､ over your ascending-sacrifices, and over your peace-offerings,—so shall they be unto you for a memorial before your God. I—Yahweh am your God.
content_old: 10 And in your day of rejoicing and in your appointed seasons､ and in the beginnings of your months then shall ye blow with the trumpets､ over your ascending-sacrifices, and over your peace-offerings,—so shall they be unto you for a memorial before your God. I—Yahweh am your God.

content: 11 And so it came to pass in the second year､ in the second month､ on the twentieth of the month that the cloud lifted itself up, from off the habitation of the testimony;
content_old: 11 And so it came to pass in the second year､ in the second month､ on the twentieth of the month that the cloud lifted itself up, from off the habitation of the testimony;

content: 12 and the sons of Israel set forward､ by their removals､ from the desert of Sinai,—and then the cloud abode in the desert of Paran.
content_old: 12 and the sons of Israel set forward､ by their removals､ from the desert of Sinai,—and then the cloud abode in the desert of Paran.

content: 13 Thus then did they set forward､ for the first time,—at the bidding of Yahweh､ by the hand of Moses.
content_old: 13 Thus then did they set forward､ for the first time,—at the bidding of Yahweh､ by the hand of Moses.

content: 14 So the standard of the camp of the sons of Judah set forward first､ by their hosts, and over his own host was Nahshôn､ son of Amminadab;
content_old: 14 So the standard of the camp of the sons of Judah set forward first､ by their hosts, and over his own host was Nahshôn､ son of Amminadab;

content: 15 and over the host of the tribe of the sons of Issachar Nethanêl､ son of Zuar;
content_old: 15 and over the host of the tribe of the sons of Issachar Nethanêl､ son of Zuar;

content: 16 and over the host of the tribe of the sons of Zebulun Eliab､ son of Hêlôn.
content_old: 16 and over the host of the tribe of the sons of Zebulun Eliab､ son of Hêlôn.

content: 17 Then was taken down the habitation,—and the sons of Gershon and the sons of Merari set forward､ bearing the habitation.
content_old: 17 Then was taken down the habitation,—and the sons of Gershon and the sons of Merari set forward､ bearing the habitation.

content: 18 Then set forward the standard of the camp of Reuben､ by their hosts,—and over his own host Elizur､ son of Shedeûr;
content_old: 18 Then set forward the standard of the camp of Reuben､ by their hosts,—and over his own host Elizur､ son of Shedeûr;

content: 19 and over the host of the tribe of the sons of Simeon Shelumiel､ son of Zurishaddai;
content_old: 19 and over the host of the tribe of the sons of Simeon Shelumiel､ son of Zurishaddai;

content: 20 and over the host of the tribe of the sons of Gad Eliasaph､ son of Deuel.
content_old: 20 and over the host of the tribe of the sons of Gad Eliasaph､ son of Deuel.

content: 21 Then set forward the Kohathites, bearing the sanctuary,—and so the habitation was reared by the time they came in.
content_old: 21 Then set forward the Kohathites, bearing the sanctuary,—and so the habitation was reared by the time they came in.

content: 22 Then set forward the standard of the camp of the sons of Ephraim､ by their hosts,—and over his own host was Elishama､ son of Ammihud;
content_old: 22 Then set forward the standard of the camp of the sons of Ephraim､ by their hosts,—and over his own host was Elishama､ son of Ammihud;

content: 23 and over the host of the tribe of the sons of Manasseh Gamaliel､ son of Pedahzur;
content_old: 23 and over the host of the tribe of the sons of Manasseh Gamaliel､ son of Pedahzur;

content: 24 and over the host of the tribe of the sons of Benjamin Abidan､ son of Gideoni.
content_old: 24 and over the host of the tribe of the sons of Benjamin Abidan､ son of Gideoni.

content: 25 Then set forward the standard of the camp of the sons of Dan, bringing up the rear of all the camps, by their hosts,—and over his own host Ahiezur､ son of Ammishaddai;
content_old: 25 Then set forward the standard of the camp of the sons of Dan, bringing up the rear of all the camps, by their hosts,—and over his own host Ahiezur､ son of Ammishaddai;

content: 26 and over the host of the tribe of the sons of Asher Pagiel､ son of Ochrân;
content_old: 26 and over the host of the tribe of the sons of Asher Pagiel､ son of Ochrân;

content: 27 and over the host of the tribe of the sons of Naphtali Ahira､ son of Enân.
content_old: 27 and over the host of the tribe of the sons of Naphtali Ahira､ son of Enân.

content: 28 These were the settings-forward of the sons of Israel､ by their hosts,—thus did they set forward.
content_old: 28 These were the settings-forward of the sons of Israel､ by their hosts,—thus did they set forward.

content: 29 Then said Moses to Hobab､ son of Raguel the Midianite､ father-in-law of Moses: Setting forward are we unto the place of which Yahweh hath said, The same will I give unto you,— Oh come with us､ and we will do thee good, for Yahweh hath spoken good､ concerning Israel.
content_old: 29 Then said Moses to Hobab､ son of Raguel the Midianite､ father-in-law of Moses: Setting forward are we unto the place of which Yahweh hath said, The same will I give unto you,— Oh come with us､ and we will do thee good, for Yahweh hath spoken good､ concerning Israel.

content: 30 And he said unto him､ I will not go,—but unto my own land､ and unto my own kindred will I go.
content_old: 30 And he said unto him､ I will not go,—but unto my own land､ and unto my own kindred will I go.

content: 31 Then said he: I beseech thee､ do not forsake us,—for on this account hast thou come to know of our encamping in the desert, so shalt thou be unto us as eyes;
content_old: 31 Then said he: I beseech thee､ do not forsake us,—for on this account hast thou come to know of our encamping in the desert, so shalt thou be unto us as eyes;

content: 32 and it shall be if thou wilt go with us,—yea it shall be that with the very good wherewith Yahweh shall do us good will we do good unto thee.
content_old: 32 and it shall be if thou wilt go with us,—yea it shall be that with the very good wherewith Yahweh shall do us good will we do good unto thee.

content: 33 So then they went forward､ from the mountain of Yahweh, a journey of three days,—and the ark of the covenant of Yahweh was going before them､ a journey of three days, to search out for them a resting-place.
content_old: 33 So then they went forward､ from the mountain of Yahweh, a journey of three days,—and the ark of the covenant of Yahweh was going before them､ a journey of three days, to search out for them a resting-place.

content: 34 And the cloud of Yahweh was over them by day,—when they set forward out of the camp.
content_old: 34 And the cloud of Yahweh was over them by day,—when they set forward out of the camp.

content: 35 And it came to pass when the ark set forward that Moses said: Arise､ O Yahweh! and scattered be thy foes, Let them that hate thee flee before thee;
content_old: 35 And it came to pass when the ark set forward that Moses said: Arise､ O Yahweh! and scattered be thy foes, Let them that hate thee flee before thee;

content: 1 And it came to pass､ that when the people were giving themselves up to murmuring it was grievous in the ears of Yahweh,—so Yahweh hearkened､ and kindled was his anger, and the fire of Yahweh burned among them, and consumed the uttermost part of the camp.
content_old: 1 And it came to pass､ that when the people were giving themselves up to murmuring it was grievous in the ears of Yahweh,—so Yahweh hearkened､ and kindled was his anger, and the fire of Yahweh burned among them, and consumed the uttermost part of the camp.

content: 2 Then did the people make outcry unto Moses,—and Moses prayed unto Yahweh, and the fire sank down.
content_old: 2 Then did the people make outcry unto Moses,—and Moses prayed unto Yahweh, and the fire sank down.

content: 3 So he called the name of that place､ Taberah i.e. “A Burning”,—because there burned among them the fire of Yahweh.
content_old: 3 So he called the name of that place､ Taberah i.e. “A Burning”,—because there burned among them the fire of Yahweh.

content: 4 Moreover the mixed multitude that was in their midst concealed not their lusting,—and so even the sons of Israel fell away and wept, and said: Who will grant us to eat flesh?
content_old: 4 Moreover the mixed multitude that was in their midst concealed not their lusting,—and so even the sons of Israel fell away and wept, and said: Who will grant us to eat flesh?

content: 5 We remember the fish that we did eat in Egypt､ without money,—the cucumbers､ and the water-melons, and the leeks and the onions､ and the garlick.
content_old: 5 We remember the fish that we did eat in Egypt､ without money,—the cucumbers､ and the water-melons, and the leeks and the onions､ and the garlick.

content: 6 But now our soul is dried up､ there is nothing at all,—unless unto the manna we turn our eyes.
content_old: 6 But now our soul is dried up､ there is nothing at all,—unless unto the manna we turn our eyes.

content: 7 Now the manna was like coriander seed, and the appearance thereof like the appearance of bdellium.
content_old: 7 Now the manna was like coriander seed, and the appearance thereof like the appearance of bdellium.

content: 8 The people used to go about and pick it up､ and grind it with a pair of millstones､ or pound it in a mortar, and boil it in a pot, and make it into round cakes,—then was the taste thereof like the taste of a sweet cake made with oil.
content_old: 8 The people used to go about and pick it up､ and grind it with a pair of millstones､ or pound it in a mortar, and boil it in a pot, and make it into round cakes,—then was the taste thereof like the taste of a sweet cake made with oil.

content: 9 When the dew came down upon the camp by night the manna came down thereupon.
content_old: 9 When the dew came down upon the camp by night the manna came down thereupon.

content: 10 So then Moses heard the people weeping by their families, every one at the entrance of his tent,—then kindled the anger of Yahweh fiercely, and in the eyes of Moses it was grievous.
content_old: 10 So then Moses heard the people weeping by their families, every one at the entrance of his tent,—then kindled the anger of Yahweh fiercely, and in the eyes of Moses it was grievous.

content: 11 And Moses said unto Yahweh— Wherefore hast thou let thy servant come to grief, and wherefore have I not found favour in thine eyes,—that thou shouldest lay the burden of all this people upon me?
content_old: 11 And Moses said unto Yahweh— Wherefore hast thou let thy servant come to grief, and wherefore have I not found favour in thine eyes,—that thou shouldest lay the burden of all this people upon me?

content: 12 Did I conceive all this people, or I beget them,—that thou shouldest say unto me, Carry them in thy bosom, as a nursing father carrieth a suckling, unto the soil which thou didst swear unto their fathers?
content_old: 12 Did I conceive all this people, or I beget them,—that thou shouldest say unto me, Carry them in thy bosom, as a nursing father carrieth a suckling, unto the soil which thou didst swear unto their fathers?

content: 13 Whence should I have flesh to give to all this people,—for they keep weeping by me､ saying, Oh give us flesh､ that we may eat!
content_old: 13 Whence should I have flesh to give to all this people,—for they keep weeping by me､ saying, Oh give us flesh､ that we may eat!

content: 14 Unable am I､ by myself to carry all this people,—for they are too heavy for me.
content_old: 14 Unable am I､ by myself to carry all this people,—for they are too heavy for me.

content: 15 But if in this way thou art going to deal with me slay me､ I beseech thee､slay､ if I have found favour in thine eyes,—and let me not see my grief.
content_old: 15 But if in this way thou art going to deal with me slay me､ I beseech thee､slay､ if I have found favour in thine eyes,—and let me not see my grief.

content: 16 Then said Yahweh unto Moses— Gather thou unto me seventy men､ from among the elders of Israel, of whom thou knowest that they are elders of the people､ and their overseers,—then shalt thou take them unto the tent of meeting, and they shall station themselves there､ with thee.
content_old: 16 Then said Yahweh unto Moses— Gather thou unto me seventy men､ from among the elders of Israel, of whom thou knowest that they are elders of the people､ and their overseers,—then shalt thou take them unto the tent of meeting, and they shall station themselves there､ with thee.

content: 17 Then will I come down､ and speak with thee there, and will take of the spirit that is upon thee､ and put upon them,—and they shall carry､ with thee､ the burden of the people, and thou shalt not carry it by thyself.
content_old: 17 Then will I come down､ and speak with thee there, and will take of the spirit that is upon thee､ and put upon them,—and they shall carry､ with thee､ the burden of the people, and thou shalt not carry it by thyself.

content: 18 And unto the people shalt thou say: Hallow yourselves by to-morrow､ and ye shall eat flesh, for ye have wept in the ears of Yahweh､ saying— Who will grant us to eat flesh? for it was well with us in Egypt,— so then Yahweh will give you flesh､ and ye shall eat.
content_old: 18 And unto the people shalt thou say: Hallow yourselves by to-morrow､ and ye shall eat flesh, for ye have wept in the ears of Yahweh､ saying— Who will grant us to eat flesh? for it was well with us in Egypt,— so then Yahweh will give you flesh､ and ye shall eat.

content: 19 Not one day shall ye eat､ nor two days,—nor five days､ nor ten days, nor twenty days:
content_old: 19 Not one day shall ye eat､ nor two days,—nor five days､ nor ten days, nor twenty days:

content: 20 for a month of days､ until it cometh forth out of your nostrils, so shall it become to you a loathsome thing,—because ye have refused Yahweh who is in your midst, and have wept before him, saying, Wherefore､ now､ came we forth out of Egypt?
content_old: 20 for a month of days､ until it cometh forth out of your nostrils, so shall it become to you a loathsome thing,—because ye have refused Yahweh who is in your midst, and have wept before him, saying, Wherefore､ now､ came we forth out of Egypt?

content: 21 And Moses said, Six hundred thousand footmen are the people in whose midst am I: yet thou hast said— Flesh will I give unto them, and they shall eat for a month of days.
content_old: 21 And Moses said, Six hundred thousand footmen are the people in whose midst am I: yet thou hast said— Flesh will I give unto them, and they shall eat for a month of days.

content: 22 Shall the flocks and herds be slaughtered for them､ that it may suffice for them? Shall all the fishes of the sea be gathered together unto them､ that it may suffice for them?
content_old: 22 Shall the flocks and herds be slaughtered for them､ that it may suffice for them? Shall all the fishes of the sea be gathered together unto them､ that it may suffice for them?

content: 23 Then said Yahweh unto Moses, Shall the hand of Yahweh fail? Now shalt thou see whether my word come to pass unto thee､ or not.
content_old: 23 Then said Yahweh unto Moses, Shall the hand of Yahweh fail? Now shalt thou see whether my word come to pass unto thee､ or not.

content: 24 And Moses went forth､ and spake unto the people the words of Yahweh,—and gathered together seventy men from among the elders of the people, and caused them to stand､ round about the tent.
content_old: 24 And Moses went forth､ and spake unto the people the words of Yahweh,—and gathered together seventy men from among the elders of the people, and caused them to stand､ round about the tent.

content: 25 Then Yahweh came down in the cloud､ and spake unto him, and took of the spirit that was upon him, and gave unto the seventy men—the elders. And it came to pass､ that when the spirit rested upon them they prophesied､ and then did so no more.
content_old: 25 Then Yahweh came down in the cloud､ and spake unto him, and took of the spirit that was upon him, and gave unto the seventy men—the elders. And it came to pass､ that when the spirit rested upon them they prophesied､ and then did so no more.

content: 26 Now there were two men left behind in the camp—the name of the one was Eldad､ and the name of the other Medad､ so then the spirit rested on them—they being among them who were written, though they had not gone forth unto the tent,—but they prophesied in the camp.
content_old: 26 Now there were two men left behind in the camp—the name of the one was Eldad､ and the name of the other Medad､ so then the spirit rested on them—they being among them who were written, though they had not gone forth unto the tent,—but they prophesied in the camp.

content: 27 And there ran a young man, and told Moses､ and said,— Eldad and Medad are prophesying in the camp!
content_old: 27 And there ran a young man, and told Moses､ and said,— Eldad and Medad are prophesying in the camp!

content: 28 Then responded Joshua､ son of Nun､ the attendant of Moses from his youth､ and said,— My lord Moses､ forbid them!
content_old: 28 Then responded Joshua､ son of Nun､ the attendant of Moses from his youth､ and said,— My lord Moses､ forbid them!

content: 29 But Moses said unto him, Art thou jealous for me? Oh would that all the people of Yahweh were prophets! Yea､ let Yahweh put his spirit upon them!
content_old: 29 But Moses said unto him, Art thou jealous for me? Oh would that all the people of Yahweh were prophets! Yea､ let Yahweh put his spirit upon them!

content: 30 Then was Moses received back into the camp,—he､ and the elders of Israel.
content_old: 30 Then was Moses received back into the camp,—he､ and the elders of Israel.

content: 31 Now a wind had sprung up from Yahweh､ and cut off quails from the sea, and let them lie over the camp—as it were a day’s journey here､ and a day’s journey there, round about the camp,—and as it were two cubits､ on the face of the land.
content_old: 31 Now a wind had sprung up from Yahweh､ and cut off quails from the sea, and let them lie over the camp—as it were a day’s journey here､ and a day’s journey there, round about the camp,—and as it were two cubits､ on the face of the land.

content: 32 And the people rose up all that day and all the night and all the next day､ and gathered the quails, he that did least gathered ten homers,—and they spread them out for themselves､ spreading away, round about the camp.
content_old: 32 And the people rose up all that day and all the night and all the next day､ and gathered the quails, he that did least gathered ten homers,—and they spread them out for themselves､ spreading away, round about the camp.

content: 33 The flesh was yet between their teeth, not yet chewed.—when the anger of Yahweh had kindled upon the people, and Yahweh smote the people, with an exceeding great plague.
content_old: 33 The flesh was yet between their teeth, not yet chewed.—when the anger of Yahweh had kindled upon the people, and Yahweh smote the people, with an exceeding great plague.

content: 34 And the name of that place was called､ Kibroth-hattaavah,—because there they buried the people who had lusted.
content_old: 34 And the name of that place was called､ Kibroth-hattaavah,—because there they buried the people who had lusted.

content: 1 And Miriam and Aaron spake against Moses, on account of the Cushite woman whom he had taken,—for a Cushite woman had he taken.
content_old: 1 And Miriam and Aaron spake against Moses, on account of the Cushite woman whom he had taken,—for a Cushite woman had he taken.

content: 2 And they said: Is it only and solely with Moses that Yahweh hath spoken? With us also hath he not spoken? And Yahweh heard it.
content_old: 2 And they said: Is it only and solely with Moses that Yahweh hath spoken? With us also hath he not spoken? And Yahweh heard it.

content: 3 Now the man Moses was patient exceedingly,—above all the sons of earth, who were on the face of the ground.
content_old: 3 Now the man Moses was patient exceedingly,—above all the sons of earth, who were on the face of the ground.

content: 4 Then said Yahweh､ suddenly､ unto Moses､ and unto Aaron､ and unto Miriam, Come out､ ye three､ unto the tent of meeting. And they three went out.
content_old: 4 Then said Yahweh､ suddenly､ unto Moses､ and unto Aaron､ and unto Miriam, Come out､ ye three､ unto the tent of meeting. And they three went out.

content: 5 Then Yahweh came down､ in a pillar of cloud, and stood at the entrance of the tent,—and called Aaron and Miriam, and they both went forth.
content_old: 5 Then Yahweh came down､ in a pillar of cloud, and stood at the entrance of the tent,—and called Aaron and Miriam, and they both went forth.

content: 6 Then said he､ Hear､ I beseech you､ my words. When ye have your prophet As Yahweh､ in a vision will I make myself known unto him; In a dream will I speak with him.
content_old: 6 Then said he､ Hear､ I beseech you､ my words. When ye have your prophet As Yahweh､ in a vision will I make myself known unto him; In a dream will I speak with him.

content: 7 Not so my servant Moses,— In all my house trusty is he:
content_old: 7 Not so my servant Moses,— In all my house trusty is he:

content: 8 Mouth to mouth do I speak with him､ And plainly—not in dark sayings, And the form of Yahweh doth he discern,— Wherefore､ then､ were ye not afraid to speak against my servant—against Moses?
content_old: 8 Mouth to mouth do I speak with him､ And plainly—not in dark sayings, And the form of Yahweh doth he discern,— Wherefore､ then､ were ye not afraid to speak against my servant—against Moses?

content: 9 And the anger of Yahweh kindled upon them､ and he departed.
content_old: 9 And the anger of Yahweh kindled upon them､ and he departed.

content: 10 And when the cloud removed from off the tent—lo! Miriam leprous､ like snow! And Aaron turned unto Miriam､ and lo! … leprous!
content_old: 10 And when the cloud removed from off the tent—lo! Miriam leprous､ like snow! And Aaron turned unto Miriam､ and lo! … leprous!

content: 11 Then said Aaron unto Moses,— Oh my lord, do not､ I beseech thee､ lay upon us sin, although we have made ourselves foolish､ and although we have sinned.
content_old: 11 Then said Aaron unto Moses,— Oh my lord, do not､ I beseech thee､ lay upon us sin, although we have made ourselves foolish､ and although we have sinned.

content: 12 Let her not､ I beseech thee､ remain like the still-born,—which when it is born of its mother the half of its flesh is consumed.
content_old: 12 Let her not､ I beseech thee､ remain like the still-born,—which when it is born of its mother the half of its flesh is consumed.

content: 13 Then Moses made outcry unto Yahweh､ saying,— O GOD, I beseech thee､ grant healing､ I beseech thee､ unto her.
content_old: 13 Then Moses made outcry unto Yahweh､ saying,— O GOD, I beseech thee､ grant healing､ I beseech thee､ unto her.

content: 14 And Yahweh said unto Moses: If her own father had but spat in her face would she not have acknowledged the shame for seven days? Let her shut herself up for seven days､ outside the camp, and afterwards let her be received back.
content_old: 14 And Yahweh said unto Moses: If her own father had but spat in her face would she not have acknowledged the shame for seven days? Let her shut herself up for seven days､ outside the camp, and afterwards let her be received back.

content: 15 So Miriam shut herself up､ outside the camp, for seven days,—and the people set not forward, until Miriam had been received back.
content_old: 15 So Miriam shut herself up､ outside the camp, for seven days,—and the people set not forward, until Miriam had been received back.

content: 1 Then spake Yahweh unto Moses saying:
content_old: 1 Then spake Yahweh unto Moses saying:

content: 2 Send for thee men､ and let them spy out the land of Canaan, which I am giving unto the sons of Israel,—one man each､ for the tribe of his fathers shalt thou send, each one a prince among them.
content_old: 2 Send for thee men､ and let them spy out the land of Canaan, which I am giving unto the sons of Israel,—one man each､ for the tribe of his fathers shalt thou send, each one a prince among them.

content: 3 So then Moses sent them out of the desert of Pârân､ at the bidding of Yahweh,—all of them great men, heads of the sons of lsrael were they.
content_old: 3 So then Moses sent them out of the desert of Pârân､ at the bidding of Yahweh,—all of them great men, heads of the sons of lsrael were they.

content: 4 And these are their names,— Of the tribe of Reuben Shammua､ son of Zaccur;
content_old: 4 And these are their names,— Of the tribe of Reuben Shammua､ son of Zaccur;

content: 5 Of the tribe of Simeon Shaphat､ son of Hori;
content_old: 5 Of the tribe of Simeon Shaphat､ son of Hori;

content: 6 Of the tribe of Judah Caleb､ son of Jephunneh;
content_old: 6 Of the tribe of Judah Caleb､ son of Jephunneh;

content: 7 Of the tribe of Issachar Igal､ son of Joseph;
content_old: 7 Of the tribe of Issachar Igal､ son of Joseph;

content: 8 Of the tribe of Ephraim Hoshea､ son of Nun;
content_old: 8 Of the tribe of Ephraim Hoshea､ son of Nun;

content: 9 Of the tribe of Benjamin Palti､ son of Raphu;
content_old: 9 Of the tribe of Benjamin Palti､ son of Raphu;

content: 10 Of the tribe of Zebulun Gaddiel､ son of Sodi;
content_old: 10 Of the tribe of Zebulun Gaddiel､ son of Sodi;

content: 11 Of the tribe of Joseph—of the tribe of Manasseh Gaddi､ son of Susi;
content_old: 11 Of the tribe of Joseph—of the tribe of Manasseh Gaddi､ son of Susi;

content: 12 Of the tribe of Dan Ammiel､ son of Gemalli;
content_old: 12 Of the tribe of Dan Ammiel､ son of Gemalli;

content: 13 Of the tribe of Asher Sethur､ son of Michael;
content_old: 13 Of the tribe of Asher Sethur､ son of Michael;

content: 14 Of the tribe of Naphtali Nahbi､ son of Vophsi;
content_old: 14 Of the tribe of Naphtali Nahbi､ son of Vophsi;

content: 15 Of the tribe of Gad Geuel､ son of Machi.
content_old: 15 Of the tribe of Gad Geuel､ son of Machi.

content: 16 These are the names of the men, whom Moses sent､ to spy out the land,—but Moses called Hoshea son of Nun､ Joshua.
content_old: 16 These are the names of the men, whom Moses sent､ to spy out the land,—but Moses called Hoshea son of Nun､ Joshua.

content: 17 So Moses sent them, to spy out the land of Canaan,—and said unto them— Go up､ here､ in the South, Yea ye shall go up the mountain;
content_old: 17 So Moses sent them, to spy out the land of Canaan,—and said unto them— Go up､ here､ in the South, Yea ye shall go up the mountain;

content: 18 And shall see the land､ what it is,— And the people that dwell thereupon. Whether they are strong or weak, Whether they are few or many;
content_old: 18 And shall see the land､ what it is,— And the people that dwell thereupon. Whether they are strong or weak, Whether they are few or many;

content: 19 And what the land is､ wherein they dwell, Whether it is good or bad,— And the cities within which they dwell, Whether in camps､ or in strongholds;
content_old: 19 And what the land is､ wherein they dwell, Whether it is good or bad,— And the cities within which they dwell, Whether in camps､ or in strongholds;

content: 20 And what the land is, Whether fat or lean､ Whether there is timber therein､ or is not, Then shall ye pluck up courage､ and take of the fruit of the land. Now the days were the days of the firstfruits of grapes.
content_old: 20 And what the land is, Whether fat or lean､ Whether there is timber therein､ or is not, Then shall ye pluck up courage､ and take of the fruit of the land. Now the days were the days of the firstfruits of grapes.

content: 21 So they went up､ and spied out the land,—from the wilderness of Zin unto Rehob､ at the entering in of Hamath.
content_old: 21 So they went up､ and spied out the land,—from the wilderness of Zin unto Rehob､ at the entering in of Hamath.

content: 22 Yea they went up in the South､ and entered as far as Hebron, and there were Ahiman､ Sheshai and Talmai､ descendants of the Anak. Now Hebron was built seven years before Zoan of Egypt.
content_old: 22 Yea they went up in the South､ and entered as far as Hebron, and there were Ahiman､ Sheshai and Talmai､ descendants of the Anak. Now Hebron was built seven years before Zoan of Egypt.

content: 23 And they entered as far as the ravine of Eschol､ and cut down､ from thence､ a branch with one cluster of grapes, and bare it on a pole､ between two,—also of the pomegranates and of the figs.
content_old: 23 And they entered as far as the ravine of Eschol､ and cut down､ from thence､ a branch with one cluster of grapes, and bare it on a pole､ between two,—also of the pomegranates and of the figs.

content: 24 That place was called, The Ravine of Eschol —on account of the cluster､ which was cut down from thence by the sons of Israel.
content_old: 24 That place was called, The Ravine of Eschol —on account of the cluster､ which was cut down from thence by the sons of Israel.

content: 25 And they returned from spying out the land,—at the end of forty days.
content_old: 25 And they returned from spying out the land,—at the end of forty days.

content: 26 So they took their journey､ and came in unto Moses and unto Aaron､ and unto all the assembly of the sons of Israel､ into the wilderness of Pârân､ towards Kadesh,—and brought back word—unto them､ and unto all the assembly, and showed them the fruit of the land.
content_old: 26 So they took their journey､ and came in unto Moses and unto Aaron､ and unto all the assembly of the sons of Israel､ into the wilderness of Pârân､ towards Kadesh,—and brought back word—unto them､ and unto all the assembly, and showed them the fruit of the land.

content: 27 And they recounted unto him､ and said, We entered into the land whither thou didst send us,—and surely it doth flow with milk and honey､ and this is the fruit thereof.
content_old: 27 And they recounted unto him､ and said, We entered into the land whither thou didst send us,—and surely it doth flow with milk and honey､ and this is the fruit thereof.

content: 28 Nevertheless surely mighty are the people that dwell in the land,—and the cities walled in､ exceeding great, moreover also､the descendants of the Anak saw we there.
content_old: 28 Nevertheless surely mighty are the people that dwell in the land,—and the cities walled in､ exceeding great, moreover also､the descendants of the Anak saw we there.

content: 29 Amalek dwelleth in the land of the South; And the Hittite and the Jebusite and the Amorite dwell in the mountain, And the Canaanite dwelleth by the sea, and by the side of the Jordan.
content_old: 29 Amalek dwelleth in the land of the South; And the Hittite and the Jebusite and the Amorite dwell in the mountain, And the Canaanite dwelleth by the sea, and by the side of the Jordan.

content: 30 And Caleb stilled the people unto Moses,—and said unto them— Let us go straight up and possess it, for we shall surely prevail against it.
content_old: 30 And Caleb stilled the people unto Moses,—and said unto them— Let us go straight up and possess it, for we shall surely prevail against it.

content: 31 But the men who went up with him said, We cannot go up against the people,—for stronger are they than we.
content_old: 31 But the men who went up with him said, We cannot go up against the people,—for stronger are they than we.

content: 32 So they sent forth a rumour of the land which they had spied out, among the sons of Israel saying,— As touching the land through which we passed､ to spy it out it is a land that eateth up them who dwell therein, And all the people that we saw in the midst thereof were men of great stature.
content_old: 32 So they sent forth a rumour of the land which they had spied out, among the sons of Israel saying,— As touching the land through which we passed､ to spy it out it is a land that eateth up them who dwell therein, And all the people that we saw in the midst thereof were men of great stature.

content: 1 Then did all the assembly lift up､ and give forth their voice,—and the people wept throughout that night.
content_old: 1 Then did all the assembly lift up､ and give forth their voice,—and the people wept throughout that night.

content: 2 And all the sons of Israel murmured against Moses and against Aaron,—and all the assembly said unto them— Oh that we had died in the land of Egypt! Or in this wilderness oh that we had died!
content_old: 2 And all the sons of Israel murmured against Moses and against Aaron,—and all the assembly said unto them— Oh that we had died in the land of Egypt! Or in this wilderness oh that we had died!

content: 3 Wherefore､ then､ is Yahweh bringing us into this land､ to fall by the sword? Our wives and little ones will become a prey! Would it not be well for us to go back towards Egypt?
content_old: 3 Wherefore､ then､ is Yahweh bringing us into this land､ to fall by the sword? Our wives and little ones will become a prey! Would it not be well for us to go back towards Egypt?

content: 4 And they said､ one to another,— Let us appoint a head､ and let us go back towards Egypt.
content_old: 4 And they said､ one to another,— Let us appoint a head､ and let us go back towards Egypt.

content: 5 Then did Moses and Aaron fall upon their faces,—before all the convocation of the assembly of the sons of Israel.
content_old: 5 Then did Moses and Aaron fall upon their faces,—before all the convocation of the assembly of the sons of Israel.

content: 6 But Joshua son of Nun､ and Caleb son of Jephunneh, of them who spied out the land rent their clothes;
content_old: 6 But Joshua son of Nun､ and Caleb son of Jephunneh, of them who spied out the land rent their clothes;

content: 7 and spake unto all the assembly of the sons of Israel, saying,— As for the land through which we passed to spy it out Good is the land､ exceedingly
content_old: 7 and spake unto all the assembly of the sons of Israel, saying,— As for the land through which we passed to spy it out Good is the land､ exceedingly

content: 8 If Yahweh delight in us then will he bring us into this land, and give it unto us,— A land which doth flow with milk and honey.
content_old: 8 If Yahweh delight in us then will he bring us into this land, and give it unto us,— A land which doth flow with milk and honey.

content: 9 Only against Yahweh do not rebel. Do not ye fear the people of the land, For our food they are,— Their shade hath departed from over them､ And Yahweh is with us､ Do not fear them!
content_old: 9 Only against Yahweh do not rebel. Do not ye fear the people of the land, For our food they are,— Their shade hath departed from over them､ And Yahweh is with us､ Do not fear them!

content: 10 But when all the assembly bade stone them､ with stones the glory of Yahweh appeared､ in the tent of meeting, unto all the sons of Israel.
content_old: 10 But when all the assembly bade stone them､ with stones the glory of Yahweh appeared､ in the tent of meeting, unto all the sons of Israel.

content: 11 Then said Yahweh unto Moses, How long must this people despise me? And how long can they not believe in me, in view of all the signs which I have done in their midst?
content_old: 11 Then said Yahweh unto Moses, How long must this people despise me? And how long can they not believe in me, in view of all the signs which I have done in their midst?

content: 12 Let me smite them with pestilence､ and disinherit them,— And make thee into a nation greater and more mighty than they!
content_old: 12 Let me smite them with pestilence､ and disinherit them,— And make thee into a nation greater and more mighty than they!

content: 13 Then said Moses unto Yahweh,— So shall the Egyptians hear, For thou hast brought up､ in thy might､ this people､ out of their midst;
content_old: 13 Then said Moses unto Yahweh,— So shall the Egyptians hear, For thou hast brought up､ in thy might､ this people､ out of their midst;

content: 14 And will tell it unto the inhabitants of this land: They have heard That thou､ Yahweh art in the midst of this people,— That eye to eye is he seen—thou､ Yahweh､ And thy cloud is standing over them, And in a pillar of cloud thou thyself art going on before them by day, And in a pillar of fire by night.
content_old: 14 And will tell it unto the inhabitants of this land: They have heard That thou､ Yahweh art in the midst of this people,— That eye to eye is he seen—thou､ Yahweh､ And thy cloud is standing over them, And in a pillar of cloud thou thyself art going on before them by day, And in a pillar of fire by night.

content: 15 As soon､ therefore､ as thou hast put to death this people､ as one man so soon will the nations who have heard thy fame speak､ saying:
content_old: 15 As soon､ therefore､ as thou hast put to death this people､ as one man so soon will the nations who have heard thy fame speak､ saying:

content: 16 Because Yahweh was not able to bring in this people into the land which he had sworn unto them therefore did he slay them in the desert.
content_old: 16 Because Yahweh was not able to bring in this people into the land which he had sworn unto them therefore did he slay them in the desert.

content: 17 Now､ therefore､ I beseech thee､ let the might of My Lord be magnified,—according as thou didst speak､ saying:
content_old: 17 Now､ therefore､ I beseech thee､ let the might of My Lord be magnified,—according as thou didst speak､ saying:

content: 18 Yahweh—slow to anger and great in lovingkindness, Forgiving iniquity and transgression: Though he will not leave wholly unpunished Visiting the iniquity of fathers upon sons, Upon a third generation､ and upon a fourth.
content_old: 18 Yahweh—slow to anger and great in lovingkindness, Forgiving iniquity and transgression: Though he will not leave wholly unpunished Visiting the iniquity of fathers upon sons, Upon a third generation､ and upon a fourth.

content: 19 Pardon､ I beseech thee､ the iniquity of this people, According to the greatness of thy loving-kindness,— And according as thou hast forgiven this people, from Egypt､ even thus far.
content_old: 19 Pardon､ I beseech thee､ the iniquity of this people, According to the greatness of thy loving-kindness,— And according as thou hast forgiven this people, from Egypt､ even thus far.

content: 20 And Yahweh said, I have pardoned､ according to thy word;
content_old: 20 And Yahweh said, I have pardoned､ according to thy word;

content: 21 Nevertheless as I live,—and that all the earth may be filled with the glory of Yahweh
content_old: 21 Nevertheless as I live,—and that all the earth may be filled with the glory of Yahweh

content: 22 Verily､none of the men who have been beholding my glory and my signs, which I have done in Egypt､ and in the desert,—and have put me to the proof these ten times, and have not hearkened unto my voice
content_old: 22 Verily､none of the men who have been beholding my glory and my signs, which I have done in Egypt､ and in the desert,—and have put me to the proof these ten times, and have not hearkened unto my voice

content: 23 shall see the land, which I sware to their fathers,—yea､none of my despisers shall see it.
content_old: 23 shall see the land, which I sware to their fathers,—yea､none of my despisers shall see it.

content: 24 But my servant Caleb—because there was another spirit with him, and he followed me fully therefore will I bring him into the land whereinto he entered, and his seed shall possess it.
content_old: 24 But my servant Caleb—because there was another spirit with him, and he followed me fully therefore will I bring him into the land whereinto he entered, and his seed shall possess it.

content: 25 Now the Amalekites and the Canaanites are dwelling in the valley,—to-morrow turn ye away; and set yourselves forward towards the desert､ by the way of the Red Sea.
content_old: 25 Now the Amalekites and the Canaanites are dwelling in the valley,—to-morrow turn ye away; and set yourselves forward towards the desert､ by the way of the Red Sea.

content: 26 Then spake Yahweh unto Moses and unto Aaron､ saying:
content_old: 26 Then spake Yahweh unto Moses and unto Aaron､ saying:

content: 27 How long, as regardeth this evil assembly are they to be murmuring against me? The murmuring of the sons of Israel､ which they have been murmuring against me have I heard.
content_old: 27 How long, as regardeth this evil assembly are they to be murmuring against me? The murmuring of the sons of Israel､ which they have been murmuring against me have I heard.

content: 28 Say unto them: As I live is the oracle of Yahweh: Surely as ye have spoken in mine ears so will I do unto you:—
content_old: 28 Say unto them: As I live is the oracle of Yahweh: Surely as ye have spoken in mine ears so will I do unto you:—

content: 29 In this desert shall your dead bodies fall､ And none of you who were numbered､ in all your counting, from twenty years old and upwards,—who have murmured against me
content_old: 29 In this desert shall your dead bodies fall､ And none of you who were numbered､ in all your counting, from twenty years old and upwards,—who have murmured against me

content: 30 none of you shall enter into the land, as to which I uplifted my hand､ to give you an abode therein,—save Caleb son of Jephunneh, and Joshua､ son of Nun:
content_old: 30 none of you shall enter into the land, as to which I uplifted my hand､ to give you an abode therein,—save Caleb son of Jephunneh, and Joshua､ son of Nun:

content: 31 whereas your little ones, of whom ye said､ they should become a prey I will bring them in, and they shall acknowledge the land which ye refused.
content_old: 31 whereas your little ones, of whom ye said､ they should become a prey I will bring them in, and they shall acknowledge the land which ye refused.

content: 32 But your own dead bodies shall fall in this desert;
content_old: 32 But your own dead bodies shall fall in this desert;

content: 33 and your sons shall be shepherds in the desert forty years, and shall bear your unchastities,—until your dead bodies are consumed in the desert.
content_old: 33 and your sons shall be shepherds in the desert forty years, and shall bear your unchastities,—until your dead bodies are consumed in the desert.

content: 34 By the number of the days､ wherein ye spied out the land—forty days each day for a year shall they bear your iniquities—forty years,—so shall ye know my opposition.
content_old: 34 By the number of the days､ wherein ye spied out the land—forty days each day for a year shall they bear your iniquities—forty years,—so shall ye know my opposition.

content: 35 I—Yahweh have spoken, Verily this will I do to all this evil assembly, who have conspired against me,— In this desert shall they be consumed And there shall they die.
content_old: 35 I—Yahweh have spoken, Verily this will I do to all this evil assembly, who have conspired against me,— In this desert shall they be consumed And there shall they die.

content: 36 Now as for the men whom Moses sent to spy out the land,—who returned and caused all the assembly to murmur against him､ by giving out a rumour against the land
content_old: 36 Now as for the men whom Moses sent to spy out the land,—who returned and caused all the assembly to murmur against him､ by giving out a rumour against the land

content: 37 they died—the men who gave out an evil rumour of the land,—by the plague､ before Yahweh.
content_old: 37 they died—the men who gave out an evil rumour of the land,—by the plague､ before Yahweh.

content: 38 But Joshua son of Nun, and Caleb son of Jephunneh remained alive—of those men who went to spy out the land.
content_old: 38 But Joshua son of Nun, and Caleb son of Jephunneh remained alive—of those men who went to spy out the land.

content: 39 And Moses spake these words unto all the sons of Israel,—and the people were greatly depressed.
content_old: 39 And Moses spake these words unto all the sons of Israel,—and the people were greatly depressed.

content: 40 So they arose early in the morning, and went up into the top of the mountain, saying,— We are here—therefore will we go up into the place as to which Yahweh hath said､ that we have sinned.
content_old: 40 So they arose early in the morning, and went up into the top of the mountain, saying,— We are here—therefore will we go up into the place as to which Yahweh hath said､ that we have sinned.

content: 41 But Moses said, Wherefore is it that ye are going beyond the bidding of Yahweh,—since that cannot prosper?
content_old: 41 But Moses said, Wherefore is it that ye are going beyond the bidding of Yahweh,—since that cannot prosper?

content: 42 Do not go up, For Yahweh is not in your midst,— Lest ye be smitten down before your enemies.
content_old: 42 Do not go up, For Yahweh is not in your midst,— Lest ye be smitten down before your enemies.

content: 43 For the Amalekites and the Canaanites are there before you, So shall ye fall by the sword,— For inasmuch as ye have turned back from following Yahweh Therefore will Yahweh not be with you.
content_old: 43 For the Amalekites and the Canaanites are there before you, So shall ye fall by the sword,— For inasmuch as ye have turned back from following Yahweh Therefore will Yahweh not be with you.

content: 44 But they presumptuously ascended into the top of the mountain,—though neither the ark of the covenant of Yahweh､ nor Moses moved out of the midst of the camp.
content_old: 44 But they presumptuously ascended into the top of the mountain,—though neither the ark of the covenant of Yahweh､ nor Moses moved out of the midst of the camp.

content: 1 Then spake Yahweh unto Moses､ saying:
content_old: 1 Then spake Yahweh unto Moses､ saying:

content: 2 Speak unto the sons of Israel, and thou shalt say unto them,— When ye shall enter into the land of your dwelling-places, which I am giving unto you;
content_old: 2 Speak unto the sons of Israel, and thou shalt say unto them,— When ye shall enter into the land of your dwelling-places, which I am giving unto you;

content: 3 and ye would offer､ as an altar-flame unto Yahweh､ an ascending-offering or a sacrifice, for celebrating a vow or as a freewill-offering, or in your appointed seasons,—by way of offering a satisfying odour unto Yahweh, from the herd or from the flock
content_old: 3 and ye would offer､ as an altar-flame unto Yahweh､ an ascending-offering or a sacrifice, for celebrating a vow or as a freewill-offering, or in your appointed seasons,—by way of offering a satisfying odour unto Yahweh, from the herd or from the flock

content: 4 then shall he that bringeth near his oblation bring near unto Yahweh a meal-offering､ of fine meal a tenth part of an ephah overflowed with the fourth part of a hin of oil;
content_old: 4 then shall he that bringeth near his oblation bring near unto Yahweh a meal-offering､ of fine meal a tenth part of an ephah overflowed with the fourth part of a hin of oil;

content: 5 wine also for a drink-offering､ the fourth part of a hin shalt thou offer with the ascending-offering or with the sacrifice,—for each he-lamb.
content_old: 5 wine also for a drink-offering､ the fourth part of a hin shalt thou offer with the ascending-offering or with the sacrifice,—for each he-lamb.

content: 6 Or with a ram thou shalt offer a meal-offering, of fine meal､ two tenths,—overflowed with oil､ the third of a hin;
content_old: 6 Or with a ram thou shalt offer a meal-offering, of fine meal､ two tenths,—overflowed with oil､ the third of a hin;

content: 7 wine also､ for a drink-offering､ the third of a hin shalt thou bring near as a satisfying odour unto Yahweh.
content_old: 7 wine also､ for a drink-offering､ the third of a hin shalt thou bring near as a satisfying odour unto Yahweh.

content: 8 And when thou wouldest offer a choice young bullock､ as an ascending-offering or sacrifice,—for celebrating a vow､ or as a peace-offering unto Yahweh
content_old: 8 And when thou wouldest offer a choice young bullock､ as an ascending-offering or sacrifice,—for celebrating a vow､ or as a peace-offering unto Yahweh

content: 9 then shall he bring near､ with his choice young bullock､ a meal-offering, of fine meal､ three tenths,—overflowed with half a hin of oil;
content_old: 9 then shall he bring near､ with his choice young bullock､ a meal-offering, of fine meal､ three tenths,—overflowed with half a hin of oil;

content: 10 wine also shalt thou bring near for a drink-offering､ half a hin,—for an altar-flame of satisfying odour､ unto Yahweh.
content_old: 10 wine also shalt thou bring near for a drink-offering､ half a hin,—for an altar-flame of satisfying odour､ unto Yahweh.

content: 11 Thus and thus shall it be done､ for each ox, and for each ram,—and for each young one among the sheep､ or among the goats:
content_old: 11 Thus and thus shall it be done､ for each ox, and for each ram,—and for each young one among the sheep､ or among the goats:

content: 12 according to the number which ye shall offer thus and thus shall ye do for each one､ according to their number.
content_old: 12 according to the number which ye shall offer thus and thus shall ye do for each one､ according to their number.

content: 13 Every one born in the land thus and thus shall offer these things,—when bringing near an altar-flame of a satisfying odour unto Yahweh.
content_old: 13 Every one born in the land thus and thus shall offer these things,—when bringing near an altar-flame of a satisfying odour unto Yahweh.

content: 14 And when there shall sojourn with you a sojourner､ or one who is in your midst to your generations, and he would offer an altar-flame of a satisfying odour､ unto Yahweh as ye offer so shall he offer.
content_old: 14 And when there shall sojourn with you a sojourner､ or one who is in your midst to your generations, and he would offer an altar-flame of a satisfying odour､ unto Yahweh as ye offer so shall he offer.

content: 15 In the convocation one statute shall there be､ for you and for the sojourner who sojourneth,—an age-abiding statute､ unto your generations, as ye are so the sojourner shall be､ before Yahweh:
content_old: 15 In the convocation one statute shall there be､ for you and for the sojourner who sojourneth,—an age-abiding statute､ unto your generations, as ye are so the sojourner shall be､ before Yahweh:

content: 16 one law and one regulation shall there be､ for yourselves and for the sojourner that sojourneth with you.
content_old: 16 one law and one regulation shall there be､ for yourselves and for the sojourner that sojourneth with you.

content: 17 Then spake Yahweh unto Moses､ saying:
content_old: 17 Then spake Yahweh unto Moses､ saying:

content: 18 Speak unto the sons of Israel, and thou shalt say unto them,— When ye enter into the land whereinto I am bringing you
content_old: 18 Speak unto the sons of Israel, and thou shalt say unto them,— When ye enter into the land whereinto I am bringing you

content: 19 then shall it be, when ye eat the bread of the land that ye shall heave up a heave-offering unto Yahweh.
content_old: 19 then shall it be, when ye eat the bread of the land that ye shall heave up a heave-offering unto Yahweh.

content: 20 Of the first of your meal shall ye heave up a cake as a heave-offering,—like the heave-offering of grain so shall ye heave it.
content_old: 20 Of the first of your meal shall ye heave up a cake as a heave-offering,—like the heave-offering of grain so shall ye heave it.

content: 21 Of the first of your meal shall ye give unto Yahweh､ a heave-offering,—unto your generations.
content_old: 21 Of the first of your meal shall ye give unto Yahweh､ a heave-offering,—unto your generations.

content: 22 And when ye shall make a mistake, and not observe all these commandments,—which Yahweh hath spoken unto Moses;
content_old: 22 And when ye shall make a mistake, and not observe all these commandments,—which Yahweh hath spoken unto Moses;

content: 23 even all that Yahweh hath given unto you in command､ by the hand of Moses,—from the day that Yahweh gave command､ and onward､ unto your generations
content_old: 23 even all that Yahweh hath given unto you in command､ by the hand of Moses,—from the day that Yahweh gave command､ and onward､ unto your generations

content: 24 then shall it be—if away from the eyes of the assembly it hath been done by mistake that all the assembly shall offer one choice young bullock for an ascending-sacrifice､ as a satisfying odour unto Yahweh, with the meal-offering thereof and the drink-offering thereof､ according to the regulation,—and one young he-goat､ as a sin-bearer.
content_old: 24 then shall it be—if away from the eyes of the assembly it hath been done by mistake that all the assembly shall offer one choice young bullock for an ascending-sacrifice､ as a satisfying odour unto Yahweh, with the meal-offering thereof and the drink-offering thereof､ according to the regulation,—and one young he-goat､ as a sin-bearer.

content: 25 So shall the priest put a propitiatory-covering over all the assembly of the sons of Israel､ and pardon shall be granted unto them,—because a mistake it was, they therefore have brought in their offering—an altar-flame unto Yahweh､ and their sin-bearer before Yahweh､ for their mistake:
content_old: 25 So shall the priest put a propitiatory-covering over all the assembly of the sons of Israel､ and pardon shall be granted unto them,—because a mistake it was, they therefore have brought in their offering—an altar-flame unto Yahweh､ and their sin-bearer before Yahweh､ for their mistake:

content: 26 and pardon shall be granted unto all the assembly of the sons of Israel, and unto the sojourner that sojourneth in their midst,—for in the case of all the people it was by mistake.
content_old: 26 and pardon shall be granted unto all the assembly of the sons of Israel, and unto the sojourner that sojourneth in their midst,—for in the case of all the people it was by mistake.

content: 27 And if any one person shall sin by mistake then shall he bring near a she-goat of the first year､ as a sin-bearer;
content_old: 27 And if any one person shall sin by mistake then shall he bring near a she-goat of the first year､ as a sin-bearer;

content: 28 and the priest shall put a propitiatory-covering over the person who hath made the mistake､ when he hath sinned by mistake before Yahweh,—even put a propitiatory-covering over him､ and pardon shall be granted him.
content_old: 28 and the priest shall put a propitiatory-covering over the person who hath made the mistake､ when he hath sinned by mistake before Yahweh,—even put a propitiatory-covering over him､ and pardon shall be granted him.

content: 29 For the native born among the sons of Israel, and for the sojourner that sojourneth in their midst one law shall there be unto you—for acting by mistake.
content_old: 29 For the native born among the sons of Israel, and for the sojourner that sojourneth in their midst one law shall there be unto you—for acting by mistake.

content: 30 But as for the person who acteth with a high hand—of the native born or of the sojourners Yahweh himself he reproacheth,—therefore shall that person be cut off out of the midst of his people.
content_old: 30 But as for the person who acteth with a high hand—of the native born or of the sojourners Yahweh himself he reproacheth,—therefore shall that person be cut off out of the midst of his people.

content: 31 Because the word of Yahweh hath he despised, and his commandment hath he broken that person shall be surely cut off､ his iniquity is in himself.
content_old: 31 Because the word of Yahweh hath he despised, and his commandment hath he broken that person shall be surely cut off､ his iniquity is in himself.

content: 32 While the sons of Israel were in the desert they found a man gathering sticks on the sabbath day.
content_old: 32 While the sons of Israel were in the desert they found a man gathering sticks on the sabbath day.

content: 33 And they who found him gathering sticks brought him near unto Moses､ and unto Aaron､ and unto all the assembly.
content_old: 33 And they who found him gathering sticks brought him near unto Moses､ and unto Aaron､ and unto all the assembly.

content: 34 And they put him in ward,—because it was not clear what they should do unto him.
content_old: 34 And they put him in ward,—because it was not clear what they should do unto him.

content: 35 Then said Yahweh unto Moses, The man shall be put to death,—all the assembly stoning him with stones, outside the camp.
content_old: 35 Then said Yahweh unto Moses, The man shall be put to death,—all the assembly stoning him with stones, outside the camp.

content: 36 So then all the assembly put him forth outside the camp, and stoned him with stones､ and he died,— As Yahweh commanded Moses.
content_old: 36 So then all the assembly put him forth outside the camp, and stoned him with stones､ and he died,— As Yahweh commanded Moses.

content: 37 And Yahweh spake unto Moses､ saying:
content_old: 37 And Yahweh spake unto Moses､ saying:

content: 38 Speak unto the sons of Israel､ and thou shalt say unto them. That they shall make them fringes on the corners of their garments､ unto their generations—and shall put upon the fringe of the corner､ a cord of blue:
content_old: 38 Speak unto the sons of Israel､ and thou shalt say unto them. That they shall make them fringes on the corners of their garments､ unto their generations—and shall put upon the fringe of the corner､ a cord of blue:

content: 39 so shall they serve you as fringes, and when ye see then, then shall ye call to mind all the commandments of Yahweh, and shall do them,—and shall not spy out, after your own hearts､ and after your own eyes for things､ after which ye are ready to go unchastely away:
content_old: 39 so shall they serve you as fringes, and when ye see then, then shall ye call to mind all the commandments of Yahweh, and shall do them,—and shall not spy out, after your own hearts､ and after your own eyes for things､ after which ye are ready to go unchastely away:

content: 40 to the intent ye may call to mind､ and do all my commandments, and be holy unto your God. I—Yahweh am your God—who brought you forth out of the land of Egypt, to become your God,——
content_old: 40 to the intent ye may call to mind､ and do all my commandments, and be holy unto your God. I—Yahweh am your God—who brought you forth out of the land of Egypt, to become your God,——

content: 1 Then took Korah, son of Izhar､ son of Kohath､ son of Levi,—and Dathan and Abiram､ sons of Eliab, and On､ son of Peleth､ sons of Reuben;
content_old: 1 Then took Korah, son of Izhar､ son of Kohath､ son of Levi,—and Dathan and Abiram､ sons of Eliab, and On､ son of Peleth､ sons of Reuben;

content: 2 and rose up before Moses, with certain men of the sons of Israel､ two hundred and fifty,—princes of assembly､ called to the stated meeting､ men of renown;
content_old: 2 and rose up before Moses, with certain men of the sons of Israel､ two hundred and fifty,—princes of assembly､ called to the stated meeting､ men of renown;

content: 3 and gathered themselves together against Moses and against Aaron､ and said unto them､ Too much for you when all the assembly are all of them holy, and in the midst of them is Yahweh,— Wherefore､ then､ should ye set yourselves up､ above the convocation of Yahweh?
content_old: 3 and gathered themselves together against Moses and against Aaron､ and said unto them､ Too much for you when all the assembly are all of them holy, and in the midst of them is Yahweh,— Wherefore､ then､ should ye set yourselves up､ above the convocation of Yahweh?

content: 4 And when Moses heard it he fell upon his face.
content_old: 4 And when Moses heard it he fell upon his face.

content: 5 Then spake he unto Korah､ and unto all his assembly､ saying, In the morning will Yahweh make known—who are his､ and who is the holy one､ and will cause him to come near unto himself,—yea him whom he shall choose will he cause to come near unto himself.
content_old: 5 Then spake he unto Korah､ and unto all his assembly､ saying, In the morning will Yahweh make known—who are his､ and who is the holy one､ and will cause him to come near unto himself,—yea him whom he shall choose will he cause to come near unto himself.

content: 6 This do,— Take to you censers, Korah､ and all his assembly;
content_old: 6 This do,— Take to you censers, Korah､ and all his assembly;

content: 7 and place therein fire, and put thereon incense､ before Yahweh､ to-morrow, So shall it be—that the man whom Yahweh shall choose he shall be the holy one. Too much for you､ ye sons of Levi!
content_old: 7 and place therein fire, and put thereon incense､ before Yahweh､ to-morrow, So shall it be—that the man whom Yahweh shall choose he shall be the holy one. Too much for you､ ye sons of Levi!

content: 8 And Moses said unto Korah,— Hear､ I pray you､ ye sons of Levi!
content_old: 8 And Moses said unto Korah,— Hear､ I pray you､ ye sons of Levi!

content: 9 Is it too small a thing for you､ that the God of Israel hath separated you from the assembly of Israel, to bring you near unto himself,—to do the laborious work of the habitation of Yahweh, and to stand before the assembly､ to wait upon them?
content_old: 9 Is it too small a thing for you､ that the God of Israel hath separated you from the assembly of Israel, to bring you near unto himself,—to do the laborious work of the habitation of Yahweh, and to stand before the assembly､ to wait upon them?

content: 10 But having brought thee near, and all thy brethren the sons of Levi with thee must ye seek priesthood also?
content_old: 10 But having brought thee near, and all thy brethren the sons of Levi with thee must ye seek priesthood also?

content: 11 Wherefore thou and all thine assembly are conspiring against Yahweh,— But Aaron what is he, that ye should murmur against him?
content_old: 11 Wherefore thou and all thine assembly are conspiring against Yahweh,— But Aaron what is he, that ye should murmur against him?

content: 12 Then sent Moses, to call for Dathan and for Abiram､ sons of Eliab,—and they said､ We will not come up:
content_old: 12 Then sent Moses, to call for Dathan and for Abiram､ sons of Eliab,—and they said､ We will not come up:

content: 13 Was it a small thing that thou didst bring us up out of a land flowing with milk and honey, to put us to death in the desert, but thou must continue even to lord it over us?
content_old: 13 Was it a small thing that thou didst bring us up out of a land flowing with milk and honey, to put us to death in the desert, but thou must continue even to lord it over us?

content: 14 Certainly not into a land flowing with milk and honey hast thou brought us, nor given unto us an inheritance of field and vineyard,— The eyes of those men wilt thou dig out? We will not come up.
content_old: 14 Certainly not into a land flowing with milk and honey hast thou brought us, nor given unto us an inheritance of field and vineyard,— The eyes of those men wilt thou dig out? We will not come up.

content: 15 Then was Moses very angry, and he said unto Yahweh, Do not thou have respect unto their meal-offering. Not one ass､ from them have I taken, neither have I wronged one of them.
content_old: 15 Then was Moses very angry, and he said unto Yahweh, Do not thou have respect unto their meal-offering. Not one ass､ from them have I taken, neither have I wronged one of them.

content: 16 And Moses said unto Korah, Thou､ and all thine assembly come ye before Yahweh,—thou､ and they､ and Aaron to-morrow.
content_old: 16 And Moses said unto Korah, Thou､ and all thine assembly come ye before Yahweh,—thou､ and they､ and Aaron to-morrow.

content: 17 And take ye each man his censer､ and put thereon incense, then shall ye bring near before Yahweh､ each man his censer, two hundred and fifty censers,—and thou and Aaron each man his censer.
content_old: 17 And take ye each man his censer､ and put thereon incense, then shall ye bring near before Yahweh､ each man his censer, two hundred and fifty censers,—and thou and Aaron each man his censer.

content: 18 So they took each man his censer､ and put thereon fire, and placed thereon incense,—and took their stand at the entrance of the tent of meeting with Moses and Aaron.
content_old: 18 So they took each man his censer､ and put thereon fire, and placed thereon incense,—and took their stand at the entrance of the tent of meeting with Moses and Aaron.

content: 19 And Korah gathered together against them all the assembly, unto the entrance of the tent of meeting,—then appeared the glory of Yahweh､ unto all the assembly.
content_old: 19 And Korah gathered together against them all the assembly, unto the entrance of the tent of meeting,—then appeared the glory of Yahweh､ unto all the assembly.

content: 20 Then spake Yahweh unto Moses and unto Aaron､ saying:
content_old: 20 Then spake Yahweh unto Moses and unto Aaron､ saying:

content: 21 Separate yourselves out of the midst of this assembly,—that I may consume them in a moment.
content_old: 21 Separate yourselves out of the midst of this assembly,—that I may consume them in a moment.

content: 22 And they fell upon their faces､ and said, O GOD, the God of the spirits of all flesh,— shall one man sin, and against all the assembly wilt thou be wroth?
content_old: 22 And they fell upon their faces､ and said, O GOD, the God of the spirits of all flesh,— shall one man sin, and against all the assembly wilt thou be wroth?

content: 23 And Yahweh spake unto Moses､ saying,
content_old: 23 And Yahweh spake unto Moses､ saying,

content: 24 Speak unto the assembly､ saying,— Get ye up from round about the habitation of Korah､ Dathan and Abiram.
content_old: 24 Speak unto the assembly､ saying,— Get ye up from round about the habitation of Korah､ Dathan and Abiram.

content: 25 So Moses rose up, and went､ unto Dathan and Abiram,—then went､ after him､ the elders of Israel.
content_old: 25 So Moses rose up, and went､ unto Dathan and Abiram,—then went､ after him､ the elders of Israel.

content: 26 And he spake unto the assembly､ saying— Remove､ I pray you､ from beside the tents of these lawless men, and do not touch aught that pertaineth unto them,—lest ye be carried off､ in all their sins.
content_old: 26 And he spake unto the assembly､ saying— Remove､ I pray you､ from beside the tents of these lawless men, and do not touch aught that pertaineth unto them,—lest ye be carried off､ in all their sins.

content: 27 So they went up from beside the habitation of Korah､ Dathan and Abiram､ on every side,—and Dathan and Abiram came out and stationed themselves､ at the entrance of their tents, with their wives and their sons､ and their little ones.
content_old: 27 So they went up from beside the habitation of Korah､ Dathan and Abiram､ on every side,—and Dathan and Abiram came out and stationed themselves､ at the entrance of their tents, with their wives and their sons､ and their little ones.

content: 28 Then said Moses, Hereby shall ye know, that Yahweh hath sent me, to do all these works,—verily､ not out of my own heart:—
content_old: 28 Then said Moses, Hereby shall ye know, that Yahweh hath sent me, to do all these works,—verily､ not out of my own heart:—

content: 29 If as all human beings die these do die, and the visitation of all human beings be visited upon them Yahweh hath not sent me.
content_old: 29 If as all human beings die these do die, and the visitation of all human beings be visited upon them Yahweh hath not sent me.

content: 30 But if a creation Yahweh create､ and the ground open wide her mouth､ and swallow them up､ with all that pertain unto them, and so they go down､ alive､ unto hades then shall ye know, that these men have despised Yahweh.
content_old: 30 But if a creation Yahweh create､ and the ground open wide her mouth､ and swallow them up､ with all that pertain unto them, and so they go down､ alive､ unto hades then shall ye know, that these men have despised Yahweh.

content: 31 And it came to pass､as he made an end of speaking all these words that the ground which was under them clave asunder;
content_old: 31 And it came to pass､as he made an end of speaking all these words that the ground which was under them clave asunder;

content: 32 and the earth opened her mouth, and swallowed up them､ and their households,—and all the human beings who pertained unto Korah, with all their goods:
content_old: 32 and the earth opened her mouth, and swallowed up them､ and their households,—and all the human beings who pertained unto Korah, with all their goods:

content: 33 so they､ and all that pertained unto them､went down､ alive､ unto hades,—and the earth closed upon them, and they perished out of the midst of the convocation.
content_old: 33 so they､ and all that pertained unto them､went down､ alive､ unto hades,—and the earth closed upon them, and they perished out of the midst of the convocation.

content: 34 And all Israel who were round about them fled at their cry,—for they said. Lest the earth swallow us up.
content_old: 34 And all Israel who were round about them fled at their cry,—for they said. Lest the earth swallow us up.

content: 35 Fire also came forth､ from Yahweh,—and consumed the two hundred and fifty men, who offered the incense.
content_old: 35 Fire also came forth､ from Yahweh,—and consumed the two hundred and fifty men, who offered the incense.

content: 36 Then spake Yahweh unto Moses､ saying:
content_old: 36 Then spake Yahweh unto Moses､ saying:

content: 37 Say unto Eleazar､ son of Aaron the priest､ that he take up the censers out of the midst of the burning, and the fire scatter thou yonder,—for they have been hallowed.
content_old: 37 Say unto Eleazar､ son of Aaron the priest､ that he take up the censers out of the midst of the burning, and the fire scatter thou yonder,—for they have been hallowed.

content: 38 As for the censers of these sinners against their own persons they shall be made into beaten-out plates､ as an overlay for the altar, for they had brought them near before Yahweh､ and hallowed them,—so shall they become a sign､ unto the sons of Israel.
content_old: 38 As for the censers of these sinners against their own persons they shall be made into beaten-out plates､ as an overlay for the altar, for they had brought them near before Yahweh､ and hallowed them,—so shall they become a sign､ unto the sons of Israel.

content: 39 And Eleazar the priest took the censers of bronze, which the consumed men had brought near,—and beat them out into plates for overlaying the altar:
content_old: 39 And Eleazar the priest took the censers of bronze, which the consumed men had brought near,—and beat them out into plates for overlaying the altar:

content: 40 a memorial unto the sons of Israel, That no stranger､ who is not of the seed of Aaron shall draw near to offer incense before Yahweh,—lest he become like Korah and like his assembly, As spake Yahweh by the hand of Moses､ with regard thereto.
content_old: 40 a memorial unto the sons of Israel, That no stranger､ who is not of the seed of Aaron shall draw near to offer incense before Yahweh,—lest he become like Korah and like his assembly, As spake Yahweh by the hand of Moses､ with regard thereto.

content: 41 And all the assembly of the sons of Israel murmured､ on the morrow, against Moses and against Aaron､ saying,— Ye have caused the death of the people of Yahweh.
content_old: 41 And all the assembly of the sons of Israel murmured､ on the morrow, against Moses and against Aaron､ saying,— Ye have caused the death of the people of Yahweh.

content: 42 And it came to pass､when the assembly gathered themselves together against Moses and against Aaron that they turned towards the tent of meeting, and lo! the cloud had covered it: and the glory of Yahweh appeared.
content_old: 42 And it came to pass､when the assembly gathered themselves together against Moses and against Aaron that they turned towards the tent of meeting, and lo! the cloud had covered it: and the glory of Yahweh appeared.

content: 43 And Moses and Aaron came in､ before the tent of meeting.
content_old: 43 And Moses and Aaron came in､ before the tent of meeting.

content: 44 Then spake Yahweh unto Moses､ saying:
content_old: 44 Then spake Yahweh unto Moses､ saying:

content: 45 Lift yourselves up out of the midst of this assembly, that I may consume them､ as in a moment,— And they fell upon their faces.
content_old: 45 Lift yourselves up out of the midst of this assembly, that I may consume them､ as in a moment,— And they fell upon their faces.

content: 46 Then said Moses unto Aaron— Take the censer and place thereon fire､ from off the altar､ and put incense thereon, and､ going quickly into the assembly､ put a propitiatory-covering over them,—for wrath hath gone forth from before Yahweh､ the plague hath begun.
content_old: 46 Then said Moses unto Aaron— Take the censer and place thereon fire､ from off the altar､ and put incense thereon, and､ going quickly into the assembly､ put a propitiatory-covering over them,—for wrath hath gone forth from before Yahweh､ the plague hath begun.

content: 47 Then took Aaron､ as Moses spake､ and ran into the midst of the convocation, and lo! the plague had begun among the people,—so he placed the incense, and put a propitiatory-covering over the people:
content_old: 47 Then took Aaron､ as Moses spake､ and ran into the midst of the convocation, and lo! the plague had begun among the people,—so he placed the incense, and put a propitiatory-covering over the people:

content: 48 thus did he take his stand between the dead and the living,—and the plague was restrained.
content_old: 48 thus did he take his stand between the dead and the living,—and the plague was restrained.

content: 49 And so it was､ that they who died in the plague were fourteen thousand､ and seven hundred,—besides them who died over the matter of Korah.
content_old: 49 And so it was､ that they who died in the plague were fourteen thousand､ and seven hundred,—besides them who died over the matter of Korah.

content: 1 Then spake Yahweh unto Moses､ saying:
content_old: 1 Then spake Yahweh unto Moses､ saying:

content: 2 Speak unto the sons of Israel､ and take of them､ one staff each for an ancestral house､ of all their princes､ by their ancestral houses, twelve staves,—each man’s name shalt thou write upon his staff;
content_old: 2 Speak unto the sons of Israel､ and take of them､ one staff each for an ancestral house､ of all their princes､ by their ancestral houses, twelve staves,—each man’s name shalt thou write upon his staff;

content: 3 and Aaron’s name shalt thou write upon the staff of Levi,—for one staff shall there be for the head of their ancestral house.
content_old: 3 and Aaron’s name shalt thou write upon the staff of Levi,—for one staff shall there be for the head of their ancestral house.

content: 4 Then shalt thou lay them up in the tent of meeting,—before the testimony､ where I meet with you.
content_old: 4 Then shalt thou lay them up in the tent of meeting,—before the testimony､ where I meet with you.

content: 5 So shall it come to pass､ that the man whom I shall choose his staff shall bud,—so will I cause to cease from against me the murmurings of the sons of Israel, wherewith they are murmuring against you.
content_old: 5 So shall it come to pass､ that the man whom I shall choose his staff shall bud,—so will I cause to cease from against me the murmurings of the sons of Israel, wherewith they are murmuring against you.

content: 6 And Moses spake unto the sons of Israel､ and every one of their princes gave unto him a staff apiece､ for each prince by their ancestral houses, twelve staves,—and the staff of Aaron was in the midst of their staves.
content_old: 6 And Moses spake unto the sons of Israel､ and every one of their princes gave unto him a staff apiece､ for each prince by their ancestral houses, twelve staves,—and the staff of Aaron was in the midst of their staves.

content: 7 So Moses laid up the staves before Yahweh,—in the tent of the testimony.
content_old: 7 So Moses laid up the staves before Yahweh,—in the tent of the testimony.

content: 8 And it came to pass on the morrow､ that Moses entered into the tent of the testimony; and lo! the staff of Aaron for the house of Levi had budded,—yea it had brought forth buds､ and bloomed blossoms, and borne ripe almonds.
