content_old: 8 And it came to pass on the morrow､ that Moses entered into the tent of the testimony; and lo! the staff of Aaron for the house of Levi had budded,—yea it had brought forth buds､ and bloomed blossoms, and borne ripe almonds.

content: 9 So then Moses brought forth all the staves､ from before Yahweh, unto all the sons of Israel,—and they saw and took､ each man his own staff.
content_old: 9 So then Moses brought forth all the staves､ from before Yahweh, unto all the sons of Israel,—and they saw and took､ each man his own staff.

content: 10 And Yahweh said unto Moses— Put back the rod of Aaron､ before the testimony, to be kept as a sign unto such as are perverse,—that thou mayest bring to an end their murmurings against me､ that they die not.
content_old: 10 And Yahweh said unto Moses— Put back the rod of Aaron､ before the testimony, to be kept as a sign unto such as are perverse,—that thou mayest bring to an end their murmurings against me､ that they die not.

content: 11 Thus did Moses,—as Yahweh commanded him so did he.
content_old: 11 Thus did Moses,—as Yahweh commanded him so did he.

content: 12 Then spake the sons of Israel unto Moses､ saying: Lo! we have breathed our last—we are lost､ we are all lost:
content_old: 12 Then spake the sons of Israel unto Moses､ saying: Lo! we have breathed our last—we are lost､ we are all lost:

content: 1 And Yahweh said unto Aaron, Thou､ and thy sons､ and the house of thy father with thee shall bear the iniquity of the sanctuary,—and thou､ and thy sons with thee shall bear the iniquity of your priesthood.
content_old: 1 And Yahweh said unto Aaron, Thou､ and thy sons､ and the house of thy father with thee shall bear the iniquity of the sanctuary,—and thou､ and thy sons with thee shall bear the iniquity of your priesthood.

content: 2 Therefore also thy brethren of the tribe of Levi､ the stem of thy father bring thou near with thee, and let them be joined unto thee､ and let them wait upon thee,—both on thee and on thy sons with thee, before the tent of the testimony.
content_old: 2 Therefore also thy brethren of the tribe of Levi､ the stem of thy father bring thou near with thee, and let them be joined unto thee､ and let them wait upon thee,—both on thee and on thy sons with thee, before the tent of the testimony.

content: 3 So shall they keep thy charge, and the charge of all the tent,—only unto the vessels of the sanctuary､ and unto the altar shall they not come near, lest they die—both they､ and ye.
content_old: 3 So shall they keep thy charge, and the charge of all the tent,—only unto the vessels of the sanctuary､ and unto the altar shall they not come near, lest they die—both they､ and ye.

content: 4 So shall they be joined unto thee, and shall keep the charge of the tent of meeting, as to all the laborious work of the tent,—but a stranger shall not come near unto you.
content_old: 4 So shall they be joined unto thee, and shall keep the charge of the tent of meeting, as to all the laborious work of the tent,—but a stranger shall not come near unto you.

content: 5 So shall ye keep the charge of the sanctuary, and the charge of the altar,—that there no more be wrath against the sons of Israel.
content_old: 5 So shall ye keep the charge of the sanctuary, and the charge of the altar,—that there no more be wrath against the sons of Israel.

content: 6 I therefore､ lo! I have taken your brethren the Levites, out of the midst of the sons of Israel,—unto you as a gift are they given､ unto Yahweh, to do the laborious work of the tent of meeting.
content_old: 6 I therefore､ lo! I have taken your brethren the Levites, out of the midst of the sons of Israel,—unto you as a gift are they given､ unto Yahweh, to do the laborious work of the tent of meeting.

content: 7 But thou and thy sons with thee shall keep the charge of your priesthood､ as to every matter of the altar､ and as to the interior of the veil, and shall do the laborious work.—as a laborious service of gifts do I give your priesthood, and the stranger who cometh near shall be put to death.
content_old: 7 But thou and thy sons with thee shall keep the charge of your priesthood､ as to every matter of the altar､ and as to the interior of the veil, and shall do the laborious work.—as a laborious service of gifts do I give your priesthood, and the stranger who cometh near shall be put to death.

content: 8 And Yahweh spake unto Aaron, l､ therefore､ lo! I have given unto thee the charge of my heave-offerings,—as to all the hallowed things of the sons of Israel—unto thee have I given them､ as pertaining to the anointing､ and unto thy sons､ for a statute age-abiding.
content_old: 8 And Yahweh spake unto Aaron, l､ therefore､ lo! I have given unto thee the charge of my heave-offerings,—as to all the hallowed things of the sons of Israel—unto thee have I given them､ as pertaining to the anointing､ and unto thy sons､ for a statute age-abiding.

content: 9 This shall be thine､ out of the things most holy､ out of the fire,—their every oblation—to the extent of their every meal-offering､ and their every sin-bearer､ and their every guilt-bearer wherewith they make amends unto me, most holy unto thee shall it be､ and unto thy sons.
content_old: 9 This shall be thine､ out of the things most holy､ out of the fire,—their every oblation—to the extent of their every meal-offering､ and their every sin-bearer､ and their every guilt-bearer wherewith they make amends unto me, most holy unto thee shall it be､ and unto thy sons.

content: 10 As something most holy shall ye eat it,—every male shall eat it, holy shall it be unto thee.
content_old: 10 As something most holy shall ye eat it,—every male shall eat it, holy shall it be unto thee.

content: 11 This､ therefore､ shall be thine—the heave-offering of their gift､ even all the wave-offerings of the sons of Israel, unto thee have I given them､ and unto thy sons and unto thy daughters with thee､ by a statute age-abiding,—every one that is clean in thy house shall eat it.
content_old: 11 This､ therefore､ shall be thine—the heave-offering of their gift､ even all the wave-offerings of the sons of Israel, unto thee have I given them､ and unto thy sons and unto thy daughters with thee､ by a statute age-abiding,—every one that is clean in thy house shall eat it.

content: 12 All the best of oil, and all the best of new-wine and corn,—the firstfruits thereof､ which they shall give unto Yahweh unto thee have I given them.
content_old: 12 All the best of oil, and all the best of new-wine and corn,—the firstfruits thereof､ which they shall give unto Yahweh unto thee have I given them.

content: 13 The firstfruits of all that is in their land､ which they shall bring in unto Yahweh thine shall it be,—every one that is clean in thy house shall eat it:
content_old: 13 The firstfruits of all that is in their land､ which they shall bring in unto Yahweh thine shall it be,—every one that is clean in thy house shall eat it:

content: 14 every devoted thing in Israel thine shall it be:
content_old: 14 every devoted thing in Israel thine shall it be:

content: 15 every thing that is born first—of all flesh that may be offered unto Yahweh､ among men and among beasts shall be thine,—only thou shalt redeem the firstborn of men, and the firstborn of unclean beasts shalt thou redeem.
content_old: 15 every thing that is born first—of all flesh that may be offered unto Yahweh､ among men and among beasts shall be thine,—only thou shalt redeem the firstborn of men, and the firstborn of unclean beasts shalt thou redeem.

content: 16 And as to the redemption price thereof from a month old shalt thou redeem, by thine estimate､ five shekels of silver､ by the shekel of the sanctuary,—twenty gerahs it is.
content_old: 16 And as to the redemption price thereof from a month old shalt thou redeem, by thine estimate､ five shekels of silver､ by the shekel of the sanctuary,—twenty gerahs it is.

content: 17 Only a firstling ox or a firstling sheep or a firstling goat shalt thou not redeem､hallowed they are,—their blood shalt thou dash against the altar､ and of their fat shalt thou make a perfume, an altar-flame､ for a satisfying odour unto Yahweh:
content_old: 17 Only a firstling ox or a firstling sheep or a firstling goat shalt thou not redeem､hallowed they are,—their blood shalt thou dash against the altar､ and of their fat shalt thou make a perfume, an altar-flame､ for a satisfying odour unto Yahweh:

content: 18 and their flesh shall be thine,—as the wave-breast and as the right leg thine shall it be:
content_old: 18 and their flesh shall be thine,—as the wave-breast and as the right leg thine shall it be:

content: 19 all the heave-offerings of the holy things､ which the sons of Israel shall heave up unto Yahweh have I given unto thee､ and unto thy sons and unto thy daughters with thee､ by a statute age-abiding,—an age-abiding covenant of salt it is､ before Yahweh, for thee､ and for thy seed with thee.
content_old: 19 all the heave-offerings of the holy things､ which the sons of Israel shall heave up unto Yahweh have I given unto thee､ and unto thy sons and unto thy daughters with thee､ by a statute age-abiding,—an age-abiding covenant of salt it is､ before Yahweh, for thee､ and for thy seed with thee.

content: 20 Then said Yahweh unto Aaron: In their land thou shalt have no inheritance, and no allotted portion shalt thou have､ in their midst,—I am thine allotted portion and thine inheritance､ in the midst of the sons of Israel.
content_old: 20 Then said Yahweh unto Aaron: In their land thou shalt have no inheritance, and no allotted portion shalt thou have､ in their midst,—I am thine allotted portion and thine inheritance､ in the midst of the sons of Israel.

content: 21 And unto the sons of Levi lo! I have given all the tenth in Israel､ for an inheritance,—the allotted portion for their laborious work which they are performing, the laborious work of the tent of meeting:
content_old: 21 And unto the sons of Levi lo! I have given all the tenth in Israel､ for an inheritance,—the allotted portion for their laborious work which they are performing, the laborious work of the tent of meeting:

content: 22 that the sons of Israel come near no more､ unto the tent of meeting,—to bear sin､ to die.
content_old: 22 that the sons of Israel come near no more､ unto the tent of meeting,—to bear sin､ to die.

content: 23 So shall the Levites themselves perform the laborious work of the tent of meeting, and they shall bear their iniquity, a statute age-abiding､ unto your generations, and in the midst of the sons of Israel shall they take no inheritance.
content_old: 23 So shall the Levites themselves perform the laborious work of the tent of meeting, and they shall bear their iniquity, a statute age-abiding､ unto your generations, and in the midst of the sons of Israel shall they take no inheritance.

content: 24 Because the tenth of the sons of Israel､ which they shall offer up unto Yahweh as a heave-offering have I given unto the Levites､ as an inheritance,—for this cause said I regarding them, In the midst of the sons of Israel shall they take no inheritance.
content_old: 24 Because the tenth of the sons of Israel､ which they shall offer up unto Yahweh as a heave-offering have I given unto the Levites､ as an inheritance,—for this cause said I regarding them, In the midst of the sons of Israel shall they take no inheritance.

content: 25 Then spake Yahweh unto Moses､ saying:
content_old: 25 Then spake Yahweh unto Moses､ saying:

content: 26 Unto the Levites therefore､ shalt thou speak､ and shalt say unto them, When ye shall take of the sons of Israel the tenth which I have given unto you from them､ as your inheritance then shall ye offer up therefrom the heave-offering of Yahweh, a tenth of the tenth.
content_old: 26 Unto the Levites therefore､ shalt thou speak､ and shalt say unto them, When ye shall take of the sons of Israel the tenth which I have given unto you from them､ as your inheritance then shall ye offer up therefrom the heave-offering of Yahweh, a tenth of the tenth.

content: 27 So shall your heave-offering be reckoned your own,—as corn out of the threshing-floor, and as the abundance､ out of the wine-press.
content_old: 27 So shall your heave-offering be reckoned your own,—as corn out of the threshing-floor, and as the abundance､ out of the wine-press.

content: 28 Thus shall ye also offer up the heave-offering of Yahweh, out of all your tenths which ye shall take from the sons of Israel,—and give therefrom the heave-offering of Yahweh, unto Aaron､ the priest.
content_old: 28 Thus shall ye also offer up the heave-offering of Yahweh, out of all your tenths which ye shall take from the sons of Israel,—and give therefrom the heave-offering of Yahweh, unto Aaron､ the priest.

content: 29 Out of all your gifts shall ye offer up every heave-offering of Yahweh,—out of all the best thereof, the hallowed part thereof､ out of it.
content_old: 29 Out of all your gifts shall ye offer up every heave-offering of Yahweh,—out of all the best thereof, the hallowed part thereof､ out of it.

content: 30 And thou shalt say unto them,— When ye offer the best thereof､ out of it then shall it be reckoned to belong unto the Levites, as the increase of the threshing-floor､ and as the increase of the wine-press.
content_old: 30 And thou shalt say unto them,— When ye offer the best thereof､ out of it then shall it be reckoned to belong unto the Levites, as the increase of the threshing-floor､ and as the increase of the wine-press.

content: 31 And ye shall eat it in any place, ye､ and your household,—for a reward it is､ unto you, the allotted portion for your laborious work in the tent of meeting.
content_old: 31 And ye shall eat it in any place, ye､ and your household,—for a reward it is､ unto you, the allotted portion for your laborious work in the tent of meeting.

content: 1 And Yahweh spake unto Moses and unto Aaron､ saying:
content_old: 1 And Yahweh spake unto Moses and unto Aaron､ saying:

content: 2 This is the statute of the law, which Yahweh hath commanded, saying,— Speak unto the sons of Israel—That they bring unto thee a red heifer､ without defect､ wherein is no blemish, and whereupon hath come no yoke.
content_old: 2 This is the statute of the law, which Yahweh hath commanded, saying,— Speak unto the sons of Israel—That they bring unto thee a red heifer､ without defect､ wherein is no blemish, and whereupon hath come no yoke.

content: 3 Then shall ye give her unto Eleazar the priest, and he shall take her forth unto the outside of the camp, and she shall be slain､ before him;
content_old: 3 Then shall ye give her unto Eleazar the priest, and he shall take her forth unto the outside of the camp, and she shall be slain､ before him;

content: 4 and Eleazar the priest shall take of her blood､ with his finger,—and shall sprinkle､ towards the front of the tent of meeting､ of her blood､ seven times;
content_old: 4 and Eleazar the priest shall take of her blood､ with his finger,—and shall sprinkle､ towards the front of the tent of meeting､ of her blood､ seven times;

content: 5 and the heifer shall be burned up before his eyes,—her skin､ and her flesh､ and her blood､ with her dung shall be burned up.
content_old: 5 and the heifer shall be burned up before his eyes,—her skin､ and her flesh､ and her blood､ with her dung shall be burned up.

content: 6 Then shall the priest take cedar-wood､ and hyssop and crimson,—and cast into the midst of the burning up of the heifer.
content_old: 6 Then shall the priest take cedar-wood､ and hyssop and crimson,—and cast into the midst of the burning up of the heifer.

content: 7 And the priest shall wash his clothes､ and bathe his flesh in water, and afterwards come into the camp,—but the priest shall be unclean until the evening.
content_old: 7 And the priest shall wash his clothes､ and bathe his flesh in water, and afterwards come into the camp,—but the priest shall be unclean until the evening.

content: 8 And he that burneth her shall wash his clothes in water, and bathe his flesh in water,—and be unclean､ until the evening.
content_old: 8 And he that burneth her shall wash his clothes in water, and bathe his flesh in water,—and be unclean､ until the evening.

content: 9 Then shall a man that is clean gather up the ashes of the heifer, and put them by､ outside the camp､ in a clean place,—so shall they be for the assembly of the sons of Israel､ to keep for water of separation､ it is a taking away of sin.
content_old: 9 Then shall a man that is clean gather up the ashes of the heifer, and put them by､ outside the camp､ in a clean place,—so shall they be for the assembly of the sons of Israel､ to keep for water of separation､ it is a taking away of sin.

content: 10 Then shall he that gathered up the ashes wash his clothes, and be unclean until the evening,—so shall it be for the sons of Israel､ and for the sojourner that sojourneth in your midst､ by a statute age-abiding.
content_old: 10 Then shall he that gathered up the ashes wash his clothes, and be unclean until the evening,—so shall it be for the sons of Israel､ and for the sojourner that sojourneth in your midst､ by a statute age-abiding.

content: 11 He that toucheth the dead､ even any human person shall be unclean seven days.
content_old: 11 He that toucheth the dead､ even any human person shall be unclean seven days.

content: 12 He shall cleanse himself from sin therewith､ on the third day､ then on the seventh day shall he be clean,—but if he cleanse not himself from sin on the third day then on the seventh day shall he not be clean.
content_old: 12 He shall cleanse himself from sin therewith､ on the third day､ then on the seventh day shall he be clean,—but if he cleanse not himself from sin on the third day then on the seventh day shall he not be clean.

content: 13 Whosoever toucheth the dead､ the person of the human being that dieth､ and doth not cleanse himself from sin the habitation of Yahweh hath he made unclean; that person､ therefore､ shall be cut off out of Israel,—because the water of separation was not dashed upon him unclean shall he be, his uncleanness is yet upon him.
content_old: 13 Whosoever toucheth the dead､ the person of the human being that dieth､ and doth not cleanse himself from sin the habitation of Yahweh hath he made unclean; that person､ therefore､ shall be cut off out of Israel,—because the water of separation was not dashed upon him unclean shall he be, his uncleanness is yet upon him.

content: 14 This is the law—When a human being shall die in a tent every one who goeth into the tent､ and every one who is in the tent shall be unclean､ seven days.
content_old: 14 This is the law—When a human being shall die in a tent every one who goeth into the tent､ and every one who is in the tent shall be unclean､ seven days.

content: 15 And in the case of every open vessel, on which no cover is fastened unclean it is.
content_old: 15 And in the case of every open vessel, on which no cover is fastened unclean it is.

content: 16 And whosoever toucheth､ on the face of the field､ one slain with a sword､ or one who hath died, or a human bone､ or a grave shall be unclean､ seven days.
content_old: 16 And whosoever toucheth､ on the face of the field､ one slain with a sword､ or one who hath died, or a human bone､ or a grave shall be unclean､ seven days.

content: 17 And they shall take､ for him that is unclean, of the ashes of the burning of the sin-bearer,—and living water shall be put thereon､ in a vessel.
content_old: 17 And they shall take､ for him that is unclean, of the ashes of the burning of the sin-bearer,—and living water shall be put thereon､ in a vessel.

content: 18 Then shall a man that is clean take hyssop, and dip in the water, and sprinkle upon the tent､ and upon all the vessels, and upon the persons who were there,—and upon him that touched the bone､ or him who had been slain, or him who had died of himself､ or the grave;
content_old: 18 Then shall a man that is clean take hyssop, and dip in the water, and sprinkle upon the tent､ and upon all the vessels, and upon the persons who were there,—and upon him that touched the bone､ or him who had been slain, or him who had died of himself､ or the grave;

content: 19 and the clean person shall sprinkle upon the unclean, on the third day､ and on the seventh day,—so shall he cleanse himself from sin､ on the seventh day, and shall wash his clothes､ and bathe in water､ and be clean in the evening.
content_old: 19 and the clean person shall sprinkle upon the unclean, on the third day､ and on the seventh day,—so shall he cleanse himself from sin､ on the seventh day, and shall wash his clothes､ and bathe in water､ and be clean in the evening.

content: 20 But in the case of the man who shall be unclean and shall not cleanse himself from sin that person shall be cut off､ out of the midst of the convocation,—for the sanctuary of Yahweh hath he made unclean､the water of separation hath not been dashed upon him､ unclean he is.
content_old: 20 But in the case of the man who shall be unclean and shall not cleanse himself from sin that person shall be cut off､ out of the midst of the convocation,—for the sanctuary of Yahweh hath he made unclean､the water of separation hath not been dashed upon him､ unclean he is.

content: 21 So shall it be unto them for a statute age-abiding,—and he that sprinkleth the water of separation shall wash his clothes, and he that toucheth the water of separation shall be unclean until the evening;
content_old: 21 So shall it be unto them for a statute age-abiding,—and he that sprinkleth the water of separation shall wash his clothes, and he that toucheth the water of separation shall be unclean until the evening;

content: 1 Then came the sons of Israel､ the whole assembly､ into the desert of Zin､ in the first month, and the people dwelt in Kadesh,—and Miriam died there, and was buried there.
content_old: 1 Then came the sons of Israel､ the whole assembly､ into the desert of Zin､ in the first month, and the people dwelt in Kadesh,—and Miriam died there, and was buried there.

content: 2 And there was no water for the assembly,—so they gathered together against Moses､ and against Aaron.
content_old: 2 And there was no water for the assembly,—so they gathered together against Moses､ and against Aaron.

content: 3 And the people contended with Moses,—and spake､ saying, Would､ then､ we had died when our brethren died､ before Yahweh!
content_old: 3 And the people contended with Moses,—and spake､ saying, Would､ then､ we had died when our brethren died､ before Yahweh!

content: 4 Wherefore then､ hast thou brought the convocation of Yahweh into this desert,—to die there, we､ and our cattle?
content_old: 4 Wherefore then､ hast thou brought the convocation of Yahweh into this desert,—to die there, we､ and our cattle?

content: 5 And wherefore did ye cause us to come up out of Egypt, to bring us into this wretched place?—not a place of seeds､ and figs､ and vines､ and pomegranates! even water is there none to drink.
content_old: 5 And wherefore did ye cause us to come up out of Egypt, to bring us into this wretched place?—not a place of seeds､ and figs､ and vines､ and pomegranates! even water is there none to drink.

content: 6 And Moses and Aaron went in､ from the presence of the multitude unto the entrance of the tent of meeting, and fell upon their faces,—and the glory of Yahweh appeared unto them.
content_old: 6 And Moses and Aaron went in､ from the presence of the multitude unto the entrance of the tent of meeting, and fell upon their faces,—and the glory of Yahweh appeared unto them.

content: 7 Then spake Yahweh unto Moses､ saying:
content_old: 7 Then spake Yahweh unto Moses､ saying:

content: 8 Take the staff､ and gather together the assembly､thou､ and Aaron thy brother, then shall ye speak unto the cliff､ before their eyes､ and it shall give forth its waters,—so shalt thou bring forth unto them water､ out of the cliff, and shalt cause the assembly､ and their cattle､ to drink.
content_old: 8 Take the staff､ and gather together the assembly､thou､ and Aaron thy brother, then shall ye speak unto the cliff､ before their eyes､ and it shall give forth its waters,—so shalt thou bring forth unto them water､ out of the cliff, and shalt cause the assembly､ and their cattle､ to drink.

content: 9 And Moses took the staff､ from before Yahweh,—as he commanded him.
content_old: 9 And Moses took the staff､ from before Yahweh,—as he commanded him.

content: 10 And Moses and Aaron gathered together the convocation､ before the cliff,—and he said unto them: Hear､ I pray you､ ye rebels! Out of this cliff must we bring forth for you､ water?
content_old: 10 And Moses and Aaron gathered together the convocation､ before the cliff,—and he said unto them: Hear､ I pray you､ ye rebels! Out of this cliff must we bring forth for you､ water?

content: 11 And Moses lifted high his hand､ and smote the cliff､ with his staff､ twice,—and there came forth water in abundance, and the assembly and their cattle did drink.
content_old: 11 And Moses lifted high his hand､ and smote the cliff､ with his staff､ twice,—and there came forth water in abundance, and the assembly and their cattle did drink.

content: 12 Then said Yahweh unto Moses and unto Aaron, Because ye believed not in me, to hallow me in the eyes of the sons of Israel therefore shall ye not bring in this convocation into the land which I have given unto them.
content_old: 12 Then said Yahweh unto Moses and unto Aaron, Because ye believed not in me, to hallow me in the eyes of the sons of Israel therefore shall ye not bring in this convocation into the land which I have given unto them.

content: 13 The same were the waters of Meribah that is “Contention” in that the sons of Israel contended with Yahweh,—and so he hallowed himself among them.
content_old: 13 The same were the waters of Meribah that is “Contention” in that the sons of Israel contended with Yahweh,—and so he hallowed himself among them.

content: 14 And Moses sent messengers from Kadesh､ unto the king of Edom,— Thus saith thy brother Israel, Thou thyself knowest all the distress which befell us;
content_old: 14 And Moses sent messengers from Kadesh､ unto the king of Edom,— Thus saith thy brother Israel, Thou thyself knowest all the distress which befell us;

content: 15 and how our fathers went down to Egypt, and we abode in Egypt､ many days,—and that the Egyptians ill-treated us､ and our fathers;
content_old: 15 and how our fathers went down to Egypt, and we abode in Egypt､ many days,—and that the Egyptians ill-treated us､ and our fathers;

content: 16 and we made outcry unto Yahweh､ and he heard our voice, and sent a messenger, and brought us forth out of Egypt,—lo! then､we are in Kadesh, a city at the extremity of thy boundary.
content_old: 16 and we made outcry unto Yahweh､ and he heard our voice, and sent a messenger, and brought us forth out of Egypt,—lo! then､we are in Kadesh, a city at the extremity of thy boundary.

content: 17 Let us､ we pray thee､ pass through thy land—we will not pass through field or vineyard, nor will we drink the waters of a well,—by the king’s road will we go—we will turn neither to the right hand nor to the left, until we get through thy boundary.
content_old: 17 Let us､ we pray thee､ pass through thy land—we will not pass through field or vineyard, nor will we drink the waters of a well,—by the king’s road will we go—we will turn neither to the right hand nor to the left, until we get through thy boundary.

content: 18 And Edom said unto him, Thou shalt not pass through my land,—lest with the sword I come out to meet thee.
content_old: 18 And Edom said unto him, Thou shalt not pass through my land,—lest with the sword I come out to meet thee.

content: 19 And the sons of Israel said unto him— By the highway will we go up, and if thy waters we should drink—I, and my cattle then would I give the price thereof,—only—it is nothing!—with my feet would I pass through.
content_old: 19 And the sons of Israel said unto him— By the highway will we go up, and if thy waters we should drink—I, and my cattle then would I give the price thereof,—only—it is nothing!—with my feet would I pass through.

content: 20 And he said､ Thou shalt not pass through. And Edom came out to meet him, with a strong people､ and with a firm hand.
content_old: 20 And he said､ Thou shalt not pass through. And Edom came out to meet him, with a strong people､ and with a firm hand.

content: 21 Thus did Edom refuse to give Israel passage through his boundary.—and Israel turned away from him.
content_old: 21 Thus did Edom refuse to give Israel passage through his boundary.—and Israel turned away from him.

content: 22 Then set they forward from Kadesh,—and the sons of Israel､ all the assembly､ came in to Mount Hor.
content_old: 22 Then set they forward from Kadesh,—and the sons of Israel､ all the assembly､ came in to Mount Hor.

content: 23 Then spake Yahweh unto Moses and unto Aaron､ in Mount Hor,—near the boundary of the land of Edom､ saying:
content_old: 23 Then spake Yahweh unto Moses and unto Aaron､ in Mount Hor,—near the boundary of the land of Edom､ saying:

content: 24 Aaron shall be withdrawn unto his kinsfolk, for he shall not enter into the land､ which I have given unto the sons of Israel,—because ye spurned my bidding､ at the waters of Meribah.
content_old: 24 Aaron shall be withdrawn unto his kinsfolk, for he shall not enter into the land､ which I have given unto the sons of Israel,—because ye spurned my bidding､ at the waters of Meribah.

content: 25 Take thou Aaron, and Eleazar his son,—and bring them up Mount Hor;
content_old: 25 Take thou Aaron, and Eleazar his son,—and bring them up Mount Hor;

content: 26 and strip thou Aaron of his garments, and put them upon Eleazar his son,—and Aaron shall be withdrawn､ and shall die there.
content_old: 26 and strip thou Aaron of his garments, and put them upon Eleazar his son,—and Aaron shall be withdrawn､ and shall die there.

content: 27 And Moses did as Yahweh commanded,—and they went up into Mount Hor, in sight of all the assembly.
content_old: 27 And Moses did as Yahweh commanded,—and they went up into Mount Hor, in sight of all the assembly.

content: 28 And Moses stripped Aaron of his garments､ and put them upon Eleazar his son, and Aaron died there､ in the top of the mount,—and Moses and Eleazar came down out of the mount.
content_old: 28 And Moses stripped Aaron of his garments､ and put them upon Eleazar his son, and Aaron died there､ in the top of the mount,—and Moses and Eleazar came down out of the mount.

content: 1 And the Canaanite､ the king of Arad､ who dwelt in the South, heard that Israel had entered by the way of Atharim,—so he made war with Israel, and took some of them captive.
content_old: 1 And the Canaanite､ the king of Arad､ who dwelt in the South, heard that Israel had entered by the way of Atharim,—so he made war with Israel, and took some of them captive.

content: 2 Then Israel vowed a vow unto Yahweh, and said,— If thou wilt surely deliver up this people into my hand then will I utterly destroy their cities.
content_old: 2 Then Israel vowed a vow unto Yahweh, and said,— If thou wilt surely deliver up this people into my hand then will I utterly destroy their cities.

content: 3 And Yahweh hearkened unto the voice of Israel､ and delivered up the Canaanite into his hand, so he utterly destroyed them､ and their cities,—and called the name of the place Hormah that is, “Utter Destruction”.
content_old: 3 And Yahweh hearkened unto the voice of Israel､ and delivered up the Canaanite into his hand, so he utterly destroyed them､ and their cities,—and called the name of the place Hormah that is, “Utter Destruction”.

content: 4 Then brake they up from Mount Hor, by way of the Red Sea, to go round the land of Edom,—and the soul of the people became impatient because of the way.
content_old: 4 Then brake they up from Mount Hor, by way of the Red Sea, to go round the land of Edom,—and the soul of the people became impatient because of the way.

content: 5 So then the people spake against God､ and against Moses, Wherefore have ye brought us up out of Egypt, to die in the desert? for there is neither bread､ nor water, and our soul doth loathe this contemptible bread!
content_old: 5 So then the people spake against God､ and against Moses, Wherefore have ye brought us up out of Egypt, to die in the desert? for there is neither bread､ nor water, and our soul doth loathe this contemptible bread!

content: 6 And Yahweh sent among the people the poisonous serpents, and they bit the people,—and much people out of Israel died.
content_old: 6 And Yahweh sent among the people the poisonous serpents, and they bit the people,—and much people out of Israel died.

content: 7 Then came the people of Israel unto Moses､ and said— We have sinned､ in that we spake against Yahweh and against thee, Pray thou unto Yahweh, that he may take from us the serpent. So Moses prayed for the people.
content_old: 7 Then came the people of Israel unto Moses､ and said— We have sinned､ in that we spake against Yahweh and against thee, Pray thou unto Yahweh, that he may take from us the serpent. So Moses prayed for the people.

content: 8 Then said Yahweh unto Moses— Make thee a like serpent, and put it upon a standard,—and it shall come to pass､ that any one who is bitten as soon as he seeth it shall live.
content_old: 8 Then said Yahweh unto Moses— Make thee a like serpent, and put it upon a standard,—and it shall come to pass､ that any one who is bitten as soon as he seeth it shall live.

content: 9 So Moses made a serpent of bronze, and put it upon the standard,—and it came to pass—that if the serpent had bitten any man as soon as he directed his look unto the serpent of bronze he lived.
content_old: 9 So Moses made a serpent of bronze, and put it upon the standard,—and it came to pass—that if the serpent had bitten any man as soon as he directed his look unto the serpent of bronze he lived.

content: 10 And the sons of Israel brake up,—and encamped in Oboth.
content_old: 10 And the sons of Israel brake up,—and encamped in Oboth.

content: 11 And they brake up from Oboth,—and encamped in Ije-Abarim､ in the desert which is over against Moab, towards the rising of the sun.
content_old: 11 And they brake up from Oboth,—and encamped in Ije-Abarim､ in the desert which is over against Moab, towards the rising of the sun.

content: 12 From thence brake they up,—and encamped in the ravine of Zered.
content_old: 12 From thence brake they up,—and encamped in the ravine of Zered.

content: 13 From thence brake they up､ and encamped on the other side of Arnon which is in the desert, that cometh forth out of the boundary of the Amorites,—for Arnon is the boundary of Moab, between Moab and the Amorites.
content_old: 13 From thence brake they up､ and encamped on the other side of Arnon which is in the desert, that cometh forth out of the boundary of the Amorites,—for Arnon is the boundary of Moab, between Moab and the Amorites.

content: 14 For this cause is it said, in the Book of the Wars of Yahweh,— … Waheb with a hurricane, And the ravines of Arnon;
content_old: 14 For this cause is it said, in the Book of the Wars of Yahweh,— … Waheb with a hurricane, And the ravines of Arnon;

content: 15 And the bottom of the ravines, that extendeth toward the dwelling of Ar,— And adjoineth to the boundary of Moab,
content_old: 15 And the bottom of the ravines, that extendeth toward the dwelling of Ar,— And adjoineth to the boundary of Moab,

content: 16 And from thence towards Beer,—the same is the well､ whereof Yahweh said unto Moses, Gather together the people, that I may give them water.
content_old: 16 And from thence towards Beer,—the same is the well､ whereof Yahweh said unto Moses, Gather together the people, that I may give them water.

content: 17 Then sang Israel this song,— Spring thou up､ O well! Respond ye thereunto;
content_old: 17 Then sang Israel this song,— Spring thou up､ O well! Respond ye thereunto;

content: 18 A well!—princes digged it､ Nobles of the people delved it, With a sceptre､ With their staves. And from the desert to Mattanah;
content_old: 18 A well!—princes digged it､ Nobles of the people delved it, With a sceptre､ With their staves. And from the desert to Mattanah;

content: 19 and from Mattanah to Nahaliel; and from Nahaliel to Bamoth;
content_old: 19 and from Mattanah to Nahaliel; and from Nahaliel to Bamoth;

content: 20 and from Bamoth of the valley､ which is in the field-country of Moab to the top of Pisgah,—which over-looketh Jeshimon.
content_old: 20 and from Bamoth of the valley､ which is in the field-country of Moab to the top of Pisgah,—which over-looketh Jeshimon.

content: 21 Then sent Israel､ messengers, unto Sihon king of the Amorites､ saying:
content_old: 21 Then sent Israel､ messengers, unto Sihon king of the Amorites､ saying:

content: 22 Let me pass through thy land—we will not turn aside into field or into vineyard, nor will we drink the water of a well,—by the king’s road will we go, until we get through thy boundary.
content_old: 22 Let me pass through thy land—we will not turn aside into field or into vineyard, nor will we drink the water of a well,—by the king’s road will we go, until we get through thy boundary.

content: 23 And Sihon suffered not Israel to pass through his boundary, but Sihon gathered together all his people､ and came forth to meet Israel､ towards the desert, and entered Jahaz,—and fought with Israel.
content_old: 23 And Sihon suffered not Israel to pass through his boundary, but Sihon gathered together all his people､ and came forth to meet Israel､ towards the desert, and entered Jahaz,—and fought with Israel.

content: 24 And Israel smote him with the edge of the sword,—and took possession of his land､ from Arnon unto Jabbok､ unto the sons of Ammon, for strong was the boundary of the sons of Ammon.
content_old: 24 And Israel smote him with the edge of the sword,—and took possession of his land､ from Arnon unto Jabbok､ unto the sons of Ammon, for strong was the boundary of the sons of Ammon.

content: 25 So Israel took all these cities,—and Israel dwelt in all the cities of the Amorites, in Heshbon､ and in all her villages;
content_old: 25 So Israel took all these cities,—and Israel dwelt in all the cities of the Amorites, in Heshbon､ and in all her villages;

content: 26 for as for Heshbon the city of Sihon king of the Amorites it was,—he having fought with the former king of Moab, and taken all his land out of his hand､ unto Arnon.
content_old: 26 for as for Heshbon the city of Sihon king of the Amorites it was,—he having fought with the former king of Moab, and taken all his land out of his hand､ unto Arnon.

content: 27 For this cause say the poets— Enter ye Heshbon,— Built and prepared be the city of Sihon;
content_old: 27 For this cause say the poets— Enter ye Heshbon,— Built and prepared be the city of Sihon;

content: 28 For a fire hath come forth out of Heshbon, A flame out of the stronghold of Sihon; It hath consumed Ar of Moab, The lords of the high places of Arnon.
content_old: 28 For a fire hath come forth out of Heshbon, A flame out of the stronghold of Sihon; It hath consumed Ar of Moab, The lords of the high places of Arnon.

content: 29 Woe to thee､ Moab, Thou art lost､ O people of Chemosh,— He hath given up his sons as fugitives And his daughters into captivity, Unto the king of the Amorites､ Sihon.
content_old: 29 Woe to thee､ Moab, Thou art lost､ O people of Chemosh,— He hath given up his sons as fugitives And his daughters into captivity, Unto the king of the Amorites､ Sihon.

content: 30 Then we shot them— Heshbon is destroyed､ as far as Dibon,— Then laid we waste as far as Nophah, A fire reacheth unto Medeba.
content_old: 30 Then we shot them— Heshbon is destroyed､ as far as Dibon,— Then laid we waste as far as Nophah, A fire reacheth unto Medeba.

content: 31 So then Israel dwelt in the land of the Amorites.
content_old: 31 So then Israel dwelt in the land of the Amorites.

content: 32 And Moses sent to spy out Jazer, and they captured the villages thereof,—and dispossessed the Amorites that were there.
content_old: 32 And Moses sent to spy out Jazer, and they captured the villages thereof,—and dispossessed the Amorites that were there.

content: 33 Then turned they､ and went up by the way of Bashan,—and Og, king of Bashan, came forth to meet them—he and all his people､ to give battle at Edrei.
content_old: 33 Then turned they､ and went up by the way of Bashan,—and Og, king of Bashan, came forth to meet them—he and all his people､ to give battle at Edrei.

content: 34 Then said Yahweh unto Moses— Do not fear him, for into thy hand have I delivered him､ and all his people､ and his land,— Therefore shalt thou do unto him, as thou didst unto Sihon､ king of the Amorites, who was dwelling in Heshbon.
content_old: 34 Then said Yahweh unto Moses— Do not fear him, for into thy hand have I delivered him､ and all his people､ and his land,— Therefore shalt thou do unto him, as thou didst unto Sihon､ king of the Amorites, who was dwelling in Heshbon.

content: 1 Then did the sons of Israel break up,—and encamp in the waste plains of Moab, on the other side of the Jordan by Jericho.
content_old: 1 Then did the sons of Israel break up,—and encamp in the waste plains of Moab, on the other side of the Jordan by Jericho.

content: 2 And Balak son of Zippor saw all that Israel had done unto the Amorites;
content_old: 2 And Balak son of Zippor saw all that Israel had done unto the Amorites;

content: 3 and Moab shrank with great fear from the presence of the people､ because many they were,—and Moab was alarmed at the presence of the sons of Israel.
content_old: 3 and Moab shrank with great fear from the presence of the people､ because many they were,—and Moab was alarmed at the presence of the sons of Israel.

content: 4 So Moab said unto the elders of Midian— Now shall the gathered host lick up all that are round about us, as the ox doth lick up the verdure of the field. But Balak son of Zippor was king unto Moab at that time.
content_old: 4 So Moab said unto the elders of Midian— Now shall the gathered host lick up all that are round about us, as the ox doth lick up the verdure of the field. But Balak son of Zippor was king unto Moab at that time.

content: 5 So he sent messengers unto Balaam son of Beor､ to Pethor､ which was by the river of the land of the sons of his people､ to call him,—saying— Lo! a people hath come forth out of Egypt Lo! he hath covered the eye of the land, Yea he is tarrying over against me.
content_old: 5 So he sent messengers unto Balaam son of Beor､ to Pethor､ which was by the river of the land of the sons of his people､ to call him,—saying— Lo! a people hath come forth out of Egypt Lo! he hath covered the eye of the land, Yea he is tarrying over against me.

content: 6 Now therefore､ do come､ I pray thee､ curse me this people､ For stronger he is than I, If peradventure I prevail we shall smite him, That I may drive him out of the land,— For I know that he whom thou dost bless is to be blessed, And he whom thou dost curse is to be cursed.
content_old: 6 Now therefore､ do come､ I pray thee､ curse me this people､ For stronger he is than I, If peradventure I prevail we shall smite him, That I may drive him out of the land,— For I know that he whom thou dost bless is to be blessed, And he whom thou dost curse is to be cursed.

content: 7 And the elders of Moab and the elders of Midian､ went their way, with the rewards of divination in their hand,—so they came in unto Balaam, and spake unto him the words of Balak.
content_old: 7 And the elders of Moab and the elders of Midian､ went their way, with the rewards of divination in their hand,—so they came in unto Balaam, and spake unto him the words of Balak.

content: 8 And he said unto them— Tarry ye here for the night, and I will bring you back word, as Yahweh shall speak unto me. So the princes of Moab abode with Balaam.
content_old: 8 And he said unto them— Tarry ye here for the night, and I will bring you back word, as Yahweh shall speak unto me. So the princes of Moab abode with Balaam.

content: 9 And God came in unto Balaam,—and said, Who are these men､ with thee?
content_old: 9 And God came in unto Balaam,—and said, Who are these men､ with thee?

content: 10 Then said Balaam unto God,— Balak､ son of Zippor､ king of Moab hath sent unto me:
content_old: 10 Then said Balaam unto God,— Balak､ son of Zippor､ king of Moab hath sent unto me:

content: 11 Lo! the people that hath come forth out of Egypt—he covereth the eye of the land. Now do come､ do revile me him, Peradventure I shall prevail in making war with him､ And shall drive him out.
content_old: 11 Lo! the people that hath come forth out of Egypt—he covereth the eye of the land. Now do come､ do revile me him, Peradventure I shall prevail in making war with him､ And shall drive him out.

content: 12 And God said unto Balaam, Thou shalt not go with them,— Thou shalt not curse the people, For blessed he is.
content_old: 12 And God said unto Balaam, Thou shalt not go with them,— Thou shalt not curse the people, For blessed he is.

content: 13 And Balaam rose up in the morning, and said unto the princes of Balak, Get you into your own land,— For Yahweh hath refused to let me go with you.
content_old: 13 And Balaam rose up in the morning, and said unto the princes of Balak, Get you into your own land,— For Yahweh hath refused to let me go with you.

content: 14 So the princes of Moab arose, and came in unto Balak,—and said, Balaam refused to come with us.
content_old: 14 So the princes of Moab arose, and came in unto Balak,—and said, Balaam refused to come with us.

content: 15 Then added Balak again,—to send princes, more and weightier than these.
content_old: 15 Then added Balak again,—to send princes, more and weightier than these.

content: 16 And they came in unto Balaam,—and said unto him— Thus said Balak son of Zippor, Do not be withheld､ I pray thee､ from coming unto me:
content_old: 16 And they came in unto Balaam,—and said unto him— Thus said Balak son of Zippor, Do not be withheld､ I pray thee､ from coming unto me:

content: 17 For I will honour thee､ exceedingly, and all that thou shalt say unto me will I do. Do come therefore､ I pray thee､ oh revile me this people.
content_old: 17 For I will honour thee､ exceedingly, and all that thou shalt say unto me will I do. Do come therefore､ I pray thee､ oh revile me this people.

content: 18 And Balaam responded､ and said unto the servants of Balak, Though Balak would give me his house full of silver and gold I could not go beyond the bidding of Yahweh my God, to do less or more.
content_old: 18 And Balaam responded､ and said unto the servants of Balak, Though Balak would give me his house full of silver and gold I could not go beyond the bidding of Yahweh my God, to do less or more.

content: 19 Now therefore､ abide here､ I pray you､ even ye—for the night,—that I may get to know what further Yahweh may be speaking with me.
content_old: 19 Now therefore､ abide here､ I pray you､ even ye—for the night,—that I may get to know what further Yahweh may be speaking with me.

content: 20 And God came in unto Balaam､ by night, and said unto him— If to call thee the men have come in arise､ go with them,— But only the thing that I shall speak unto thee that shalt thou do.
content_old: 20 And God came in unto Balaam､ by night, and said unto him— If to call thee the men have come in arise､ go with them,— But only the thing that I shall speak unto thee that shalt thou do.

content: 21 So Balaam arose in the morning, and saddled his ass,—and went with the princes of Moab.
content_old: 21 So Balaam arose in the morning, and saddled his ass,—and went with the princes of Moab.

content: 22 Then kindled the anger of God, because he was going, and the messenger of Yahweh stationed himself in the way､ to withstand him,—as he was riding upon his ass, his two young men being with him.
content_old: 22 Then kindled the anger of God, because he was going, and the messenger of Yahweh stationed himself in the way､ to withstand him,—as he was riding upon his ass, his two young men being with him.

content: 23 And the ass saw the messenger of Yahweh､ stationed in the road､ with his drawn sword in his hand, so the ass turned aside out of the road､ and went into the field,—and Balaam smote the ass, to make her turn back into the road.
content_old: 23 And the ass saw the messenger of Yahweh､ stationed in the road､ with his drawn sword in his hand, so the ass turned aside out of the road､ and went into the field,—and Balaam smote the ass, to make her turn back into the road.

content: 24 But the messenger of Yahweh took his stand, in a hollow pass of the vineyards,—with a fence on this side､ and a fence on that side.
content_old: 24 But the messenger of Yahweh took his stand, in a hollow pass of the vineyards,—with a fence on this side､ and a fence on that side.

content: 25 And when the ass saw the messenger of Yahweh she squeezed herself against the wall, and squeezed the foot of Balaam､ against the wall,���and again he smote her.
content_old: 25 And when the ass saw the messenger of Yahweh she squeezed herself against the wall, and squeezed the foot of Balaam､ against the wall,���and again he smote her.

content: 26 And the messenger of Yahweh went on further, and took his stand in a narrow place, where there was no way to turn､ to the right hand or to the left.
content_old: 26 And the messenger of Yahweh went on further, and took his stand in a narrow place, where there was no way to turn､ to the right hand or to the left.

content: 27 And when the ass saw the messenger of Yahweh she sank down under Balaam,—then was Balaam’s anger kindled, and he smote the ass with the staff.
content_old: 27 And when the ass saw the messenger of Yahweh she sank down under Balaam,—then was Balaam’s anger kindled, and he smote the ass with the staff.

content: 28 And Yahweh opened the mouth of the ass,—and she said unto Balaam— What have I done to thee, that thou hast smitten me､ these three times?
content_old: 28 And Yahweh opened the mouth of the ass,—and she said unto Balaam— What have I done to thee, that thou hast smitten me､ these three times?

content: 29 And Balaam said unto the ass, Surely thou hast been making sport of me,— Would there had been a sword in my hand, for now would I have slain thee.
content_old: 29 And Balaam said unto the ass, Surely thou hast been making sport of me,— Would there had been a sword in my hand, for now would I have slain thee.

content: 30 Then said the ass unto Balaam— Am not I thine own ass､ on which thou hast ridden all thy life､ until this day? Have I been wont to do unto thee thus? And he said､ Nay!
content_old: 30 Then said the ass unto Balaam— Am not I thine own ass､ on which thou hast ridden all thy life､ until this day? Have I been wont to do unto thee thus? And he said､ Nay!

content: 31 Then did Yahweh unveil the eyes of Balaam, and he saw the messenger of Yahweh stationed in the road, with his sword drawn､ in his hand,—so he bent his head and bowed down before him.
content_old: 31 Then did Yahweh unveil the eyes of Balaam, and he saw the messenger of Yahweh stationed in the road, with his sword drawn､ in his hand,—so he bent his head and bowed down before him.

content: 32 And the messenger of Yahweh said unto him, Wherefore hast thou smitten thine ass, these three times? Lo! I myself am come forth to withstand thee, because headlong was thy way before me.
content_old: 32 And the messenger of Yahweh said unto him, Wherefore hast thou smitten thine ass, these three times? Lo! I myself am come forth to withstand thee, because headlong was thy way before me.

content: 33 And the ass hath seen me, and hath turned aside at my presence､ these three times: Unless she had turned aside from my presence yea now even thee had I slain､ but her had I suffered to live.
content_old: 33 And the ass hath seen me, and hath turned aside at my presence､ these three times: Unless she had turned aside from my presence yea now even thee had I slain､ but her had I suffered to live.

content: 34 Then said Balaam unto the messenger of Yahweh— I have sinned, for I knew not､ that thou wast stationed to meet me in the road,— Now､ therefore､if it be displeasing in thine eyes I must get me back again.
content_old: 34 Then said Balaam unto the messenger of Yahweh— I have sinned, for I knew not､ that thou wast stationed to meet me in the road,— Now､ therefore､if it be displeasing in thine eyes I must get me back again.

content: 35 And the messenger of Yahweh said unto Balaam— Go with the men: Only the word that I shall speak unto thee that shalt thou speak. So Balaam went his way with the princes of Balak.
content_old: 35 And the messenger of Yahweh said unto Balaam— Go with the men: Only the word that I shall speak unto thee that shalt thou speak. So Balaam went his way with the princes of Balak.

content: 36 And Balak heard that Balaam was coming,—so he went forth to meet him､ unto a city of Moab which was upon the boundary of Arnon, which was in the utmost part of the boundary.
content_old: 36 And Balak heard that Balaam was coming,—so he went forth to meet him､ unto a city of Moab which was upon the boundary of Arnon, which was in the utmost part of the boundary.

content: 37 And Balak said unto Balaam: Did I not send unto thee､ to call thee? Wherefore didst thou not come unto me? Am I not in very deed able to honour thee?
content_old: 37 And Balak said unto Balaam: Did I not send unto thee､ to call thee? Wherefore didst thou not come unto me? Am I not in very deed able to honour thee?

content: 38 And Balaam said unto Balak— Lo! I am come unto thee, Now can I possibly promise anything? The word that God shall put in my mouth that must I speak.
content_old: 38 And Balaam said unto Balak— Lo! I am come unto thee, Now can I possibly promise anything? The word that God shall put in my mouth that must I speak.

content: 39 So Balaam went with Balak,—and they entered Kiriath-huzoth.
content_old: 39 So Balaam went with Balak,—and they entered Kiriath-huzoth.

content: 40 And Balak sacrificed herd and flock,—and sent unto Balaam, and unto the princes that were with him.
content_old: 40 And Balak sacrificed herd and flock,—and sent unto Balaam, and unto the princes that were with him.

content: 1 Then said Balaam unto Balak: Build me here､ seven altars,—and prepare me here, seven bullocks and seven rams.
content_old: 1 Then said Balaam unto Balak: Build me here､ seven altars,—and prepare me here, seven bullocks and seven rams.

content: 2 And Balak did as Balaam had spoken,—and Balak and Balaam caused to ascend a bullock and a ram on each altar.
content_old: 2 And Balak did as Balaam had spoken,—and Balak and Balaam caused to ascend a bullock and a ram on each altar.

content: 3 Then said Balaam unto Balak: Station thyself by thine ascending-sacrifice, and let me go my way—peradventure Yahweh may come and meet me, and what thing soever he may shew me I will tell thee. So he went his way to a bare height.
content_old: 3 Then said Balaam unto Balak: Station thyself by thine ascending-sacrifice, and let me go my way—peradventure Yahweh may come and meet me, and what thing soever he may shew me I will tell thee. So he went his way to a bare height.

content: 4 And God came unto Balaam,—so he said unto him— The seven altars have I built in a row, and have caused to ascend､ a bullock and a ram on each altar.
content_old: 4 And God came unto Balaam,—so he said unto him— The seven altars have I built in a row, and have caused to ascend､ a bullock and a ram on each altar.

content: 5 And Yahweh put a word into the mouth of Balaam,—and said— Return unto Balak､ and thus shalt thou speak.
content_old: 5 And Yahweh put a word into the mouth of Balaam,—and said— Return unto Balak､ and thus shalt thou speak.

content: 6 So he returned unto him, and lo! he was stationed by his ascending-sacrifice,—he, and all the princes of Moab.
content_old: 6 So he returned unto him, and lo! he was stationed by his ascending-sacrifice,—he, and all the princes of Moab.

content: 7 So he took up his parable and said,— From Aram doth Balak conduct me､ The king of Moab from the mountains of the East, Come thou! curse me Jacob, Yea､ come thou! rage on Israel.
content_old: 7 So he took up his parable and said,— From Aram doth Balak conduct me､ The king of Moab from the mountains of the East, Come thou! curse me Jacob, Yea､ come thou! rage on Israel.

content: 8 How can I revile one whom GOD hath not reviled? Yea､ how can I rage on one on whom Yahweh hath not raged?
content_old: 8 How can I revile one whom GOD hath not reviled? Yea､ how can I rage on one on whom Yahweh hath not raged?

content: 9 Surely from the head of the rocks do I see him, Yea from the hills do I observe him,— Lo! a people who alone doth dwell, And among the nations he doth not reckon himself.
content_old: 9 Surely from the head of the rocks do I see him, Yea from the hills do I observe him,— Lo! a people who alone doth dwell, And among the nations he doth not reckon himself.

content: 10 Who hath counted the dust of Jacob? Or who hath numbered the fourth part of Israel? Let me die the death of the upright, And let my hereafter be like his!
content_old: 10 Who hath counted the dust of Jacob? Or who hath numbered the fourth part of Israel? Let me die the death of the upright, And let my hereafter be like his!

content: 11 Then said Balak unto Balaam, What hast thou done for me? To revile mine enemies I summoned thee, and lo! thou hast kept on blessing.
content_old: 11 Then said Balak unto Balaam, What hast thou done for me? To revile mine enemies I summoned thee, and lo! thou hast kept on blessing.

content: 12 And he answered and said,— Was it not to be so that whatsoever Yahweh should put into my mouth the same should I take heed to speak?
content_old: 12 And he answered and said,— Was it not to be so that whatsoever Yahweh should put into my mouth the same should I take heed to speak?

content: 13 Then said Balak unto him— Come､ I pray thee､ with me､ unto another places､ from whence thou mayest see him, nothing but his utmost part shalt thou see, but all of him shalt thou not see,—and so revile me him､ from thence.
content_old: 13 Then said Balak unto him— Come､ I pray thee､ with me､ unto another places､ from whence thou mayest see him, nothing but his utmost part shalt thou see, but all of him shalt thou not see,—and so revile me him､ from thence.

content: 14 And he took him to the field of Zophim, unto the head of Pisgah,—and built seven altars, and caused to ascend a bullock and a ram on each altar.
content_old: 14 And he took him to the field of Zophim, unto the head of Pisgah,—and built seven altars, and caused to ascend a bullock and a ram on each altar.

content: 15 Then said he to Balak, Station thyself here､ by thine ascending-sacrifice,—while I meet him yonder.
content_old: 15 Then said he to Balak, Station thyself here､ by thine ascending-sacrifice,—while I meet him yonder.

content: 16 And Yahweh met Balaam, and put a word into his mouth,—and said— Return unto Balak､ and thus shalt thou speak.
content_old: 16 And Yahweh met Balaam, and put a word into his mouth,—and said— Return unto Balak､ and thus shalt thou speak.

content: 17 So he came in unto him､ and there he was—stationed by his ascending-sacrifice, and the princes of Moab､ with him. And Balak said unto him, What hath yahweh spoken?
content_old: 17 So he came in unto him､ and there he was—stationed by his ascending-sacrifice, and the princes of Moab､ with him. And Balak said unto him, What hath yahweh spoken?

content: 18 Then took he up his parable､ and said,— Rise､ Balak､ and hear, Give ear unto me､ son of Zippor!
content_old: 18 Then took he up his parable､ and said,— Rise､ Balak､ and hear, Give ear unto me､ son of Zippor!

content: 19 GOD is not a man､ that he should lie, Nor a son of Adam that he should repent,— Hath he said､ and will not perform? Yea spoken､ and will not make it stand fast?
content_old: 19 GOD is not a man､ that he should lie, Nor a son of Adam that he should repent,— Hath he said､ and will not perform? Yea spoken､ and will not make it stand fast?

content: 20 Lo! to bless have I received command,— And I will bless､ nor will I take it back.
content_old: 20 Lo! to bless have I received command,— And I will bless､ nor will I take it back.

content: 21 He hath not discovered trouble､ in Jacob, Neither hath he seen wretchedness in Israel,— Yahweh､ his God is with him, And the acclaim of a king in his midst:
content_old: 21 He hath not discovered trouble､ in Jacob, Neither hath he seen wretchedness in Israel,— Yahweh､ his God is with him, And the acclaim of a king in his midst:

content: 22 GOD having brought them forth out of Egypt The very horns of the buffalo are his:
content_old: 22 GOD having brought them forth out of Egypt The very horns of the buffalo are his:

content: 23 Surely､ there is no enchantment against Jacob, Nor divination against Israel,— Now shall it be said— Of Jacob､ and of Israel, What hath GOD wrought!
content_old: 23 Surely､ there is no enchantment against Jacob, Nor divination against Israel,— Now shall it be said— Of Jacob､ and of Israel, What hath GOD wrought!

content: 24 Lo a people like a lioness shall rise, And like a strong lion shall rouse himself up; He will not lie down､ till he eat the torn, And the blood of the slain he drink.
content_old: 24 Lo a people like a lioness shall rise, And like a strong lion shall rouse himself up; He will not lie down､ till he eat the torn, And the blood of the slain he drink.

content: 25 Then said Balak unto Balaam, Thou shalt neither revile him,—nor bless him.
content_old: 25 Then said Balak unto Balaam, Thou shalt neither revile him,—nor bless him.

content: 26 And Balaam responded, and said unto Balak,—Spake I not unto thee､ saying, All that Yahweh shall speak that must I do?
content_old: 26 And Balaam responded, and said unto Balak,—Spake I not unto thee､ saying, All that Yahweh shall speak that must I do?

content: 27 And Balak said unto Balaam, Come､ I pray thee! let me take thee unto another place,—peradventure it may be right in the eyes of God that thou revile me him､ from thence.
content_old: 27 And Balak said unto Balaam, Come､ I pray thee! let me take thee unto another place,—peradventure it may be right in the eyes of God that thou revile me him､ from thence.

content: 28 So Balak took Balaam,—unto the head of Peor, that looketh over the face of the Jeshimon.
content_old: 28 So Balak took Balaam,—unto the head of Peor, that looketh over the face of the Jeshimon.

content: 29 And Balaam said unto Balak, Build me here､ seven altars,—and prepare me here, seven bullocks and seven rams.
content_old: 29 And Balaam said unto Balak, Build me here､ seven altars,—and prepare me here, seven bullocks and seven rams.

content: 1 And when Balaam saw that it was good in the eyes of Yahweh､ to bless Israel he went not as at other times､ to invoke enchantments,—but set towards the desert his face.
content_old: 1 And when Balaam saw that it was good in the eyes of Yahweh､ to bless Israel he went not as at other times､ to invoke enchantments,—but set towards the desert his face.

content: 2 So Balaam lifted up his eyes､ and saw Israel, dwelling､ according to his tribes,—then came upon him､ the Spirit of God;
content_old: 2 So Balaam lifted up his eyes､ and saw Israel, dwelling､ according to his tribes,—then came upon him､ the Spirit of God;

content: 3 and he took up his parable､ and said,— The oracle of Balaam､ son of Beor, Yea the oracle of the man､ of opened eye;
content_old: 3 and he took up his parable､ and said,— The oracle of Balaam､ son of Beor, Yea the oracle of the man､ of opened eye;

content: 4 The oracle of one hearing sayings of GOD, Who the sight of the Almighty receiveth in vision, Who､ falleth down､ but hath unveiled eyes:—
content_old: 4 The oracle of one hearing sayings of GOD, Who the sight of the Almighty receiveth in vision, Who､ falleth down､ but hath unveiled eyes:—

content: 5 How pleasing are thy tents､ O Jacob,— Thy habitations､ O Israel:
content_old: 5 How pleasing are thy tents､ O Jacob,— Thy habitations､ O Israel:

content: 6 Like ravines extended, Like gardens by a river,— Like aloe-trees Yahweh hath planted, Like cedars by waters:
content_old: 6 Like ravines extended, Like gardens by a river,— Like aloe-trees Yahweh hath planted, Like cedars by waters:

content: 7 He poureth forth water from his buckets, And his seed is among many waters,— And taller than Agag is his King, And exalted is his kingdom.
content_old: 7 He poureth forth water from his buckets, And his seed is among many waters,— And taller than Agag is his King, And exalted is his kingdom.

content: 8 GOD having brought him forth out of Egypt The very horns of the buffalo are his,— He eateth up nations that assail him､ And the bones of them he breaketh､ And the loins of him he crusheth:
content_old: 8 GOD having brought him forth out of Egypt The very horns of the buffalo are his,— He eateth up nations that assail him､ And the bones of them he breaketh､ And the loins of him he crusheth:

content: 9 He hath knelt—hath lain down､ Like a strong lion, yea like a lioness､ Who shall rouse him up? Such as bless thee are each one blessed, But such as curse thee are each one cursed.
content_old: 9 He hath knelt—hath lain down､ Like a strong lion, yea like a lioness､ Who shall rouse him up? Such as bless thee are each one blessed, But such as curse thee are each one cursed.

content: 10 Then kindled the anger of Balak against Balaam, and､ he smote together his hands,—and Balak said unto Balaam— To revile my foes I called thee, And lo! thou hast kept on blessing, these three times.
content_old: 10 Then kindled the anger of Balak against Balaam, and､ he smote together his hands,—and Balak said unto Balaam— To revile my foes I called thee, And lo! thou hast kept on blessing, these three times.

content: 11 Now therefore､ flee thou unto thy place,— I said, I will highly honour thee; but lo! Yahweh hath kept thee back from honour.
content_old: 11 Now therefore､ flee thou unto thy place,— I said, I will highly honour thee; but lo! Yahweh hath kept thee back from honour.

content: 12 And Balaam said unto Balak,— Was it not so､ that even unto thy messengers whom thou didst send unto me I spake､ saying—
content_old: 12 And Balaam said unto Balak,— Was it not so､ that even unto thy messengers whom thou didst send unto me I spake､ saying—

content: 13 Though Balak would give me his house full of silver and gold yet could I not go beyond the bidding of Yahweh, to do good or ill､ out of my own heart,—what Yahweh shall speak that must I speak?
content_old: 13 Though Balak would give me his house full of silver and gold yet could I not go beyond the bidding of Yahweh, to do good or ill､ out of my own heart,—what Yahweh shall speak that must I speak?

content: 14 Now therefore､ behold me! going to my own people,— Come now! let me advise thee, what this people shall do unto thy people､ in the after-part of the days.
content_old: 14 Now therefore､ behold me! going to my own people,— Come now! let me advise thee, what this people shall do unto thy people､ in the after-part of the days.

content: 15 So he took up his parable､ and said,— The oracle of Balaam, son of Beor, Yea the oracle of the man､ of opened eye;
content_old: 15 So he took up his parable､ and said,— The oracle of Balaam, son of Beor, Yea the oracle of the man､ of opened eye;

content: 16 The oracle of one hearing sayings of GOD, And knowing the knowledge of the Most High,— Who the sight of the Almighty receiveth in vision, Who falleth down､ but hath unveiled eyes:—
content_old: 16 The oracle of one hearing sayings of GOD, And knowing the knowledge of the Most High,— Who the sight of the Almighty receiveth in vision, Who falleth down､ but hath unveiled eyes:—

content: 17 I see One､ who is not now, I observe One､ who is not nigh,— There hath marched forth a Star out of Jacob､ And arisen a Sceptre out of Israel, That hath dishonoured the beard of Moab, Yea the crown of the head of all the tumultuous;
content_old: 17 I see One､ who is not now, I observe One､ who is not nigh,— There hath marched forth a Star out of Jacob､ And arisen a Sceptre out of Israel, That hath dishonoured the beard of Moab, Yea the crown of the head of all the tumultuous;

content: 18 So Edom hath become a possession､ Yea a possession is Seir to his foes,— But Israel is doing valiantly;
content_old: 18 So Edom hath become a possession､ Yea a possession is Seir to his foes,— But Israel is doing valiantly;

content: 19 Yea One wieldeth dominion out of Jacob,— Who hath destroyed the remnant out of the fortress.
content_old: 19 Yea One wieldeth dominion out of Jacob,— Who hath destroyed the remnant out of the fortress.

content: 20 And when he saw Amalek he took up his parable､ and said— The beginning of nations—Amalek, But his latter end is even to perish.
content_old: 20 And when he saw Amalek he took up his parable､ and said— The beginning of nations—Amalek, But his latter end is even to perish.

content: 21 And when he saw the Kenite he took up his parable､ and said,— Enduring thy dwelling-place, Set thou､ then､in the crag thy nest;
content_old: 21 And when he saw the Kenite he took up his parable､ and said,— Enduring thy dwelling-place, Set thou､ then､in the crag thy nest;

content: 22 Yet shall it be for destruction､ O Kain,— How long shall Assyria hold thee captive?
content_old: 22 Yet shall it be for destruction､ O Kain,— How long shall Assyria hold thee captive?

content: 23 And he took up his parable､ and said,— Alas! who shall survive its fulfilment by GOD;
content_old: 23 And he took up his parable､ and said,— Alas! who shall survive its fulfilment by GOD;

content: 24 When ships come from the coast of the isles, And humble Assyria, and humble the Hebrew,— And he too is even to perish?
content_old: 24 When ships come from the coast of the isles, And humble Assyria, and humble the Hebrew,— And he too is even to perish?

content: 1 And Israel remained among the acacias,—and the people began to go away unchastely unto the daughters of Moab;
content_old: 1 And Israel remained among the acacias,—and the people began to go away unchastely unto the daughters of Moab;

content: 2 who invited the people unto the sacrifices of their gods,—so the people did eat, and did bow themselves down unto their gods.
content_old: 2 who invited the people unto the sacrifices of their gods,—so the people did eat, and did bow themselves down unto their gods.

content: 3 Thus Israel let himself be bound unto Baal-peor,—and the anger of Yahweh kindled upon Israel.
content_old: 3 Thus Israel let himself be bound unto Baal-peor,—and the anger of Yahweh kindled upon Israel.

content: 4 And Yahweh said unto Moses— Take all the heads of the people, and crucify them unto Yahweh､ in the face of the sun,—that the heat of the anger of Yahweh may turn away from Israel.
content_old: 4 And Yahweh said unto Moses— Take all the heads of the people, and crucify them unto Yahweh､ in the face of the sun,—that the heat of the anger of Yahweh may turn away from Israel.

content_old: 5 And Moses said unto the judges of Israel,— Slay ye each one his men, who have let themselves be bound unto Baal-peor.

content: 6 And lo! a man of the sons of Israel coming in who brought near unto his brethren a Midianite woman, before the eyes of Moses, and before the eyes of all the assembly of the sons of Israel,—when they were weeping at the entrance of the tent of meeting.
content_old: 6 And lo! a man of the sons of Israel coming in who brought near unto his brethren a Midianite woman, before the eyes of Moses, and before the eyes of all the assembly of the sons of Israel,—when they were weeping at the entrance of the tent of meeting.

content: 7 And Phinehas､ son of Eleazar､ son of Aaron the priest､ saw it,—so he rose up out of the midst of the assembly, and took a spear in his hand;
content_old: 7 And Phinehas､ son of Eleazar､ son of Aaron the priest､ saw it,—so he rose up out of the midst of the assembly, and took a spear in his hand;

content: 8 and went in after the man of Israel､ into the pleasure-tent､ and thrust both of them through, the man of Israel､ and the woman､ in her parts of shame,—so the plague was restrained､ from against the sons of Israel.
content_old: 8 and went in after the man of Israel､ into the pleasure-tent､ and thrust both of them through, the man of Israel､ and the woman､ in her parts of shame,—so the plague was restrained､ from against the sons of Israel.

content: 9 Then was it found that they who had died by the plague were four and twenty thousand.
content_old: 9 Then was it found that they who had died by the plague were four and twenty thousand.

content: 10 Then spake Yahweh unto Moses､ saying:
content_old: 10 Then spake Yahweh unto Moses､ saying:

content: 11 Phinehas､ son of Eleazar､ son of Aaron the priest hath turned back my wrath from against the sons of Israel, in that he was jealous with my jealousy､ in their midst,—so that I made not an end of the sons of Israel､ in my jealousy.
content_old: 11 Phinehas､ son of Eleazar､ son of Aaron the priest hath turned back my wrath from against the sons of Israel, in that he was jealous with my jealousy､ in their midst,—so that I made not an end of the sons of Israel､ in my jealousy.

content: 12 Wherefore say,— Behold me! giving unto him my covenant of peace;
content_old: 12 Wherefore say,— Behold me! giving unto him my covenant of peace;

content: 13 so shall it prove to be unto him､ and unto his seed after him, the covenant of our age-abiding priesthood,—because he was jealous for his God, and did put a propitiatory-covering over the sons of Israel.
content_old: 13 so shall it prove to be unto him､ and unto his seed after him, the covenant of our age-abiding priesthood,—because he was jealous for his God, and did put a propitiatory-covering over the sons of Israel.

content: 15 and the name of the woman who was smitten､ the Midianitess was Cozbi､ daughter of Zur,—the head of his kindred､ of an ancestral house in Midian was he.

content: 17 Besiege the Midianites,—and ye shall smite them:

content: 1 And it came to pass after the plague that Yahweh spake unto Moses, and unto Eleazar､ son of Aaron the priest､ saying:
content_old: 1 And it came to pass after the plague that Yahweh spake unto Moses, and unto Eleazar､ son of Aaron the priest､ saying:

content: 2 Reckon ye up the sum of all the assembly of the sons of Israel､ from twenty years old and upwards､ by their ancestral houses,—every one able to go forth to war､ in Israel.
content_old: 2 Reckon ye up the sum of all the assembly of the sons of Israel､ from twenty years old and upwards､ by their ancestral houses,—every one able to go forth to war､ in Israel.

content_old: 52 Then spake Yahweh unto Moses､ saying:

content_old: 53 Unto these shall be apportioned the land､ as an inheritance､ by the number of names.

content: 54 For the large one thou shalt make large his inheritance, and for the small one thou shalt make small his inheritance,—unto each one､ in proportion to them who were numbered of him shall be given his inheritance.
content_old: 54 For the large one thou shalt make large his inheritance, and for the small one thou shalt make small his inheritance,—unto each one､ in proportion to them who were numbered of him shall be given his inheritance.

content: 55 Nevertheless by lot shall the land be apportioned,—by the names of the tribes of their fathers shall they inherit.
content_old: 55 Nevertheless by lot shall the land be apportioned,—by the names of the tribes of their fathers shall they inherit.

content: 56 At the bidding of the lot shall be apportioned his inheritance,—between large and small.
content_old: 56 At the bidding of the lot shall be apportioned his inheritance,—between large and small.

content_old: 57 And these are they who were numbered of the Levites､ by their families, To Gershon pertained the family of the Gershonites, To Kohath the family of the Kohathites; To Merari the family of the Merarites.

content_old: 61 But Nadab and Abihu died,—when they brought near strange fire before Yahweh:

content: 62 And they who were numbered of them were found to be—twenty-three thousand, all the males､ from one month old and upwards,—for they had not numbered themselves in the midst of the sons of Israel, because there was given unto them no inheritance, in the midst of the sons of Israel.
content_old: 62 And they who were numbered of them were found to be—twenty-three thousand, all the males､ from one month old and upwards,—for they had not numbered themselves in the midst of the sons of Israel, because there was given unto them no inheritance, in the midst of the sons of Israel.
