content: 1 Then came near the daughters of Zelophehad､ son of Hepher､ son of Gilead､ son of Machir､ son of Manasseh､ pertaining to the families of Manasseh､ son of Joseph,—these being the names of his daughters, Mahlah､ Noah､ and Hoglah and Milcah､ and Tirzah.
content_old: 1 Then came near the daughters of Zelophehad､ son of Hepher､ son of Gilead､ son of Machir､ son of Manasseh､ pertaining to the families of Manasseh､ son of Joseph,—these being the names of his daughters, Mahlah､ Noah､ and Hoglah and Milcah､ and Tirzah.

content: 2 So they stood before Moses､ and before Eleazar the priest, and before the princes､ and all the assembly,—at the entrance of the tent of meeting､ saying:
content_old: 2 So they stood before Moses､ and before Eleazar the priest, and before the princes､ and all the assembly,—at the entrance of the tent of meeting､ saying:

content: 3 Our father died in the desert, although he was not among the assembly that conspired against Yahweh､ in the assembly of Korah,—but in his own sin died he; and sons had he none.
content_old: 3 Our father died in the desert, although he was not among the assembly that conspired against Yahweh､ in the assembly of Korah,—but in his own sin died he; and sons had he none.

content: 4 Wherefore should the name of our father be withdrawn､ out of the midst of his family, because he had no son? Give ye unto us a possession, in the midst of the brethren of our father.
content_old: 4 Wherefore should the name of our father be withdrawn､ out of the midst of his family, because he had no son? Give ye unto us a possession, in the midst of the brethren of our father.

content: 5 And Moses brought near their cause､ before Yahweh.
content_old: 5 And Moses brought near their cause､ before Yahweh.

content: 6 Then spake Yahweh unto Moses､ saying:
content_old: 6 Then spake Yahweh unto Moses､ saying:

content: 7 A right thing are the daughters of Zelophehad speaking: Thou shalt surely give them a possession for an inheritance, in the midst of the brethren of their father,—and shalt cause the inheritance of their father to pass over unto them.
content_old: 7 A right thing are the daughters of Zelophehad speaking: Thou shalt surely give them a possession for an inheritance, in the midst of the brethren of their father,—and shalt cause the inheritance of their father to pass over unto them.

content: 8 And unto the sons of Israel shalt thou speak､ saying,— When any man shall die､ having no son then shall ye cause his inheritance to pass over to his daughter.
content_old: 8 And unto the sons of Israel shalt thou speak､ saying,— When any man shall die､ having no son then shall ye cause his inheritance to pass over to his daughter.

content: 9 And if he hath no daughter then shall ye give his inheritance unto his brethren.
content_old: 9 And if he hath no daughter then shall ye give his inheritance unto his brethren.

content: 10 And if he hath no brethren then shall ye give his inheritance unto the brethren of his father.
content_old: 10 And if he hath no brethren then shall ye give his inheritance unto the brethren of his father.

content: 11 And if his father hath no brethren then shall ye give his inheritance unto his blood-relation that is near unto him､ of his family､ and he shall possess it,— So shall it serve the sons of Israel as a regulative statute. As Yahweh commanded Moses.
content_old: 11 And if his father hath no brethren then shall ye give his inheritance unto his blood-relation that is near unto him､ of his family､ and he shall possess it,— So shall it serve the sons of Israel as a regulative statute. As Yahweh commanded Moses.

content: 12 And Yahweh said unto Moses, Go up into this mount of Abarim,—and see the land which I have given unto the sons of Israel;
content_old: 12 And Yahweh said unto Moses, Go up into this mount of Abarim,—and see the land which I have given unto the sons of Israel;

content: 13 And when thou hast seen it then shalt thou also be withdrawn unto thy kinsfolk,—as Aaron thy brother was withdrawn;
content_old: 13 And when thou hast seen it then shalt thou also be withdrawn unto thy kinsfolk,—as Aaron thy brother was withdrawn;

content: 14 because ye resisted my bidding—in the desert of Zin､ when the assembly contended,—that ye should hallow me regarding the waters､ before their eyes,—the same were the waters of Meribah, of Kadesh､ in the desert of Zin.
content_old: 14 because ye resisted my bidding—in the desert of Zin､ when the assembly contended,—that ye should hallow me regarding the waters､ before their eyes,—the same were the waters of Meribah, of Kadesh､ in the desert of Zin.

content: 15 Then spake Moses unto Yahweh､ saying:
content_old: 15 Then spake Moses unto Yahweh､ saying:

content: 16 Let Yahweh､ God of the spirits of all flesh､ appoint a man over the assembly;
content_old: 16 Let Yahweh､ God of the spirits of all flesh､ appoint a man over the assembly;

content: 17 who may go out before them､ and who may come in before them, and who may take them out､ and who may bring them in,—that the assembly of Yahweh become not as sheep that have no shepherd.
content_old: 17 who may go out before them､ and who may come in before them, and who may take them out､ and who may bring them in,—that the assembly of Yahweh become not as sheep that have no shepherd.

content: 18 And Yahweh said unto Moses: Take thee Joshua son of Nun, a man in whom is spirit,—then shalt thou lean thy hand upon him;
content_old: 18 And Yahweh said unto Moses: Take thee Joshua son of Nun, a man in whom is spirit,—then shalt thou lean thy hand upon him;

content: 19 and shalt cause him to stand､ before Eleazar the priest, and before all the assembly,—and shalt charge him､ before their eyes;
content_old: 19 and shalt cause him to stand､ before Eleazar the priest, and before all the assembly,—and shalt charge him､ before their eyes;

content: 20 and shalt put some of thine honour upon him,—that all the assembly of the sons of Israel may hearken.
content_old: 20 and shalt put some of thine honour upon him,—that all the assembly of the sons of Israel may hearken.

content: 21 And before Eleazar the priest shall he stand, and shall ask by him for the decision of the Lights､ before Yahweh,—at the bidding thereof shall they go out､ and at the bidding thereof shall they come in—he､ and all the sons of Israel with him､ even all the assembly.
content_old: 21 And before Eleazar the priest shall he stand, and shall ask by him for the decision of the Lights､ before Yahweh,—at the bidding thereof shall they go out､ and at the bidding thereof shall they come in—he､ and all the sons of Israel with him､ even all the assembly.

content: 22 And Moses did as Yahweh commanded him,—and took Joshua､ and caused him to stand before Eleazar the priest, and before all the assembly;

content: 1 And Yahweh spake unto Moses､ saying:
content_old: 1 And Yahweh spake unto Moses､ saying:

content: 2 Command the sons of Israel, and thou shalt say unto them,— My offering､ my food､ for my altar-flames､ my satisfying odour shall ye take heed to offer unto me､ in its season.
content_old: 2 Command the sons of Israel, and thou shalt say unto them,— My offering､ my food､ for my altar-flames､ my satisfying odour shall ye take heed to offer unto me､ in its season.

content: 3 Therefore shalt thou say to them. This is the altar-flame､ which ye shall offer unto Yahweh,—he-lambs a year old､ without defect､two daily､ as a continual ascending-sacrifice.
content_old: 3 Therefore shalt thou say to them. This is the altar-flame､ which ye shall offer unto Yahweh,—he-lambs a year old､ without defect､two daily､ as a continual ascending-sacrifice.

content: 4 The one lamb shalt thou offer in the morning,—and the other lamb shalt thou offer between the two evenings;
content_old: 4 The one lamb shalt thou offer in the morning,—and the other lamb shalt thou offer between the two evenings;

content: 5 also the tenth of an ephah of fine meal､ for a meal-offering,—overflowed with beaten oil､ the fourth of a hin:
content_old: 5 also the tenth of an ephah of fine meal､ for a meal-offering,—overflowed with beaten oil､ the fourth of a hin:

content: 6 a continual ascending-sacrifice,—which was offered in Mount Sinai, as a satisfying odour､ an altar-flame､ unto Yahweh.
content_old: 6 a continual ascending-sacrifice,—which was offered in Mount Sinai, as a satisfying odour､ an altar-flame､ unto Yahweh.

content: 7 Also the drink-offering thereof､ the fourth of a hin for each lamb,—in a holy place shall it be poured out､ as a libation of strong drink unto Yahweh.

content: 8 And the other lamb shalt thou offer､ between the two evenings; like the meal-offering of the morning､ and like the drink-offering thereof shalt thou offer, an altar flame､ a satisfying odour､ unto Yahweh.

content: 39 These shall ye offer unto Yahweh､ in your appointed seasons,—besides your vow-offerings and your freewill offerings—as your ascending-sacrifices､ and as your meal-offerings, and as your drink-offerings､ and as your peace-offerings.

content: 1 And Moses spake unto the heads of the tribes of the sons of Israel､ saying: This is the thing which Yahweh hath commanded—
content_old: 1 And Moses spake unto the heads of the tribes of the sons of Israel､ saying: This is the thing which Yahweh hath commanded—

content: 2 When a man shall vow a vow unto Yahweh､ or swear an oath to bind a bond upon his soul he shall not break his word,—according to all that proceedeth out of his mouth shall he do.
content_old: 2 When a man shall vow a vow unto Yahweh､ or swear an oath to bind a bond upon his soul he shall not break his word,—according to all that proceedeth out of his mouth shall he do.

content: 3 And when a woman shall vow a vow unto Yahweh,—and bind a bond､ in the house of her father､ in her youth;
content_old: 3 And when a woman shall vow a vow unto Yahweh,—and bind a bond､ in the house of her father､ in her youth;

content: 4 and her father shall hear her vow or her bond which she bindeth upon her soul, and her father shall hold his peace at her then shall all her vows stand, and every bond which she hath bound upon her soul shall stand.
content_old: 4 and her father shall hear her vow or her bond which she bindeth upon her soul, and her father shall hold his peace at her then shall all her vows stand, and every bond which she hath bound upon her soul shall stand.

content: 5 But if her father forbade her､ in the day when he heard none of her vows or her bonds which she hath bound upon her soul shall stand,—and Yahweh will pardon her, because her father forbade her.
content_old: 5 But if her father forbade her､ in the day when he heard none of her vows or her bonds which she hath bound upon her soul shall stand,—and Yahweh will pardon her, because her father forbade her.

content: 6 But if she belonged to a husband, when her vows were taken upon her,—or a rash utterance fell from her lips, wherewith she put a bond upon her soul;
content_old: 6 But if she belonged to a husband, when her vows were taken upon her,—or a rash utterance fell from her lips, wherewith she put a bond upon her soul;

content: 7 and her husband heard it､ and on the day that he heard he held his peace at her then shall her vows stand､ and her bonds which she hath bound upon her soul shall stand.
content_old: 7 and her husband heard it､ and on the day that he heard he held his peace at her then shall her vows stand､ and her bonds which she hath bound upon her soul shall stand.

content: 8 But if on the day her husband heard､ he forbade her then shall he have made of none effect her vow that is upon her, or the rash utterance of her lips､ wherewith she put a bond upon her soul,—and Yahweh will pardon her.
content_old: 8 But if on the day her husband heard､ he forbade her then shall he have made of none effect her vow that is upon her, or the rash utterance of her lips､ wherewith she put a bond upon her soul,—and Yahweh will pardon her.

content: 9 But as for the vow of a widow､ or of a woman divorced whatsoever she hath bound on her soul shall stand against her.
content_old: 9 But as for the vow of a widow､ or of a woman divorced whatsoever she hath bound on her soul shall stand against her.

content: 10 But if in the house of her husband she vowed,—or bound a bond upon her soul､ with an oath;
content_old: 10 But if in the house of her husband she vowed,—or bound a bond upon her soul､ with an oath;

content: 11 and her husband heard､ and held his peace at her, did not forbid her then shall all her vows stand, and every bond which she hath bound upon her soul shall stand.
content_old: 11 and her husband heard､ and held his peace at her, did not forbid her then shall all her vows stand, and every bond which she hath bound upon her soul shall stand.

content: 12 But if her husband did make them of none effect on the day he heard nothing which came forth out of her lips—of her vows､ or of the bond of her soul shall stand,—her husband made it of none effect, and Yahweh will pardon her.
content_old: 12 But if her husband did make them of none effect on the day he heard nothing which came forth out of her lips—of her vows､ or of the bond of her soul shall stand,—her husband made it of none effect, and Yahweh will pardon her.

content: 13 As for any vow､ or any oath of binding､ to humble one’s soul her husband may make it stand､ or her husband may make it of none effect.
content_old: 13 As for any vow､ or any oath of binding､ to humble one’s soul her husband may make it stand､ or her husband may make it of none effect.

content: 14 But if her husband do hold his peace at her､ from day to day then shall he cause all her vows to stand, or all her bonds which are upon her,—cause them to stand because he held his peace at her､ on the day when he heard.
content_old: 14 But if her husband do hold his peace at her､ from day to day then shall he cause all her vows to stand, or all her bonds which are upon her,—cause them to stand because he held his peace at her､ on the day when he heard.

content: 15 And if he do make them of none effect after that he hath heard them then shall he bear her iniquity.
content_old: 15 And if he do make them of none effect after that he hath heard them then shall he bear her iniquity.

content: 1 Then spake Yahweh unto Moses､ saying:
content_old: 1 Then spake Yahweh unto Moses､ saying:

content: 2 Exact thou､ the avenging of the sons of Israel, from the Midianites,—and afterwards shalt thou be withdrawn unto thy kinsfolk.
content_old: 2 Exact thou､ the avenging of the sons of Israel, from the Midianites,—and afterwards shalt thou be withdrawn unto thy kinsfolk.

content: 3 So Moses spake unto the people､ saying, Arm ye from among you men､ for the war,—and let them go against Midian, to render the avenging of Yahweh upon Midian.
content_old: 3 So Moses spake unto the people､ saying, Arm ye from among you men､ for the war,—and let them go against Midian, to render the avenging of Yahweh upon Midian.

content: 4 A thousand from each tribe,—of all the tribes of Israel shall ye send forth unto the war.
content_old: 4 A thousand from each tribe,—of all the tribes of Israel shall ye send forth unto the war.

content: 5 And there volunteered out of the thousands of Israel, a thousand of each tribe,—twelve thousand､ armed for war.
content_old: 5 And there volunteered out of the thousands of Israel, a thousand of each tribe,—twelve thousand､ armed for war.

content: 6 And Moses sent them､ a thousand of each tribe､ to the war,—them､ and Phinehas son of Eleazar the priest to the war, with the vessels of the sanctuary､ and the alarm trumpets､ in his hand.
content_old: 6 And Moses sent them､ a thousand of each tribe､ to the war,—them､ and Phinehas son of Eleazar the priest to the war, with the vessels of the sanctuary､ and the alarm trumpets､ in his hand.

content: 7 So they made war upon Midian, as Yahweh had commanded Moses,—and slew every male:
content_old: 7 So they made war upon Midian, as Yahweh had commanded Moses,—and slew every male:

content: 8 and the kings of Midian slew they besides their other slain—namely, Evi､ and Rekem､ and Zur､ and Hur､ and Reba, five kings of Midian,—Balaam also､ son of Beor slew they with the sword.
content_old: 8 and the kings of Midian slew they besides their other slain—namely, Evi､ and Rekem､ and Zur､ and Hur､ and Reba, five kings of Midian,—Balaam also､ son of Beor slew they with the sword.

content: 9 And the sons of Israel took captive the women of Midian､ and their little ones,—all their cattle also､ and all their flocks､ and all their substance carried they off as a prey;
content_old: 9 And the sons of Israel took captive the women of Midian､ and their little ones,—all their cattle also､ and all their flocks､ and all their substance carried they off as a prey;

content: 10 all their cities also､ in their sites, and all their encampments burned they up with fire.
content_old: 10 all their cities also､ in their sites, and all their encampments burned they up with fire.

content: 11 Then took they all the spoil､ and all the booty,—both of man and beast;
content_old: 11 Then took they all the spoil､ and all the booty,—both of man and beast;

content: 12 and brought in unto Moses､ and unto Eleazar the priest､ and unto the assembly of the sons of Israel—the captives､ and the booty､ and the spoil､ unto the camp,—unto the waste plains of Moab, which are by Jordan, near Jericho.
content_old: 12 and brought in unto Moses､ and unto Eleazar the priest､ and unto the assembly of the sons of Israel—the captives､ and the booty､ and the spoil､ unto the camp,—unto the waste plains of Moab, which are by Jordan, near Jericho.

content: 13 And Moses､ and Eleazar the priest､ and all the princes of the assembly､ went forth to meet them,—unto the outside､ of the camp.
content_old: 13 And Moses､ and Eleazar the priest､ and all the princes of the assembly､ went forth to meet them,—unto the outside､ of the camp.

content: 14 Then was Moses sore displeased with the officers of the force,—the princes of thousands､ and the princes of hundreds, who were coming in from the warring host.
content_old: 14 Then was Moses sore displeased with the officers of the force,—the princes of thousands､ and the princes of hundreds, who were coming in from the warring host.

content: 15 And Moses said unto them,— Have ye saved alive every female?
content_old: 15 And Moses said unto them,— Have ye saved alive every female?

content: 16 Lo! they became unto the sons of Israel､ by the advice of Balaam, the cause of daring acts of treachery against Yahweh, over the affair of Peor,—and then came the plague against the assembly of Yahweh!
content_old: 16 Lo! they became unto the sons of Israel､ by the advice of Balaam, the cause of daring acts of treachery against Yahweh, over the affair of Peor,—and then came the plague against the assembly of Yahweh!

content: 17 Now therefore､ slay ye every male among the young,—every woman also that hath cohabited with man slay ye.
content_old: 17 Now therefore､ slay ye every male among the young,—every woman also that hath cohabited with man slay ye.

content: 18 But all the young of womankind that have not cohabited with man preserve alive for yourselves.
content_old: 18 But all the young of womankind that have not cohabited with man preserve alive for yourselves.

content: 19 Ye then､ pitch outside the camp､ for seven days,—whosoever hath killed a person､ and whoever hath touched the slain cleanse yourselves (from sin) on the third day､ and on the seventh day, ye､ and your captives.
content_old: 19 Ye then､ pitch outside the camp､ for seven days,—whosoever hath killed a person､ and whoever hath touched the slain cleanse yourselves (from sin) on the third day､ and on the seventh day, ye､ and your captives.

content: 20 Every garment also､ and every article of skin､ and every thing made of goat’s-hair､ and every article of wood shall ye cleanse (from sin).
content_old: 20 Every garment also､ and every article of skin､ and every thing made of goat’s-hair､ and every article of wood shall ye cleanse (from sin).

content: 21 Then said Eleazar the priest unto the men of the host, who had been to the war: This is the statute of the law, which Yahweh hath commanded Moses:
content_old: 21 Then said Eleazar the priest unto the men of the host, who had been to the war: This is the statute of the law, which Yahweh hath commanded Moses:

content: 22 Surely the gold､ and the silver,—the bronze､ the iron, the tin and the lead
content_old: 22 Surely the gold､ and the silver,—the bronze､ the iron, the tin and the lead

content: 23 whatsoever thing can go into fire ye shall pass through fire､ and it shall be clean, only with the water of separation shall ye cleanse it (from sin). But whatsoever cannot go into fire ye shall pass through water.
content_old: 23 whatsoever thing can go into fire ye shall pass through fire､ and it shall be clean, only with the water of separation shall ye cleanse it (from sin). But whatsoever cannot go into fire ye shall pass through water.

content: 24 And ye shall wash your clothes､ on the seventh day､ and be clean,—and afterwards shall ye come into the camp.
content_old: 24 And ye shall wash your clothes､ on the seventh day､ and be clean,—and afterwards shall ye come into the camp.

content: 25 Then spake Yahweh unto Moses､ saying:
content_old: 25 Then spake Yahweh unto Moses､ saying:

content: 26 Reckon thou up the sum of the booty that was captured, both of man and of beast,—thou､ and Eleazar the priest, and the ancestral heads of the assembly;
content_old: 26 Reckon thou up the sum of the booty that was captured, both of man and of beast,—thou､ and Eleazar the priest, and the ancestral heads of the assembly;

content: 27 and divide the booty into two parts, between them who took upon them the war, who went out in the host,—and all the rest of the assembly.
content_old: 27 and divide the booty into two parts, between them who took upon them the war, who went out in the host,—and all the rest of the assembly.

content: 28 Then shalt thou levy a tribute unto Yahweh—from the men of war､ who went forth in the host, one living thing､ out of five hundred,—of the human beings､ and of the herd, and of the asses､ and of the flock:
content_old: 28 Then shalt thou levy a tribute unto Yahweh—from the men of war､ who went forth in the host, one living thing､ out of five hundred,—of the human beings､ and of the herd, and of the asses､ and of the flock:

content: 29 out of their half shall ye take them,—and thou shalt give them unto Eleazar the priest､ as a heave-offering unto Yahweh.
content_old: 29 out of their half shall ye take them,—and thou shalt give them unto Eleazar the priest､ as a heave-offering unto Yahweh.

content: 30 And out of the half allotted to the sons of Israel shalt thou take one allotted portion out of fifty, of the human beings､ of the herd､ of the asses and of the flock､ of all the cattle,—and shalt give them unto the Levites, who keep the charge of the habitation of Yahweh.
content_old: 30 And out of the half allotted to the sons of Israel shalt thou take one allotted portion out of fifty, of the human beings､ of the herd､ of the asses and of the flock､ of all the cattle,—and shalt give them unto the Levites, who keep the charge of the habitation of Yahweh.

content: 31 And Moses and Eleazar the priest did,— As Yahweh commanded Moses.
content_old: 31 And Moses and Eleazar the priest did,— As Yahweh commanded Moses.

content: 32 And it came to pass that the booty, over and above the prey which the people of the host had seized was,—of the flock six hundred and seventy-five thousand;
content_old: 32 And it came to pass that the booty, over and above the prey which the people of the host had seized was,—of the flock six hundred and seventy-five thousand;

content: 33 and of the herd seventy-two thousand;
content_old: 33 and of the herd seventy-two thousand;

content: 34 and of the asses sixty-one thousand;
content_old: 34 and of the asses sixty-one thousand;

content: 35 and of the human persons, even of the woman-kind who had not cohabited with man,—all the persons, thirty-two thousand.
content_old: 35 and of the human persons, even of the woman-kind who had not cohabited with man,—all the persons, thirty-two thousand.

content: 36 And the half, the share of them who had gone forth in the host, was,—the number of the flock—three hundred and thirty-seven thousand, and five hundred;
content_old: 36 And the half, the share of them who had gone forth in the host, was,—the number of the flock—three hundred and thirty-seven thousand, and five hundred;

content: 37 and so､the tribute unto Yahweh､ out of the flock was—six hundred and seventy-five;
content_old: 37 and so､the tribute unto Yahweh､ out of the flock was—six hundred and seventy-five;

content: 38 and the herd thirty-six thousand,—and the tribute of them unto Yahweh—seventy-two;
content_old: 38 and the herd thirty-six thousand,—and the tribute of them unto Yahweh—seventy-two;

content: 39 and the asses thirty thousand､ and five hundred,—and the tribute of them unto Yahweh､ sixty-one;
content_old: 39 and the asses thirty thousand､ and five hundred,—and the tribute of them unto Yahweh､ sixty-one;

content: 40 and the human persons sixteen thousand,—and the tribute of them unto Yahweh, thirty-two persons.
content_old: 40 and the human persons sixteen thousand,—and the tribute of them unto Yahweh, thirty-two persons.

content: 41 And Moses gave the tribute—the heave-offering of Yahweh, unto Eleazar the priest,— As Yahweh commanded Moses.
content_old: 41 And Moses gave the tribute—the heave-offering of Yahweh, unto Eleazar the priest,— As Yahweh commanded Moses.

content: 42 And of the half､ allotted unto the sons of Israel,—which Moses halved away from the men who had gone out in the host
content_old: 42 And of the half､ allotted unto the sons of Israel,—which Moses halved away from the men who had gone out in the host

content: 43 the half allotted unto the assembly was—of the flock three hundred and thirty-seven thousand, and five hundred;
content_old: 43 the half allotted unto the assembly was—of the flock three hundred and thirty-seven thousand, and five hundred;

content: 44 and of the herd, six and thirty thousand;
content_old: 44 and of the herd, six and thirty thousand;

content: 45 and of asses thirty thousand and five hundred;
content_old: 45 and of asses thirty thousand and five hundred;

content: 46 and human persons, sixteen thousand.
content_old: 46 and human persons, sixteen thousand.

content: 47 So then Moses took—out of the half belonging to the sons of Israel､ the allotted portion､ one out of fifty､ of the human beings､ and of the beasts,—and gave them unto the Levites, the keepers of the charge of the habitation of Yahweh, As Yahweh commanded Moses.
content_old: 47 So then Moses took—out of the half belonging to the sons of Israel､ the allotted portion､ one out of fifty､ of the human beings､ and of the beasts,—and gave them unto the Levites, the keepers of the charge of the habitation of Yahweh, As Yahweh commanded Moses.

content: 48 Then came near unto Moses, the officers who belonged unto the thousands of the host,—the princes of thousands､ and the princes of hundreds;
content_old: 48 Then came near unto Moses, the officers who belonged unto the thousands of the host,—the princes of thousands､ and the princes of hundreds;

content: 49 and said unto Moses, Thy servants have reckoned up the sum of the men of war who are in our hand,—and there is not missed from among us a man!
content_old: 49 and said unto Moses, Thy servants have reckoned up the sum of the men of war who are in our hand,—and there is not missed from among us a man!

content: 50 Therefore have we brought near an offering unto Yahweh, what each man hath found—articles of gold､ ankle chains and bracelets, rings､ earrings and buckles,—to put a propitiatory-covering over our souls､ before Yahweh.
content_old: 50 Therefore have we brought near an offering unto Yahweh, what each man hath found—articles of gold､ ankle chains and bracelets, rings､ earrings and buckles,—to put a propitiatory-covering over our souls､ before Yahweh.

content: 51 So Moses and Eleazar the priest took the gold､ of them,—all the wrought articles.
content_old: 51 So Moses and Eleazar the priest took the gold､ of them,—all the wrought articles.

content: 52 And all the gold of the heave-offering which they offered up unto Yahweh､ was—sixteen thousand､ seven hundred and fifty shekels,—of the princes of thousands, and of the princes of hundreds.
content_old: 52 And all the gold of the heave-offering which they offered up unto Yahweh､ was—sixteen thousand､ seven hundred and fifty shekels,—of the princes of thousands, and of the princes of hundreds.

content: 53 The men of the host had taken prey､ each man for himself.
content_old: 53 The men of the host had taken prey､ each man for himself.

content: 1 Now much cattle had come into the possession of the sons of Reuben､ and of the sons of Gad､an exceeding mighty number. And when they saw the land of Jazer and the land of Gilead lo! the place was a place for cattle.
content_old: 1 Now much cattle had come into the possession of the sons of Reuben､ and of the sons of Gad､an exceeding mighty number. And when they saw the land of Jazer and the land of Gilead lo! the place was a place for cattle.

content: 2 So the sons of Gad and the sons of Reuben came in,—and spake unto Moses､ and unto Eleazar the priest, and unto the princes of assembly, saying:
content_old: 2 So the sons of Gad and the sons of Reuben came in,—and spake unto Moses､ and unto Eleazar the priest, and unto the princes of assembly, saying:

content: 3 As touching Ataroth and Dibon､ and Jazer and Nimrah, and Heshbon､ and Elealeh,—and Sebam and Nebo､ and Beôn—
content_old: 3 As touching Ataroth and Dibon､ and Jazer and Nimrah, and Heshbon､ and Elealeh,—and Sebam and Nebo､ and Beôn—

content: 4 the land which Yahweh smote before the assembly of Israel a land for cattle it is,—and thy servants have cattle.
content_old: 4 the land which Yahweh smote before the assembly of Israel a land for cattle it is,—and thy servants have cattle.

content: 5 And they said— If we have found favour in thine eyes let this land be given unto thy servants､ for a possession,—do not take us over the Jordan.
content_old: 5 And they said— If we have found favour in thine eyes let this land be given unto thy servants､ for a possession,—do not take us over the Jordan.

content: 6 Then said Moses unto the sons of Gad and unto the sons of Reuben,— Shall your brethren go into the war, and ye settle down here?
content_old: 6 Then said Moses unto the sons of Gad and unto the sons of Reuben,— Shall your brethren go into the war, and ye settle down here?

content: 7 Wherefore､ then､ should ye dissuade the heart of the sons of Israel,—from passing over into the land which Yahweh hath given to them?
content_old: 7 Wherefore､ then､ should ye dissuade the heart of the sons of Israel,—from passing over into the land which Yahweh hath given to them?

content: 8 Thus did your fathers,—when I sent them from Kadesh-barnea､ to view the land,
content_old: 8 Thus did your fathers,—when I sent them from Kadesh-barnea､ to view the land,

content: 9 and they went up as far as the ravine of Eschol､ and viewed the land, and then dissuaded the heart of the sons of Israel from entering into the land, which Yahweh had given them.
content_old: 9 and they went up as far as the ravine of Eschol､ and viewed the land, and then dissuaded the heart of the sons of Israel from entering into the land, which Yahweh had given them.

content: 10 Then was the anger of Yahweh kindled､ on that day,—and he sware, saying:
content_old: 10 Then was the anger of Yahweh kindled､ on that day,—and he sware, saying:

content: 11 Surely none of the men that came up out of Egypt､ from twenty years old and upwards, shall see the soil､ which I sware unto Abraham､ unto Isaac､ and unto Jacob,—because they have not followed after me fully;
content_old: 11 Surely none of the men that came up out of Egypt､ from twenty years old and upwards, shall see the soil､ which I sware unto Abraham､ unto Isaac､ and unto Jacob,—because they have not followed after me fully;

content: 12 save Caleb son of Jephunneh､ the Kenezite, and Joshua､ son of Nun,—for they followed after Yahweh fully.
content_old: 12 save Caleb son of Jephunneh､ the Kenezite, and Joshua､ son of Nun,—for they followed after Yahweh fully.

content: 13 So the anger of Yahweh kindled upon Israel, and he made them wander in the desert, forty years,—until all the generation who had done the evil in the eyes of Yahweh had wasted away.
content_old: 13 So the anger of Yahweh kindled upon Israel, and he made them wander in the desert, forty years,—until all the generation who had done the evil in the eyes of Yahweh had wasted away.

content: 14 Lo! therefore､ ye have arisen in the room of your fathers, a brood of sinful men,—to heap up yet more upon the heat of the anger of Yahweh､ towards Israel.
content_old: 14 Lo! therefore､ ye have arisen in the room of your fathers, a brood of sinful men,—to heap up yet more upon the heat of the anger of Yahweh､ towards Israel.

content: 15 If ye do turn away from following him then will he yet again leave them behind in the desert,—so shall ye bring destruction upon all this people.
content_old: 15 If ye do turn away from following him then will he yet again leave them behind in the desert,—so shall ye bring destruction upon all this people.

content: 16 Then came they near unto him､ and said, Folds for flocks would we build for our cattle here,—and cities for our little ones;
content_old: 16 Then came they near unto him､ and said, Folds for flocks would we build for our cattle here,—and cities for our little ones;

content: 17 but we would arm ourselves promptly､ before the sons of Israel, until that we have brought them into their place,—so should our little ones remain in the fortified cities, because of the inhabitants of the land.
content_old: 17 but we would arm ourselves promptly､ before the sons of Israel, until that we have brought them into their place,—so should our little ones remain in the fortified cities, because of the inhabitants of the land.

content: 18 We would not return unto our houses,—until the sons of Israel have possessed themselves each man of his inheritance.
content_old: 18 We would not return unto our houses,—until the sons of Israel have possessed themselves each man of his inheritance.

content: 19 For we would not inherit with them, over the Jordan､ and onwards,—because our inheritance hath come unto us on this side the Jordan､ towards sunrise.
content_old: 19 For we would not inherit with them, over the Jordan､ and onwards,—because our inheritance hath come unto us on this side the Jordan､ towards sunrise.

content: 20 And Moses said unto them, If ye will indeed do this thing,—if ye will arm yourselves､ before Yahweh､ for the war;
content_old: 20 And Moses said unto them, If ye will indeed do this thing,—if ye will arm yourselves､ before Yahweh､ for the war;

content: 21 and every armed man of you pass over the Jordan before Yahweh,—until he hath dispossessed his enemies､ from before him;
content_old: 21 and every armed man of you pass over the Jordan before Yahweh,—until he hath dispossessed his enemies､ from before him;

content: 22 and the land be subdued before Yahweh then afterwards shall ye return, and shall be acquitted by Yahweh and by Israel,—and this land shall be yours for a possession before Yahweh.
content_old: 22 and the land be subdued before Yahweh then afterwards shall ye return, and shall be acquitted by Yahweh and by Israel,—and this land shall be yours for a possession before Yahweh.

content: 23 But if ye shall not do this lo! ye will have sinned against Yahweh,—and take note of your sin, that it will find you out.
content_old: 23 But if ye shall not do this lo! ye will have sinned against Yahweh,—and take note of your sin, that it will find you out.

content: 24 Build you cities for your little ones, and folds for your flocks,—and then that which hath gone forth from your mouth ye shall do.
content_old: 24 Build you cities for your little ones, and folds for your flocks,—and then that which hath gone forth from your mouth ye shall do.

content: 25 Then spake the sons of Gad､ and the sons of Reuben､ unto Moses, saying,— Thy servants will do, as my lord is giving command.
content_old: 25 Then spake the sons of Gad､ and the sons of Reuben､ unto Moses, saying,— Thy servants will do, as my lord is giving command.

content: 26 Our little ones､ our wives, our cattle､ and all our beasts shall remain there､ in the cities of Gilead;
content_old: 26 Our little ones､ our wives, our cattle､ and all our beasts shall remain there､ in the cities of Gilead;

content: 27 and thy servants will pass over､ every one armed for war､ before Yahweh､ to battle,—as my lord is speaking.
content_old: 27 and thy servants will pass over､ every one armed for war､ before Yahweh､ to battle,—as my lord is speaking.

content: 28 So Moses gave command concerning them, unto Eleazar the priest､ and unto Joshua son of Nun,—and unto the heads of the fathers of the tribes､ of the sons of Israel;
content_old: 28 So Moses gave command concerning them, unto Eleazar the priest､ and unto Joshua son of Nun,—and unto the heads of the fathers of the tribes､ of the sons of Israel;

content: 29 and Moses said unto them— If the sons of Gad and the sons of Reuben will pass with you over the Jordan､ every one armed for the war､ before Yahweh, and the land be subdued before you then shall ye give unto them the land of Gilead､ for a possession.
content_old: 29 and Moses said unto them— If the sons of Gad and the sons of Reuben will pass with you over the Jordan､ every one armed for the war､ before Yahweh, and the land be subdued before you then shall ye give unto them the land of Gilead､ for a possession.

content: 30 But if they will not pass over armed､ with you then shall they accept a possession in your midst､ in the land of Canaan.
content_old: 30 But if they will not pass over armed､ with you then shall they accept a possession in your midst､ in the land of Canaan.

content: 31 Then responded the sons of Gad and the sons of Reuben､ saying,— That which Yahweh had spoken unto thy servants so will we do.
content_old: 31 Then responded the sons of Gad and the sons of Reuben､ saying,— That which Yahweh had spoken unto thy servants so will we do.

content: 32 We will pass over､ armed､ before Yahweh､ into the land of Canaan,—then shall be ours the possession of our inheritance across the Jordan.
content_old: 32 We will pass over､ armed､ before Yahweh､ into the land of Canaan,—then shall be ours the possession of our inheritance across the Jordan.

content: 33 So then Moses gave unto them—even unto the sons of Gad､ and unto the sons of Reuben､ and unto the half tribe of Manasseh son of Joseph—the kingdom of Sihon､ king of the Amorites, and the kingdom of Og､ the king of Bashan､ the land､ by her cities､ with boundaries, even the cities of the land round about.
content_old: 33 So then Moses gave unto them—even unto the sons of Gad､ and unto the sons of Reuben､ and unto the half tribe of Manasseh son of Joseph—the kingdom of Sihon､ king of the Amorites, and the kingdom of Og､ the king of Bashan､ the land､ by her cities､ with boundaries, even the cities of the land round about.

content: 34 And the sons of Gad built Dibôn､ and Ataroth,—and Aroer;
content_old: 34 And the sons of Gad built Dibôn､ and Ataroth,—and Aroer;

content: 35 and Atroth-shophân and Jazer､ and Jogbehah;
content_old: 35 and Atroth-shophân and Jazer､ and Jogbehah;

content: 36 and Beth-nimrah､ and Beth-hârân,—fortified cities､ and folds for flocks.
content_old: 36 and Beth-nimrah､ and Beth-hârân,—fortified cities､ and folds for flocks.

content: 37 And the sons of Reuben built Heshbon､ and Elealeh,—and Kiriathaim,
content_old: 37 And the sons of Reuben built Heshbon､ and Elealeh,—and Kiriathaim,

content: 38 and Nĕbô and Baal-meôn—their names being changed､ and Sibmah,—and they gave names to the cities which they built.
content_old: 38 and Nĕbô and Baal-meôn—their names being changed､ and Sibmah,—and they gave names to the cities which they built.

content: 39 Then went the sons of Machir､ son of Manasseh､ to Gilead, and captured it, and dispossessed the Amorites who were therein.
content_old: 39 Then went the sons of Machir､ son of Manasseh､ to Gilead, and captured it, and dispossessed the Amorites who were therein.

content: 40 So Moses gave Gilead unto Machir､ son of Manasseh,—and he dwelt therein.
content_old: 40 So Moses gave Gilead unto Machir､ son of Manasseh,—and he dwelt therein.

content: 41 And Jair､ son of Manasseh went, and captured their encampments,—and called them Havvoth-jair .
content_old: 41 And Jair､ son of Manasseh went, and captured their encampments,—and called them Havvoth-jair .

content: 1 These are the departures of the sons of Israel､ whereby they came forth out of the land of Egypt､ by their hosts,—in the hand of Moses and Aaron.
content_old: 1 These are the departures of the sons of Israel､ whereby they came forth out of the land of Egypt､ by their hosts,—in the hand of Moses and Aaron.

content: 2 And Moses wrote their comings forth､ by their departures､ at the bidding of Yahweh,—and these are their departures､ by their comings forth.
content_old: 2 And Moses wrote their comings forth､ by their departures､ at the bidding of Yahweh,—and these are their departures､ by their comings forth.

content: 3 So then they brake up from Rameses､ in the first month, on the fifteenth day of the first month,—on the morrow of the passover came forth the sons of Israel､ with an uplifted hand, in the sight of all the Egyptians;
content_old: 3 So then they brake up from Rameses､ in the first month, on the fifteenth day of the first month,—on the morrow of the passover came forth the sons of Israel､ with an uplifted hand, in the sight of all the Egyptians;

content: 4 when the Egyptians were burying them whom Yahweh had smitten among them､ every first-born,—when upon their gods Yahweh had executed judgments.
content_old: 4 when the Egyptians were burying them whom Yahweh had smitten among them､ every first-born,—when upon their gods Yahweh had executed judgments.

content: 5 Thus then the sons of Israel brake up from Rameses,—and encamped in Succoth.
content_old: 5 Thus then the sons of Israel brake up from Rameses,—and encamped in Succoth.

content: 6 And they brake up from Succoth,—and encamped in Etham, which is at the edge of the desert.
content_old: 6 And they brake up from Succoth,—and encamped in Etham, which is at the edge of the desert.

content: 7 And they brake up from Etham, and turned upon Pi-hahiroth, which is over against Baal-zĕphôn,—and encamped before Migdôl.
content_old: 7 And they brake up from Etham, and turned upon Pi-hahiroth, which is over against Baal-zĕphôn,—and encamped before Migdôl.

content: 8 And they brake up from before Hahiroth, and passed through the midst of the sea､ towards the desert,—and went their way a journey of three days､ in the desert of Etham, and encamped in Marah.
content_old: 8 And they brake up from before Hahiroth, and passed through the midst of the sea､ towards the desert,—and went their way a journey of three days､ in the desert of Etham, and encamped in Marah.

content: 9 And they brake up from Marah, and came in towards Elim; there being in Elim twelve fountains of water､ and seventy palm-trees､ so they encamped there.
content_old: 9 And they brake up from Marah, and came in towards Elim; there being in Elim twelve fountains of water､ and seventy palm-trees､ so they encamped there.

content: 10 And they brake up from Elim,—and encamped by the Red Sea.
content_old: 10 And they brake up from Elim,—and encamped by the Red Sea.

content: 11 And they brake up from the Red Sea,—and encamped in the desert of Sîn.
content_old: 11 And they brake up from the Red Sea,—and encamped in the desert of Sîn.

content: 12 And they brake up from the desert of Sîn,—and encamped in Dophkah.
content_old: 12 And they brake up from the desert of Sîn,—and encamped in Dophkah.

content: 13 And they brake up from Dophkah,—and encamped in Alush.
content_old: 13 And they brake up from Dophkah,—and encamped in Alush.

content: 14 And they brake up from Alush,—and encamped in Rephidim, where was no water､ for the people to drink.
content_old: 14 And they brake up from Alush,—and encamped in Rephidim, where was no water､ for the people to drink.

content: 15 And they brake up from Rephidim,—and encamped in the desert of Sinai.
content_old: 15 And they brake up from Rephidim,—and encamped in the desert of Sinai.

content: 16 And they brake up from the desert of Sinai,—and encamped in Kibroth-hattaavah.
content_old: 16 And they brake up from the desert of Sinai,—and encamped in Kibroth-hattaavah.

content: 17 And they brake up from Kibroth-hattaavah,—and encamped in Hazeroth.
content_old: 17 And they brake up from Kibroth-hattaavah,—and encamped in Hazeroth.

content: 18 And they brake up from Hazeroth,—and encamped in Rithmah.
content_old: 18 And they brake up from Hazeroth,—and encamped in Rithmah.

content: 19 And they brake up from Rithmah,—and encamped in Rimmon-perez.
content_old: 19 And they brake up from Rithmah,—and encamped in Rimmon-perez.

content: 20 And they brake up from Rimmon-perez,—and encamped in Libnah.
content_old: 20 And they brake up from Rimmon-perez,—and encamped in Libnah.

content: 21 And they brake up from Libnah,—and encamped in Rissah.
content_old: 21 And they brake up from Libnah,—and encamped in Rissah.

content: 22 And they brake up from Risaah,—and encamped in Kehelathah.
content_old: 22 And they brake up from Risaah,—and encamped in Kehelathah.

content: 23 And they brake up from Kehelathah,—and encamped in Mount Shepher.
content_old: 23 And they brake up from Kehelathah,—and encamped in Mount Shepher.

content: 24 And they brake up from Mount Shepher,—and encamped in Haradah.
content_old: 24 And they brake up from Mount Shepher,—and encamped in Haradah.

content: 25 And they brake up from Haradah,—and encamped in Makheloth.
content_old: 25 And they brake up from Haradah,—and encamped in Makheloth.

content: 26 And they brake up from Makheloth,—and encamped in Tahath.
content_old: 26 And they brake up from Makheloth,—and encamped in Tahath.

content: 27 And they brake up from Tahath,—and encamped in Terah.
content_old: 27 And they brake up from Tahath,—and encamped in Terah.

content: 28 And they brake up from Terah,—and encamped in Mithkah.
content_old: 28 And they brake up from Terah,—and encamped in Mithkah.

content: 29 And they brake up from Mithkah,—and encamped in Hashmonah.
content_old: 29 And they brake up from Mithkah,—and encamped in Hashmonah.

content: 30 And they brake up from Hashmonah,—and encamped in Moseroth.
content_old: 30 And they brake up from Hashmonah,—and encamped in Moseroth.

content: 31 And they brake up from Moseroth,—and encamped in Bene-jaakan.
content_old: 31 And they brake up from Moseroth,—and encamped in Bene-jaakan.

content: 32 And they brake up from Bene-jaakan, and encamped in Hor-haggidgad.
content_old: 32 And they brake up from Bene-jaakan, and encamped in Hor-haggidgad.

content: 33 And they brake up from Hor-haggidgad,—and encamped in Jotbathah.
content_old: 33 And they brake up from Hor-haggidgad,—and encamped in Jotbathah.

content: 34 And they brake up from Jotbathah,—and encamped in Abronah.
content_old: 34 And they brake up from Jotbathah,—and encamped in Abronah.

content: 35 And they brake up from Abronah,—and encamped in Eziongeber.
content_old: 35 And they brake up from Abronah,—and encamped in Eziongeber.

content: 36 And they brake up from Eziongeber,—and encamped in the desert of Zin､ the same is Kadesh.
content_old: 36 And they brake up from Eziongeber,—and encamped in the desert of Zin､ the same is Kadesh.

content: 37 And they brake up from Kadesh,—and encamped in Mount Hor, on the outskirts of the land of Edom;
content_old: 37 And they brake up from Kadesh,—and encamped in Mount Hor, on the outskirts of the land of Edom;

content: 38 and Aaron the priest went up into Mount Hor, at the bidding of Yahweh､ and died there,—in the fortieth year､ by the coming forth of the sons of Israel out of the land of Egypt, in the fifth month､ on the first of the month.
content_old: 38 and Aaron the priest went up into Mount Hor, at the bidding of Yahweh､ and died there,—in the fortieth year､ by the coming forth of the sons of Israel out of the land of Egypt, in the fifth month､ on the first of the month.

content: 39 Now Aaron was a hundred and twenty-three years old､ when he died in Mount Hor.
content_old: 39 Now Aaron was a hundred and twenty-three years old､ when he died in Mount Hor.

content: 40 And a Canaanite､ king of Arad, who was dwelling in the South､ in the land of Canaan, heard of the coming in of the sons of Israel.
content_old: 40 And a Canaanite､ king of Arad, who was dwelling in the South､ in the land of Canaan, heard of the coming in of the sons of Israel.

content: 41 And they brake up from Mount Hor,—and encamped in Zalmonah.
content_old: 41 And they brake up from Mount Hor,—and encamped in Zalmonah.

content: 42 And they brake up from Zalmonah,—and encamped in Punon.
content_old: 42 And they brake up from Zalmonah,—and encamped in Punon.

content: 43 And they brake up from Punon,—and encamped in Oboth.
content_old: 43 And they brake up from Punon,—and encamped in Oboth.

content: 44 And they brake up from Oboth,—and encamped in Iye-abarim, within the bounds of Moab.
content_old: 44 And they brake up from Oboth,—and encamped in Iye-abarim, within the bounds of Moab.

content: 45 And they brake up from Iyim,—and encamped in Dibon-gad.
content_old: 45 And they brake up from Iyim,—and encamped in Dibon-gad.

content: 46 And they brake up from Dibon-gad,—and encamped in Almon-diblathaim.
content_old: 46 And they brake up from Dibon-gad,—and encamped in Almon-diblathaim.

content: 47 And they brake up from Almon-diblathaim,—and encamped among the mountains of Abarim, before Nebo.
content_old: 47 And they brake up from Almon-diblathaim,—and encamped among the mountains of Abarim, before Nebo.

content: 48 And they brake up from the mountains of Abarim,—and encamped in the waste plains of Moab, by Jordan near Jericho.
content_old: 48 And they brake up from the mountains of Abarim,—and encamped in the waste plains of Moab, by Jordan near Jericho.

content: 49 Thus did they encamp by the Jordan､ from Beth-jeshimoth unto Abel-Shittim that is, “The acacia-meadows”,—in the waste plains of Moab.
content_old: 49 Thus did they encamp by the Jordan､ from Beth-jeshimoth unto Abel-Shittim that is, “The acacia-meadows”,—in the waste plains of Moab.

content: 50 And Yahweh spake unto Moses､ in the waste plains of Moab,—by Jordan near Jericho､ saying:
content_old: 50 And Yahweh spake unto Moses､ in the waste plains of Moab,—by Jordan near Jericho､ saying:

content: 51 Speak unto the sons of Israel, and thou shalt say unto them,— When ye do pass over the Jordan､ into the land of Canaan
content_old: 51 Speak unto the sons of Israel, and thou shalt say unto them,— When ye do pass over the Jordan､ into the land of Canaan

content: 52 then shall ye dispossess all the inhabitants of the land､ from before you, and shall destroy all their figured stones,—all their molten images also shall ye destroy, and all their high places shall ye lay waste.
content_old: 52 then shall ye dispossess all the inhabitants of the land､ from before you, and shall destroy all their figured stones,—all their molten images also shall ye destroy, and all their high places shall ye lay waste.

content: 53 So shall ye possess the land､ and settle down therein,—for unto you have I given the land､ to possess it.
content_old: 53 So shall ye possess the land､ and settle down therein,—for unto you have I given the land､ to possess it.

content: 54 And ye shall take your inheritance in the land by lot､ by your families—for the large one ye shall make large his inheritance､ and for the small one make small his inheritance､ whithersoever the lot cometh out to him his shall it be,—by the tribes of your fathers shall ye take your inheritance.
content_old: 54 And ye shall take your inheritance in the land by lot､ by your families—for the large one ye shall make large his inheritance､ and for the small one make small his inheritance､ whithersoever the lot cometh out to him his shall it be,—by the tribes of your fathers shall ye take your inheritance.

content: 55 But if ye do not dispossess the inhabitants of the land from before you then shall it be､ that they whom ye leave remaining of them will become pricks in your eyes, and thorns in your sides,—and will harass you, concerning the land, wherein ye are settling down.
content_old: 55 But if ye do not dispossess the inhabitants of the land from before you then shall it be､ that they whom ye leave remaining of them will become pricks in your eyes, and thorns in your sides,—and will harass you, concerning the land, wherein ye are settling down.

content: 1 And Yahweh spake unto Moses､ saying:
content_old: 1 And Yahweh spake unto Moses､ saying:

content: 2 Command the sons of Israel､ and thou shalt say unto them, When ye are coming into the land of Canaan this is the land which shall fall unto you､ as an inheritance, even the land of Canaan､ by the boundaries thereof.
content_old: 2 Command the sons of Israel､ and thou shalt say unto them, When ye are coming into the land of Canaan this is the land which shall fall unto you､ as an inheritance, even the land of Canaan､ by the boundaries thereof.

content: 3 Ye shall therefore have a south corner､ from the desert of Zin､ on the side of Edom,—so shall ye have a south boundary, from the end of the salt sea､ eastward;
content_old: 3 Ye shall therefore have a south corner､ from the desert of Zin､ on the side of Edom,—so shall ye have a south boundary, from the end of the salt sea､ eastward;

content: 4 and the boundary shall go round for you from the south towards the cliffs of Akrabbim, then cross over towards Zin, and the extension thereof shall be from the south to Kadeshbarnea,—then shall it reach out to Hazaraddar､ and cross over towards Azmon;
content_old: 4 and the boundary shall go round for you from the south towards the cliffs of Akrabbim, then cross over towards Zin, and the extension thereof shall be from the south to Kadeshbarnea,—then shall it reach out to Hazaraddar､ and cross over towards Azmon;

content: 5 then shall the boundary turn round from Azmon towards the ravine of Egypt,—and the extension thereof shall be towards the sea.
content_old: 5 then shall the boundary turn round from Azmon towards the ravine of Egypt,—and the extension thereof shall be towards the sea.

content: 6 And for a west boundary—ye shall have the great sea､ even a boundary,—this shall serve you as a west boundary.
content_old: 6 And for a west boundary—ye shall have the great sea､ even a boundary,—this shall serve you as a west boundary.

content: 7 And this shall serve you as a north boundary,—From the great sea ye shall draw a line for you､ to Mount Hor:
content_old: 7 And this shall serve you as a north boundary,—From the great sea ye shall draw a line for you､ to Mount Hor:

content: 8 From Mount Hor ye shall draw a line to the entering in of Hamath,—and the extension of the boundary shall be towards Zedad;
content_old: 8 From Mount Hor ye shall draw a line to the entering in of Hamath,—and the extension of the boundary shall be towards Zedad;

content: 9 then shall the boundary reach out towards Ziphron, and the extension thereof､ be to Hazar-enân. This shall serve you as a north boundary.
content_old: 9 then shall the boundary reach out towards Ziphron, and the extension thereof､ be to Hazar-enân. This shall serve you as a north boundary.

content: 10 Then shall ye draw for yourselves a line､ for an east boundary,—from Hazar-enân towards Shephâm;
content_old: 10 Then shall ye draw for yourselves a line､ for an east boundary,—from Hazar-enân towards Shephâm;

content: 11 and the boundary shall go down from Shephâm towards Riblah､ on the east of Ain,—then shall the boundary go down､ and strike on the side of the Sea of Chinnereth､ eastward;
content_old: 11 and the boundary shall go down from Shephâm towards Riblah､ on the east of Ain,—then shall the boundary go down､ and strike on the side of the Sea of Chinnereth､ eastward;

content: 12 then shall the boundary go down towards the Jordan, and the extension thereof be to the salt sea. This shall be your land､ by the boundaries thereof､ round about.
content_old: 12 then shall the boundary go down towards the Jordan, and the extension thereof be to the salt sea. This shall be your land､ by the boundaries thereof､ round about.

content: 13 And Moses commanded the sons of Israel､ saying,— This is the land､ which ye shall inherit by lot, which Yahweh had commanded to be given to the nine tribes､ and the half tribe.
content_old: 13 And Moses commanded the sons of Israel､ saying,— This is the land､ which ye shall inherit by lot, which Yahweh had commanded to be given to the nine tribes､ and the half tribe.

content: 14 For the tribe of the sons of the Reubenites､ by their ancestral house, and the tribe of the sons of Gad､ by their ancestral house, have received,—and the half tribe of Manasseh have received､ their inheritance:
content_old: 14 For the tribe of the sons of the Reubenites､ by their ancestral house, and the tribe of the sons of Gad､ by their ancestral house, have received,—and the half tribe of Manasseh have received､ their inheritance:

content: 15 the two tribes､ and the half tribe have received their inheritance—on this side Jordan near Jericho､ eastwards, towards sunrise.
content_old: 15 the two tribes､ and the half tribe have received their inheritance—on this side Jordan near Jericho､ eastwards, towards sunrise.

content: 16 Then spake Yahweh unto Moses､ saying:
content_old: 16 Then spake Yahweh unto Moses､ saying:

content: 17 These are the names of the men who shall receive for you the land､ as an inheritance,—Eleazar､ the priest, and Joshua､ son of Nun.
content_old: 17 These are the names of the men who shall receive for you the land､ as an inheritance,—Eleazar､ the priest, and Joshua､ son of Nun.

content: 18 Also one prince from each tribe shall ye take to receive the land as an inheritance.
content_old: 18 Also one prince from each tribe shall ye take to receive the land as an inheritance.

content: 19 These therefore､ are the names of the men,— For the tribe of Judah Caleb､ son of Jephunneh;
content_old: 19 These therefore､ are the names of the men,— For the tribe of Judah Caleb､ son of Jephunneh;

content: 20 And for the tribe of the sons of Simeon Shemuel､ son of Ammihud:
content_old: 20 And for the tribe of the sons of Simeon Shemuel､ son of Ammihud:

content: 21 For the tribe of Benjamin Elidad､ son of Chislon;
content_old: 21 For the tribe of Benjamin Elidad､ son of Chislon;

content: 22 And for the tribe of the sons of Dan a prince—Bukki､ son of Jogli:
content_old: 22 And for the tribe of the sons of Dan a prince—Bukki､ son of Jogli:

content: 23 For the sons of Joseph For the tribe of the sons of Manasseh a prince,—Hanniel､ son of Ephod;
content_old: 23 For the sons of Joseph For the tribe of the sons of Manasseh a prince,—Hanniel､ son of Ephod;

content: 24 And for the tribe of the sons of Ephraim a prince,—Kemuel､ son of Shiphtân;
content_old: 24 And for the tribe of the sons of Ephraim a prince,—Kemuel､ son of Shiphtân;

content: 25 And for the tribe of the sons of Zebulun a prince,—Elizaphân､ son of Parnach;
content_old: 25 And for the tribe of the sons of Zebulun a prince,—Elizaphân､ son of Parnach;

content: 26 And for the tribe of the sons of Issachar a prince,—Paltiel､ son of Azzân;
content_old: 26 And for the tribe of the sons of Issachar a prince,—Paltiel､ son of Azzân;

content: 27 And for the tribe of the sons of Asher a prince,—Ahihud､ son of Shelomi;
content_old: 27 And for the tribe of the sons of Asher a prince,—Ahihud､ son of Shelomi;

content: 28 And for the tribe of the sons of Naphtali a prince,—Pedahel､ son of Ammihud.
content_old: 28 And for the tribe of the sons of Naphtali a prince,—Pedahel､ son of Ammihud.

content: 1 And Yahweh spake unto Moses in the waste plains of Moab,—by Jordan, near Jericho､ saying:
content_old: 1 And Yahweh spake unto Moses in the waste plains of Moab,—by Jordan, near Jericho､ saying:

content: 2 Command the sons of Israel, that they give unto the Levites—out of the inheritance which they possess—cities to dwell in,—pasture land also unto the cities､ round about them shall ye give unto the Levites.
content_old: 2 Command the sons of Israel, that they give unto the Levites—out of the inheritance which they possess—cities to dwell in,—pasture land also unto the cities､ round about them shall ye give unto the Levites.

content: 3 So shall the cities be theirs､ to dwell in,—and their pasture lands shall be for their cattle and for their goods､ and for all their beasts.
content_old: 3 So shall the cities be theirs､ to dwell in,—and their pasture lands shall be for their cattle and for their goods､ and for all their beasts.

content: 4 And the pasture lands of the cities which ye shall give unto the Levites shall be,—from the wall of the city､ and outwards, a thousand cubits､ round about
content_old: 4 And the pasture lands of the cities which ye shall give unto the Levites shall be,—from the wall of the city､ and outwards, a thousand cubits､ round about

content: 5 So ye shall measure—on the outside of the city—the eastward quarter two thousand by the cubit､ and the south quarter two thousand by the cubit､ and the west quarter two thousand by the cubit､ and the north quarter two thousand by the cubit､ with the city in the midst. This shall be unto them the pasture lands of the cities.
content_old: 5 So ye shall measure—on the outside of the city—the eastward quarter two thousand by the cubit､ and the south quarter two thousand by the cubit､ and the west quarter two thousand by the cubit､ and the north quarter two thousand by the cubit､ with the city in the midst. This shall be unto them the pasture lands of the cities.

content: 6 And among the cities which ye shall give unto the Levites shall be the six cities of refuge, which ye shall give that the manslayer may flee thither,—and besides them ye shall give､ forty-two cities.
content_old: 6 And among the cities which ye shall give unto the Levites shall be the six cities of refuge, which ye shall give that the manslayer may flee thither,—and besides them ye shall give､ forty-two cities.

content: 7 All the cities which ye shall give unto the Levites shall be forty-eight cities,—them､ and their pasture lands.
content_old: 7 All the cities which ye shall give unto the Levites shall be forty-eight cities,—them､ and their pasture lands.

content: 8 And as touching the cities which ye shall give out of the possession of the sons of Israel from the many shall ye take many, and from the few shall ye take few,—each､ according to his inheritance､ which they shall inherit shall give of his cities､ unto the Levites.
content_old: 8 And as touching the cities which ye shall give out of the possession of the sons of Israel from the many shall ye take many, and from the few shall ye take few,—each､ according to his inheritance､ which they shall inherit shall give of his cities､ unto the Levites.

content: 9 Then spake Yahweh unto Moses, saying:
content_old: 9 Then spake Yahweh unto Moses, saying:

content: 10 Speak unto the sons of Israel, and thou shalt say unto them,— When ye are passing over the Jordan､ unto the land of Canaan
content_old: 10 Speak unto the sons of Israel, and thou shalt say unto them,— When ye are passing over the Jordan､ unto the land of Canaan

content: 11 then shall ye find for you､ convenient cities, cities of refuge shall they be unto you,—and the manslayer, who hath slain a person by mistake､ shall flee thither.
content_old: 11 then shall ye find for you､ convenient cities, cities of refuge shall they be unto you,—and the manslayer, who hath slain a person by mistake､ shall flee thither.

content: 12 So shall the cities serve you for places of refuge from the redeemer,—that the manslayer may not die, until he has stood before the assembly､ for judgment.
content_old: 12 So shall the cities serve you for places of refuge from the redeemer,—that the manslayer may not die, until he has stood before the assembly､ for judgment.

content: 13 And as touching the cities which ye shall give six cities of refuge shall there be unto you.
content_old: 13 And as touching the cities which ye shall give six cities of refuge shall there be unto you.

content: 14 Three of the cities shall ye give､ on this side the Jordan, and three of the cities shall ye give in the land of Canaan,—cities of refuge shall they be.
content_old: 14 Three of the cities shall ye give､ on this side the Jordan, and three of the cities shall ye give in the land of Canaan,—cities of refuge shall they be.

content: 15 For the sons of Israel､ and for the sojourner､ and for the settler in your midst shall these six cities serve､ as places of refuge,—that any one may flee thither who hath slain a person､ by mistake.
content_old: 15 For the sons of Israel､ and for the sojourner､ and for the settler in your midst shall these six cities serve､ as places of refuge,—that any one may flee thither who hath slain a person､ by mistake.

content: 16 If､ then､ with an instrument of iron he smote him､ and he died a manslayer he is,—a manslayer shall surely die.
content_old: 16 If､ then､ with an instrument of iron he smote him､ and he died a manslayer he is,—a manslayer shall surely die.

content: 17 Or if with a stone thrown by hand, whereby one might die he smote him､ and he died a manslayer he is,—the manslayer shall surely die.
content_old: 17 Or if with a stone thrown by hand, whereby one might die he smote him､ and he died a manslayer he is,—the manslayer shall surely die.

content: 18 Or if with hand-weapon of wood, wherewith one might die he smote him､ and he died a manslayer he is,—the manslayer shall surely die.
content_old: 18 Or if with hand-weapon of wood, wherewith one might die he smote him､ and he died a manslayer he is,—the manslayer shall surely die.

content: 19 The blood-redeemer he shall put to death the manslayer,—when he lighteth upon him he shall put him to death.
content_old: 19 The blood-redeemer he shall put to death the manslayer,—when he lighteth upon him he shall put him to death.

content: 20 Or if with hate he shall thrust at him, or hurl at him designedly､ and he have died
content_old: 20 Or if with hate he shall thrust at him, or hurl at him designedly､ and he have died

content: 21 or if with enmity he hath smitten him with his hand､ and he is dead then shall he that dealt the blow be surely put to death､ a manslayer he is,—the blood-redeemer shall put to death the manslayer when he lighteth upon him.
content_old: 21 or if with enmity he hath smitten him with his hand､ and he is dead then shall he that dealt the blow be surely put to death､ a manslayer he is,—the blood-redeemer shall put to death the manslayer when he lighteth upon him.

content: 22 But if suddenly､ without enmity he shall thrust him, or hurl upon him any missile､ without design;
content_old: 22 But if suddenly､ without enmity he shall thrust him, or hurl upon him any missile､ without design;

content: 23 or with any stone whereby one might die､ without seeing him, and it fall upon him, and he dieth; he not being at enmity with him, nor seeking to harm him
content_old: 23 or with any stone whereby one might die､ without seeing him, and it fall upon him, and he dieth; he not being at enmity with him, nor seeking to harm him

content: 24 then shall the assembly judge, between him that smote and the blood-redeemer,—according to these regulations;
content_old: 24 then shall the assembly judge, between him that smote and the blood-redeemer,—according to these regulations;

content: 25 and the assembly shall rescue the manslayer out of the hand of the blood-redeemer, and the assembly shall restore him unto his city of refuge､ whither he had fled,���and he shall dwell therein, until the death of the high priest, who hath been anointed with the hallowing oil.
content_old: 25 and the assembly shall rescue the manslayer out of the hand of the blood-redeemer, and the assembly shall restore him unto his city of refuge､ whither he had fled,���and he shall dwell therein, until the death of the high priest, who hath been anointed with the hallowing oil.

content: 26 But if the manslayer go out of the bounds of his city of refuge, whereinto he hath fled;
content_old: 26 But if the manslayer go out of the bounds of his city of refuge, whereinto he hath fled;

content: 27 and the blood-redeemer find him, outside the bounds of his city of refuge then may the blood-redeemer slay the slayer, without being guilty of blood;
content_old: 27 and the blood-redeemer find him, outside the bounds of his city of refuge then may the blood-redeemer slay the slayer, without being guilty of blood;

content: 28 for in his city of refuge should he have remained, until the death of the high priest,—and after the death of the high priest might he have returned into the land which he doth possess.
content_old: 28 for in his city of refuge should he have remained, until the death of the high priest,—and after the death of the high priest might he have returned into the land which he doth possess.

content: 29 So shall these serve you as a regulative statute unto your generations,—wheresoever ye may dwell.
content_old: 29 So shall these serve you as a regulative statute unto your generations,—wheresoever ye may dwell.

content: 30 Whosoever taketh away life at the mouth of witnesses shall the slayer be slain,—but one witness shall not testify against a person､ to put him to death.
content_old: 30 Whosoever taketh away life at the mouth of witnesses shall the slayer be slain,—but one witness shall not testify against a person､ to put him to death.

content: 31 And ye shall accept no ransom for the life of him that slayeth, if he have unlawfully caused death,—but he must surely be put to death.
content_old: 31 And ye shall accept no ransom for the life of him that slayeth, if he have unlawfully caused death,—but he must surely be put to death.

content: 32 And ye shall accept no ransom for him that hath fled to his city of refuge, if he should return to dwell in the land before the death of the priest.
content_old: 32 And ye shall accept no ransom for him that hath fled to his city of refuge, if he should return to dwell in the land before the death of the priest.

content: 33 So shall ye not pollute the land wherein ye are, for blood doth pollute the land,—and for the land no propitiatory-covering can be made､ as touching blood､ that is shed therein, save with the blood of him that shed it;
content_old: 33 So shall ye not pollute the land wherein ye are, for blood doth pollute the land,—and for the land no propitiatory-covering can be made､ as touching blood､ that is shed therein, save with the blood of him that shed it;

content: 1 Then came near the heads of fathers､ belonging to the family of the sons of Gilead､ son of Machir､ son of Manasseh, out of the families of the sons of Joseph,—and spake before Moses, and before the princes, heads of fathers､ belonging to the sons of Israel;
content_old: 1 Then came near the heads of fathers､ belonging to the family of the sons of Gilead､ son of Machir､ son of Manasseh, out of the families of the sons of Joseph,—and spake before Moses, and before the princes, heads of fathers､ belonging to the sons of Israel;

content: 2 and they said— Unto my lord did Yahweh give command, to bestow the land as an inheritance､ by lot､ unto the sons of Israel,—my lord therefore､ was commanded by Yahweh, to give the inheritance of Zelophehad our brother､ unto his daughters.
content_old: 2 and they said— Unto my lord did Yahweh give command, to bestow the land as an inheritance､ by lot､ unto the sons of Israel,—my lord therefore､ was commanded by Yahweh, to give the inheritance of Zelophehad our brother､ unto his daughters.

content: 3 When､ therefore､ unto any one from among the sons of the other tribes of the sons of Israel they become wives their inheritance shall disappear out of the inheritance of our fathers, and be added to the inheritance of the tribe to which they shall be received,—and so out of the lot of our inheritance shall it disappear.
content_old: 3 When､ therefore､ unto any one from among the sons of the other tribes of the sons of Israel they become wives their inheritance shall disappear out of the inheritance of our fathers, and be added to the inheritance of the tribe to which they shall be received,—and so out of the lot of our inheritance shall it disappear.

content: 4 And when the jubilee shall come to the sons of Israel then shall their inheritance be added unto the inheritance of the tribe to which they shall be received､—and out of the inheritance of the tribe of our fathers shall their inheritance disappear.
content_old: 4 And when the jubilee shall come to the sons of Israel then shall their inheritance be added unto the inheritance of the tribe to which they shall be received､—and out of the inheritance of the tribe of our fathers shall their inheritance disappear.

content: 5 Then Moses commanded the sons of Israel, at the bidding of Yahweh､ saying,— A right thing are the tribe of the sons of Joseph speaking.
content_old: 5 Then Moses commanded the sons of Israel, at the bidding of Yahweh､ saying,— A right thing are the tribe of the sons of Joseph speaking.

content: 6 This is the thing which Yahweh hath commanded, as to the daughters of Zelophehad､ saying: Unto whomsoever it may be good in their eyes let them become wives,—save only unto the family of the tribe of their father let them become wives.
content_old: 6 This is the thing which Yahweh hath commanded, as to the daughters of Zelophehad､ saying: Unto whomsoever it may be good in their eyes let them become wives,—save only unto the family of the tribe of their father let them become wives.

content: 7 So shall no inheritance belonging to the sons of Israel go round from tribe to tribe,—for the sons of Israel shall each one cleave unto the inheritance of the tribe of his fathers.
content_old: 7 So shall no inheritance belonging to the sons of Israel go round from tribe to tribe,—for the sons of Israel shall each one cleave unto the inheritance of the tribe of his fathers.

content: 8 And every daughter possessing an inheritance､ from among the tribes of the sons of Israel unto one of the family of the tribe of her father shall become wife,—to the intent that the sons of Israel may possess､ each one the inheritance of his fathers;
content_old: 8 And every daughter possessing an inheritance､ from among the tribes of the sons of Israel unto one of the family of the tribe of her father shall become wife,—to the intent that the sons of Israel may possess､ each one the inheritance of his fathers;

content: 9 and no inheritance go round from one tribe to another tribe,—for the tribes of the sons of Israel shall cleave each one unto his own inheritance.
content_old: 9 and no inheritance go round from one tribe to another tribe,—for the tribes of the sons of Israel shall cleave each one unto his own inheritance.

content: 10 As Yahweh commanded Moses so did the daughters of Zelophehad.
content_old: 10 As Yahweh commanded Moses so did the daughters of Zelophehad.

content: 11 Thus then did Mahlah､ Tirzah､ and Hoglah､ and Milchah､ and Noah､ the daughters of Zelophehad, become wives unto the sons of their father’s brethren.
content_old: 11 Thus then did Mahlah､ Tirzah､ and Hoglah､ and Milchah､ and Noah､ the daughters of Zelophehad, become wives unto the sons of their father’s brethren.

content: 12 Unto men from among the families of the sons of Manasseh､ son of Joseph became they wives,—and so their inheritance remained with the tribe of the family of their father.
content_old: 12 Unto men from among the families of the sons of Manasseh､ son of Joseph became they wives,—and so their inheritance remained with the tribe of the family of their father.
